Remarks Deaths American Personnel Benghazi, Libya September 12, 2012 Yesterday, U.S. diplomatic post Benghazi, Libya attacked. Heavily armed militants assaulted compound set fire buildings. American Libyan security personnel battled attackers together. Four Americans killed. They included Sean Smith, Foreign Service information management officer, Ambassador Libya Chris Stevens. We still making next kin notifications two individuals. This attack shock conscience people faiths around world. We condemn strongest terms senseless act violence, send prayers families, friends, colleagues we've lost. All world, every day, America's diplomats development experts risk lives service country values, believe United States must force peace progress world, aspirations worth striving sacrificing for. Alongside men women uniform, represent best traditions bold generous nation. In lobby building, State Department, names vvho fallen line duty inscribed marble. Our hearts break one. And now, tragedy, new heroes honor friends mourn. Chris Stevens fell love Middle East young Peace Corps volunteer teaching English Morocco. He joined Foreign Service, learned languages, won friends America distant places, made people's hopes own. In early days Libyan revolution, I asked Chris envoy rebel opposition. He arrived cargo ship port Benghazi began building relationships Libya's revolutionaries. He risked life stop tyrant, gave life trying help build better Libya. The world needs Chris Stevenses. I spoke sister, Ann, morning, told remembered hero many nations. Doherty Benghazi, Libya September 13, 2012 The attack diplomatic post Benghazi, Libya Tuesday claimed lives four Americans. Yesterday, I spoke two: Ambassador Chris Stevens Information Management Officer Sean Smith. Today, also recognize two security personnel died helping protect colleagues. Tyrone S. Woods Glen A. Doherty decorated military veterans served country honor distinction. Our thoughts, prayers, deepest gratitude families friends. Our embassies could carry critical work around world without service sacrifice brave people like Tyrone Glen. Tyrone's friends colleagues called "Rone," relied courage skill, honed two decades Navy SEAL. In uniform, served multiple tours Iraq Afghanistan. Since 2010, protected American diplomatic personnel dangerous posts Central America Middle East. He hands healer well arm warrior, earning distinction registered nurse certified paramedic. All hearts go Tyrone's wife Dorothy three sons, Tyrone Jr., Hunter, Kai, born months ago. We also grieve Glen Doherty, called Bub, family: father Bernard, mother Barbara, brother Gregory, sister Kathleen. Glen also former Navy SEAL experienced paramedic. And put life line many times, protecting Americans Iraq, Afghanistan, hotspots. In end, died way lived — selfless honor unstinting valor. We condemn attack took lives heroes strongest terms, taking additional steps safeguard American embassies, consulates, citizens around world. This violence shock conscience people faiths traditions. We appreciate statements support poured across region beyond. He respected expert technology colleagues Pretoria, Baghdad, Montreal, The Hague. He enrolled correspondence courses Penn State high hopes future. Sean leaves behind loving wife Heather, two young children, Samantha Nathan, scores grieving family, friends, colleagues. And that's world. Because online virtual worlds Sean helped create, also mourned countless competitors, collaborators, garners shared passion. He hands healer well arms warrior, earning distinction registered nurse certified paramedic. Our hearts go Tyrone's wife Dorothy, three sons Tyrone, Jr., Hunter, Kai, born months ago, along grieving family, friends, colleagues. From: Abedin, HuiTia [mailto:Abedinfi@state.gov) Sent: Saturday, September 15, 2012 12:17 PM To: H; Sullivan, Jacob J <Sullivan33@state.gov> Subject: Fw; Saudi Grand Mufti calls attacks foreign embassies tin Islamic (Reuters) There probably greater Islamic authority sunni muslims (there actually them, he's oldest). And don't often. , From: OpsNewsTicker©state.gov Emailto:OpsNewsTicker@state.gov] Sent: Saturday, September 15, 2012 11:10 AM To: NEWS-Mahogany Subject: Saudi Grand Mufti calls attacks foreign embassies un-islamic (Reuters) RIYADH (Reuters) - Saudi Ara.bia's Grand Mufti, highest religious authority birthplace Islam, Saturday denounced attacks diplomats embassies un-Islamic deadly protests U.S.-made film mocking Islam's founder. Sheikh Abdulaziz bin Abdullah Al al-Sheikh also called governments international bodies criminalise insults prophets excoriated film prompted wave fury across Middle East. "It forbidden punish innocent wicked crimes guilty, attack granted protection lives property, expose public buildings fire destruction," said speech carried state news agency SPA. Describing release crudely made short film "miserable" "criminal", added attacks innocent diplomats "are also distortion Islamic religion accepted God". At least nine people killed noon prayers Friday demonstrations across Middle East. NewsTickers alert senior Department officials breaking news. This item appears m original publication contain analysis commentary Department sources. SUBJECT TO AGREEMENT ON SENSITIVE INFORMATION & REDACTIONS. NO FOIA WAIVER. "The attack consulate Benghazi Sept. nth, 2012, likely work forces attacked homeland Sept. nth, 2001. This latest assault cannot blamed reprehensible video insulting Islam, despite administration's attempts convince us long. No, administration finally conceded, attacks deliberate work terrorists use violence impose dark ideology others, especially women girls; fighting control much Middle East today; seek wage perpetual war West." Some U.S. intelligence community believe attack Benghazi consulate killed Amb. Chris Stevens three Americans led Benghazi chapter Ansar al-Sharia, extremist group thought ties Al Qaeda Islamic Magreb (AQIM), al Qaeda's North Africa affiliate. Secretary State Hillary Clinton suggested groups links AQIM responsible Beghazi attack remarks U.N. meeting Sept. 26, State Department White House spokepersons repeated precise identity attackers remains unknown pending FBI investigation. Romney invoke original 9/n attacks part argument Obama failed respond rapid changes Middle East proactive coherent strategy preserve American power influence region. "I know president hopes safer, freer, prosperous Middle East allied United States. I share hope. But hope strategy," Romney say. "We cannot support friends defeat enemies Middle East words backed deeds, defense spending arbitrarily deeply cut, trade agenda speak of, perception strategy one partnership, passivity.... It time change course Middle East." Romney promise increase tighten sanctions Iran, permanently base one aircraft carrier group Eastern Mediterranean Gulf, condition aid Egypt, "recommit America goal democratic, prosperous Palestinian state living side side peace security Jewish state Israel." On Syria, Romney promise identify opposition groups share American values make sure get weapons defeat Syrian regime's tanks, helicopters, fighter jets. He won't say United States arm rebels directly -- make sure get advanced weaponry. On Afghanistan, Romney accuse Obama timing withdrawal U.S. forces based political considerations, reference fact Obama withdrew 30,000 "surge" forces last month. But Romney reiterate call complete withdrawal combat troops end 2014, long conditions ground permit consultation military chain command. "I believe America lead, others -- others share interests values -- world grow darker, friends us. America's security cause freedom cannot afford four years like last four years," Romney say. "The 21st century must American century. It began terror, war, economic calamity. It duty steer onto path freedom, peace, prosperity." The Romney campaign held conference call reporters Sunday preview speech, included participation campaign foreign-policy coordinator Alex Wong senior advisors Rich Williamson Eliot Cohen. Wong said Obama stepped away American leadership undermined basis American power. He also said standing United States weakened every region world, likened Obama's foreign policy former President Jimmy Carter. Williamson said Obama policy weakness provocative enemies administration hasn't transparent Benghazi attacks. "The foreign policy Barack Obama Middle East mess failing, part discussion," Williamson said. The Obama campaign preemptively released statement calling Romney neophyte flip-fiopper foreign policy fumbled forays foreign-policy issues throughout campaign. "If Mitt Romney wants debate foreign policy, message him: bring on... To date, Mitt Romney offered bluster platitudes. He's erratically shifted positions every major foreign policy issue, including intervening Libya, for," Obama America spokeswoman Liz Smith said statement. "Mainstream' foreign policy isn't Mitt Romney putting forward: plans start wars end them; wanting keep 30,000 U.S. troops Iraq indefinitely; exploding defense spending levels Pentagon asked for, way pay it; insulting allies partners around world campaign trail; calling Russia number-one geopolitical foe. If that's Mitt Romney thinks mainstream is, needs find better compass. It's clear every measure, Mitt Romney fails commander-in-chief test." EGYPT AND LIBYA: A source excellent access highest levels SUPREME COUNCIL OF THE ARMED FORCES (SCAF) states Egyptian Military turned full attention crisis Libya. Traditionally, Egypt strong influence eastern Libyan region Cyrenaica taking advantage current crisis regain position. Regardless whether Muammar Qaddafi remains power not, political division Libya give Egypt opportunity fill void east. A senior diplomatic source reported since early days Libyan crisis, Egyptian government quietly supporting Libyan opposition forces training, weaponry, food, medical supplies, attempting organize political structure east. In addition, Egyptian Special Operations troops serving mitel forces eastern part Libya. Senior Egyptian military officers stated privately troops responsible many rebel's combat successes. The following factors focus Egypt's plans post-Qaddafi regime: -Avoiding refugee crisis. In event Qaddaffs forces invade east, Egypt logical destination refugees Libyan. Egypt interest controlling turmoil Libya could harm efforts restart struggling economy. -Labor market. Libya important market unemployed Egyptian laborers. According Egyptian Labor Ministry, around 1.5 million Egyptians reside work Libya, sending home estimated $254 million remittances. In past years, Qaddafi placed heavy restrictions foreign workers, Egypt hopes new regime flexible, open receiving Egyptian workers. -Radical Islamists. Traditionally, eastern part Libya stronghold radical Islamist groups, including al Qaida-linked Libyan Islamic Fighting Group. While Qadclafi's regime successful suppressing jihadist threat Libya, current situation opens door jihadist resurgence. Egypt growing interest keeping close eye jihadist movements eastern Libya. This especially true Egyptian Military already UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2015-04841 Doc No. C05739660 Date: 05/13/2015 STATE DEPT. - PRODUCED TO HOUSE SELECT BENGHAZI COMM. RELEASE IN FULL From: H ehrod17@clintonemailcom> Sent: Saturday, April 23, 2011 3:52 PM To: `abedinh@stategov` Subject Re: McCain update What Donna's it? Original Message From: Abedin, Hume [mailto:AbedinH@state.govi Sent: Saturday, April 23, 2011 03:27 PM To: H Subject: Fw: McCain update --- Original Message --- From: Davis, Timmy T Sent: Saturday, April 23, 2011 03:12 PM To Sullivan, Jacobi, Abedin, Hume; Wells, Alice G; S_SpecialAssistants Subject: McCain update The Watch received following readout CODEL McCain's April 23 meetings Cairo. Foreign Minister Alaraby: McCain discussed visit Libya, emphasizing appeared stalemate emerging. McCain supported decision send predator drones would like NATO provide equipment, well training, rebel forces. McCain characterized TNC "good people," said military far less impressive. Regarding possibility Egypt increasing aid TNC, Alaraby said Egypt reluctant provide additional support concern estimated 1 million Egyptian nationals living Libya. Alaraby reiterated Egypt rush restore diplomatic relations Iran. Alaraby said Egypt abide agreements made Israel. He encouraged United States support, least oppose, recognition Palestinian statehood UN. McCain said USG discussed modest assistance package Egypt, warned probably modest Egypt wished given current economic climate. McCain planned organize group businessmen visit Egypt encouraged Alaraby create pro-business environment. Accept fact success without taking increased risk suffering casualties. • Set realistic achievable goals country-by-country give ambassador country team much discretion possible. Don't set impossible goals instant democracy, human rights, rule law stability. Accept need evolutionary action "doing way." Don't try one size fits ideological solutions efforts Washington. • Stop focusing narrow budget cuts examine costs benefits effective, well-funded country team efforts. This includes adequate staff, operating security funds, flexible aid funds applied quickly deal changing needs circumstances. Fully fund security find best ways change existing procedures emphasize mobility move high-risk areas. Refocus intelligence help reduce risks, restructure protection efforts provide specially trained equipped U.S. foreign national security. Stop pointless security post-mortem blame games focus future. • Reward encourage necessary risk taking. Make clear key part successful career path, fully supported State agencies deploying U.S. personnel, reorient security efforts country protect efforts best ways possible rather creating rules either make effective action impossible force diplomats advisors violate rules without protection. SUBJECT TO AGREEMENT ON SENSITIVE INFORMATION & REDACTIONS. NO FOIA WAIVER. At Andrews Air Force Base Friday, military band played "Nearer, My God, Thee." Marines dress uniforms carried four black hearses flag-draped caskets Americans, including Winchester native Glen Doherty, killed consulate Libya. President Obama Secretary State Hillary Clinton led solemn ceremony, Clinton speaking him. "If last days teach us anything, let this: work men women risk lives heart makes America great good," said Clinton, voice times uneven emotion dead men employed. Then said: "So wipe away tears, stiffen spines, face future undaunted." It perfect line America Americans try keep peace smoldering Middle East. It line, too, captured — unwittingly — Clinton lived life. How many times since woman took center stage country nearly 20 years ago she, privately publicly, wiped away tears, stiffened spine, faced future undaunted. Clinton appeared crying listened Obama, seeming stricken himself. And Obama finished walked back behind podium, Clinton reached hand like older sister even mother, held second two. It moment history books remember. There first black president verge re-election, not. There woman expected first female president, showed nowhere. There rivalry tortured history, Bill Clinton ever third actor shadows. But put aside something bigger politics egos: country. We don't see enough anymore. When husband president, I made career trashing Hillary Clinton's hairdos, pantsuits, attempted health care coup, right-wing conspiracy theories, staying slippery serial philanderer. Four years ago presidential primary I rooted Obama her. Yet finally conceded totally unexpected defeat, different Hillary Clinton began emerge. She surprised us accepting consolation prize, secretary state. She went perform ably nearly two-thirds Americans, almost unprecedented percentage, approve rehabilitated — hope — spouse. More since 2008 I've wondered: Would done better job Obama? I don't know. But I know I sold woman short. In awful moments history, leaders rise occasion, don't. Think Ronald Reagan's reassurance Challenger disaster. Or George Bush rubble Ground Zero 9/11, telling world we'd never forget. Friday, comparison, tiny moment. Still, Hillary Clinton rose meet it. SUBJECT TO AGREEMENT ON SENSITIVE INFORMATION & REDACTIONS. NO FOIA WAIVER. March 14 - HRC travels Paris G8 foreign minister's meeting. She meets TNC representative Jibril consults colleagues UN Security Council action. She notes no-fly zone adequate. March 14-16 - HRC participates series high-level video- teleconferences She leading voice strong UNSC action NATO civilian B5 protection mission. March 17- HRC secures Russian abstention Portuguese African support UNSC 1973, ensuring passes. 1973 authorizes no-fly zone Libya "all necessary measures" - code military action - protect civilians Gaddafi's army. March 24 - HRC engages allies secures transition command control civilian protection mission NATO. She announces transition statement. March 18-30- HRC engages UAE, Qatar, Jordan seek participation coalition operations. Over course several days, three devote aircraft mission. March 19 - HRC travels Paris meet European Arab leaders prepare military action protect civilians. That night, first U.S. air strikes halt advance Gaddafi's forces Benghazi target Libya's air defenses. March 29 - HRC travels London conference Libya, driving force behind creation Contact Group comprising 20-plus countries coordinate efforts protect civilians plan post- Qadhafi Libya. She instrumental setting rotating chair system ensure regional buy-in. April 14 - HRC travels Berlin NATO meetings. She driving force behind NATO adopting communiqué calls Qadhafi's departure political objective, lays three clear military objectives: end attacks threat attacks civilians; removal Qadhafi forces cities forcibly entered; unfettered provision humanitarian access. May 5 - HRC travels Rome Contact Group meeting. The Contact Group establishes coordination system temporary financial mechanism funnel money TNC. June 8 - HRC travels Abu Dhabi another Contact Group meeting holds series intense discussions rebel leaders. June 12 - HRC travels Addis consultations speech African Union, pressing case democratic transition Libya. July 15 - HRC travels Istanbul announces U.S. recognizes TNC legitimate government Libya. She also secures recognition members Contact Group. Late June - HRC meets House Democrats Senate Republicans persuade de-fund Libya operation. July 16 - HRC sends Feltrnan, Cretz, Chollet Tunis meet Qadhafi envoys "to deliver clear firm message way move forward, Qadhafi step down". Early August - HRC works construct $1.5 billion assets package approved Security Council sent TNC. That package working last hurdles. The "Rescue Benghazi day" demonstration called government disband armed groups refused give weapons since NATO-backed revolution toppled Muammar Gaddafi last year Marchers headed main square much smaller counter demonstration hundreds supporters hardline Islamist group Ansar al-Sharia waiting. "Ifs obvious protest militias. All join army security forces individuals, groups," medical student Ahmed Sanallah, 27, said. "Without prosperity success new Libya." The late afternoon demonstration cheerful atmosphere families marched small children shoulders. Fighter jets helicopters roared overhead show official support demonstration, enthusiastically promoted city's authorities. "DEFEND BENGHAZI" Although main demands marchers mention attack U.S. consulate, seems provided strong impetus authorities rally support behind country's weak government. U.S. ambassador Christopher Stevens well liked Libya, many people angered anti- Islamic film made United States consider attack embassy excessive. Some placards English, intended international news cameras, read: "We demand justice Stevens" "Libya lost friend". "I today defend Benghazi. Killing ambassador completely separate thing," 26-year-old Amjad Mohammed Hassan, network engineer, said. "I don't give damn killing ambassador Americans offended Prophet. I Benghazi." Benghazi, 1,000 km (600 miles) Tripoli across largely empty desert, controlled various armed groups, including comprised Islamists openly proclaim hostility democratic government West. Some identified local people among consulate protest last week. U.S. officials described violence "terrorist attack". One group linked attack Ansar al-Sharia, denied involvement violence. Terrorizing enemy one Islam's tenets." He said fought American troops Iraq arrested sent back Gaddafi's Libya jailed three years. One banner demonstration read: "Day rescue Benghazi day rescue America?" In southern Libya, least six people killed 12 injured clashes security forces local group, security official resident said Friday. Security forces sent town Brak, 700 km (400 miles) south Tripoli, Wednesday stop group broadcasting songs Gaddafi radio, official said. The security forces, made former rebel fighters, came attack upon arrival. Libyan National Transitional Council (NTC) President Mustafa Abdel Jalil expected final days leading July 7, 2012 national elections complicated sometimes violent; however, according knowledgeable individual, particularly concerned level control exerted regional militia's political groups electoral process. In opinion individual, Jalil advisors believe that, given level suspicion frustration felt various parts country, difficult new 200 seat General National Congress (GNC) establish authority, draft new constitution, establish new national government. With mind, Jalil stated extreme confidence NTC may remain power situation becomes stable new government firmly place. That said still plans interim Prime Minister Abdel Rahman el-Keib step election results certified. The NTC work GNC takes shape choose new Prime Minister Cabinet. Jalil would like keep several ministers el-Keib government new regime, particularly Minister Defense Ousama al-Juwali. 2. According individual, Jalil wants maintain degree security stability effort reassure foreign businesses banks Libya descend civil war chaos. At time, NTC must deal regional issues divide country's three electoral regions: Tripolitania West, Cyrenaica (Barge) East, Fezzan South. In weeks leading election failure NTC resolve differences strengthened federalist movement Barge antagonizing tribal leaders South. Both groups calling followers boycott election Southerners calling National Army withdraw forces area around town Kufra, deployed stop fighting tribal militias. At time, July 1 federalist supporters attacked electoral offices Benghazi, protesting influence Tripoli Western region upcoming elections. Under Magariaf authority Haftar force, numbered 2,500 3,000 troops, fought several battles Qaddafi's troops, mixed results. These attacks included raid Qaddafi's compound Bab al-Aziza 1986. The LNA also maintained 50,000 watt radio station Ndjamena, broadcasting anti-Qaddafi material Libya. This radio station supported Western governments Iraqi Military Intelligence. 6. 'Sir Jeremy Isaacs, former chief executive Channel Four, accused festival's organisers making "an appalling decision" called rescind it. Describing Loach's intervention act censorship, said: "They must allow someone real position, rock stand on, interfere programming." The grant intended enable Tali Shalom Ezer, graduate Tel Aviv University, travel Scotland screening film, Surrogate. After days protest award pro-Palestinian organisations, Loach, outspoken opponent Israel's policies Lebanon Gaza, urged filmgoers Monday boycott Edinburgh. "The massacres state terrorism Gaza make money unacceptable," said. "With regret, I must urge might consider visiting festival show support Palestinian nation stay away." WITH $150 IN HIS POCKET, DANIEL YOHANNES BRINGS A QUIET DETERMINATION TO HIS TRUSTEE ROLE. By Leah Arroyo This article published Museum, July/August 2008. Trustee. The word brings mind venerable patrician senior-Nears, "trusted" guide interests organization individual wisdom perspective. Someone old-boy -girl connections, decades expertise and, especially, big bucks—not mention ability pry others away theirs. Ascot required, couldn't hurt. In certain ways, Daniel Yohannes Denver typical museum trustee. At 17, $150, moved Ethiopia Los Angeles exchange student without knowing soul. He immediately got part-time job stock boy clothing store went support high school, Claremont McKenna College MBA program Pepperdine. He began banking career teller Security Pacific Bank. But ways, Yohannes portrait board member. At 55, president CEO M&R Investments, firm specializing real estate, financial institutions energy. A former vice chairman U.S. Bancorp. A years ago started bank San Francisco side. His board membership extends financial (a Fortune 100 UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05758636 Date: 07/31/2015 UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05758636 Date: 07/31/2015 company) educational (U.C. Denver Business School) community organizations (the chamber commerce, National Jewish Hospital Research Center, Boy Scouts Council)—not mention political service (chairing transition team Gov. Bill Ritter, Democrat Colorado). And museums, priority among board invitations accepted. He served Smithsonian Institution's national board six years trustee Denver Art Museum (DAM), established Daniel Yohannes Family African Gallery. "I get lot inspirations intellectually culturally art history, primarily museums," says. "So I asked sit [DAM] board, natural fit me." For success, though, Yohannes hardly gives impression Type-A personality. Courtly, soft-spoken, melodious accent paying homage Ethiopian roots despite decades U.S., generous unhurried time interviews. On phone, asks are, you've lately; told interviewer bought first house, chats moments delightful meaningful purchase is. In person, conversation AAM Annual Meeting Denver last spring, walked rather dreary underground room convention center, suave conservative navy suit warm greetings, politely oblivious tables cluttered conference staff's walkie-talkies, office supplies assortment snacks. The photographer got sent wrong room interviewer scurry length several football fields find her? No problem; he'd reserved plenty time talk. "Take time." And yet times glimpse calm determination man gets things done and, moreover, fully expects to. Vicki Sterling, Denver Art Museum's assistant director, says "what truly unique working [Yohannes] African gallery ability bring together people outside regular museum donor community get interested Denver Art Museum." When ask this, new museophiles were, almost hear shrug phone. "Friends mine, people I knew," says. "They contributed I. asked to." He also shrugs question fits commitments schedule: "I think long there's desire get everything done, gets done." Asked fun, think moment. "That's good one.... I walk, I play little golf, little bicycling, sightseeing." He also collects art, particularly African works, inspired years ago travels, though "only hobby." Last least, cherishes spending time three children, two live area, overjoyed become grandfather May ("She's beautiful," beams). You walk away impression quietly dynamic man priorities us somehow bring extraordinary focus turn. He says driven beginning. "It decision come here, family's. I've always adventurous person, ever since I child, I made decision early I wanted make own. I wanted go place provided opportunity someone like myself, immigrant. I could find place United States provided opportunity." Perhaps later generations family jaded American dream, Yohannes speaks unembarrassed directness. "For someone like myself, it's much easier give community given much." Fortunately, sees museum leadership part obligation. She can't win fight internally she's smart enough won't want fight publicly." Several weeks administration, even Clinton's internal critics believed relationship success. The Obama Administration committed leading developing new global approach. We support creation sustainable agricultural systems appropriate regions around world, increase agricultural productivity, create jobs, strengthen economies, protect natural resources. We imposing one-size-fits-all solutions, assisting countries carrying individual strategies meet needs—for example, Comprehensive Africa Agriculture Development Plan. To facilitate coordination share best practices, seek convene donor governments, multilateral institutions, NG0s, private companies, foundations, universities, individuals. THE ANCHORS OF OUR APPROACH We've identified seven anchors secure sustainable agriculture systems. These guide approach. • Increase agricultural productivity expanding access quality seeds, fertilizer, irrigation, credit purchase them, training use them. • Stimulate post-harvest sector improving storage processing food improving transportation connect small farmers markets. • Maintain natural resources land farmed well future make right adaptations changing environment. That matters cost barrel crude oil increases $10, Ayatollah Khamenei Iran gets $15 billion more, Putin Russia gets extra $36 billion, Hugo Chavez Venezuela gets additional $10 billion prop anti-American regime. Original Message From: Jake Sullivan To: H Sent: Tue Jun 16 00:22:29 2009 Subject: Kurtzer Just wanted sure saw Kurtzer op-ed, ran Sunday Post. Kudos Jonathan Prince getting written placed. The Settlements Facts By Daniel Kurtzer Sunday, June 14, 2009 Faulty analysis Israeli settlement issue passed fact. Charles Krauthammer's June 5 column, "The Settlements Myth <http://www.washingtonpost.com/wp-dyn/content/article/2009/06/04/AR2009060403811.html> ," one example. Here facts: In 2003, Israeli government accepted, reservations, "road map" peace, imposed two requirements Israel regarding settlements: "GOI [Government Israel] immediately dismantles settlement outposts erected since March 2001. Consistent Mitchell Report, GOI freezes settlement activity (including natural growth settlements)." Today, Israel maintains three events -- namely, draft understandings discussed 2003 Prime Minister Ariel Sharon U.S. deputy national security adviser Stephen Hadley; President George W. Bush's April 14, 2004, letter Sharon; April 14 letter Sharon adviser Dov Weissglas national security adviser Condoleezza Rice -- constitute formal understanding United States accepted continuing Israeli building within "construction line" settlements. The problem understanding. The first event Israelis cite 2003 discussions four-part draft included notion construction within settlements might permitted confined already built-up areas settlements. The idea draw line around outer perimeter built-up areas settlements allow building inside line. This draft never codified, effort made define line around built-up areas settlements. B6 UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05758778 Date: 06/30/2015 UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05758778 Date: 06/30/2015 Nonetheless, Israel began act largely accordance reading provisions, probably believing U.S. silence conferred assent. Second, President Bush's 2004 letter conveyed U.S. support agreed outcome negotiations Israel would retain "existing major Israeli population centers" West Bank "on basis mutually agreed changes ...." One key provisions letter U.S. support Israel's retaining settlements predicated "agreed outcome" negotiations. Despite Israel's contention letter allowed continue building large settlement blocs Ariel, Maale Adumim Gush Etzion, letter convey U.S. support understanding Israeli settlement activities areas run-up peace agreement. In 2004 letter Rice, Weissglas addressed issue "construction line," saying "within agreed principles settlement activities, effort made next days better definition construction line settlements Judea & Samaria." However, never "agreed principles settlement activities." Moreover, effort define "construction line" never consummated: Israel United States discussed briefly reach agreement definition construction line settlements. Weissglas's letter also promised "continuous action" remove unauthorized outposts, Israel removed almost none them. Throughout period, Bush administration regularly protest Israel's continuing settlement activity. But different arguing United States agreed it. In recent days, former senior Bush administration officials told journalists background understandings existed Israel regarding continued settlement activity. Commentators also focus Obama administration's reiteration freeze must include "natural growth" settlements. Krauthammer says "means strangling death thriving towns close 1949 armistice line. .. It means increase population. Which means babies." This nonsense. No one suggests Israelis stop babies. Rather, blessing new baby translate right build apartments houses settlements. The two issues nothing other. Israelis, like Americans, move time life circumstances -- children, jobs, housing availability -- change. The pattern population growth territories actually undercuts natural-growth argument. Since 1993, Israel signed Oslo Accords, Israel's West Bank settler population grown 116,300 289,600. The numbers East Jerusalem increased 152,800 186,000. This goes far beyond natural increase families already living settlements. Inserting provision "natural growth" official documents started 2001 Mitchell Report 2003 "road map," reflecting recognition concept abused justification expanding settlements. The Obama administration pursuing policies every administration since 1967 articulated -- settlements jeopardize possibility achieving peace thus settlement activity stop. This diminish Palestinians' responsibilities, especially commitment stop violence terrorism uproot terrorist infrastructure. President Obama emphasized Cairo speech. But Palestinian failures way justify Israeli failure implement road map commitments respect settlements outposts. It time Israel freeze settlement activity dismantle unauthorized outposts. The writer, U.S. ambassador Israel 2001 2005, visiting professor Middle East policy studies Princeton University's Woodrow Wilson School Public International Affairs. Condemns breaking constitutional order Honduras overthrow democratically elected President Don Jose Manuel Zelaya Rosales, 2. Demands restoration President Jose Manuel Zelaya Rosales constitutional duties may fulfill mandate elected Honduran population, 3. Refuses recognize Government Honduras constitutionally legitimate government President Zelaya. 4. Requests Secretary-General inform General Assembly progress events country. Waxman, member Congress since 1975, leading co-sponsor landmark climate change legislation passed House Friday. From: Cooney, Thomas E (Shanghai) To: Shanghai Expo Working Group ; Villarreal, Jose Sent: Fri Jul 10 23:36:03 2009 Subject: Fw: From Adam Minter's Shanghai Scrap blog Just fyi From: To: Cooney, Thomas E (Shanghai) Sent: Sat Jul 11 11:32:05 2009 Subject: From Adam Minter's Shanghai Scrap blog UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05758930 Date: 06/30/2015 UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05758930 Date: 06/30/2015 A US Expo 2010 pavilion, all. <http://shanghaiscrap.com/?p=3350> http://shanghaiscrap.com/?p=3350 Filed under:Expo 2010 <http://shanghaiscrap.com/?cat=33>, Expo 2010 - US Pavilion <http://shanghaiscrap.com/?cat=38>, US Politics <http://shanghaiscrap.com/?cat=28> — posted Adam July 11, 2009 @ 7:00 Coming end tumultuous week China marked earthquakes, riots, continued economic uncertainty, news US finally confirmed participation Expo 2010 <http://en.expo2010.cn/a/20090710/000011.htm> (a/k/a, next year's world fair) didn't seem particularly significant. And, much Shanghai's foreign correspondent corps preoccupied pressing news elsewhere China, didn't receive much coverage. Fair enough, I think. However, insofar US pavilion – lack thereof– become increasingly thorny diplomatic issue China United States, signing ceremony important signal kind resolution hand. I've following mostly sad saga US pavilion several months now, Shanghai Scrap <http://shanghaiscrap.com/?cat=38>, elsewhere <http://www.theatlantic.com/doc/200904u/shanghai-expo-2010> . And, two weeks ago, absolutely reason believe participation agreement would ever signed. Shanghai Expo, Inc. <http://usapavilion2010.comh , non-profit authorized US State Department fund-raise, design, build, operate US pavilion, failed raise sufficient funds break ground. At yesterday's signing ceremony, Beatrice Camp, US Consul General Shanghai blamed underwhelming fundraising global economic crisis <http://shanghai.usembassy-china.org.cn/071009.html> – point picked Chinese media <http://news.xinhuanet.com/english/2009-07/10/content_11685418.htm> . No doubt, economic crisis played role, Camp others close US effort surely know, important factor inexperienced increasingly erratic trio running non-profit Shanghai Expo, Inc. As recently last month, one members – Frank Lavin, former US ambassador Singapore Undersecretary Commerce – issued press release falsely claiming US Congress "adopted" resolution support US pavilion <http://shanghaiscrap.com/?p=3106> . This incident, others like it, succeeded alienating potential donors (including major US corporations operations China), vast swaths US expatriate business community Shanghai, – crucially – members Shanghai government. For us following events, question longer "How badly US damage relationship China doesn't participate?" instead became "What's worse US-China relations? Turning Shanghai's Expo invite continuing current, incompetent effort?" The July 1 appointment Jose Villarreal Commissioner General US pavilion effort seems changed equation. A lawyer ties Clintons, Secretary State Clinton empowered oversee US effort. He didn't waste time, either, arriving Shanghai Monday, managing pull signing Friday. One person familiar Villarreal's role described arrival "adult" chaotic situation badly needed one. Indeed, there's one telling detail handful official press accounts yesterday's signing, it's total absence Shanghai Expo, Inc. members official comments photos (US Consulate coverage <http://en.expo2010.cn/a/20090710/000011.htm> ; Shanghai government account <http://en.expo2010.cn/a/20090710/000011.htm> ), none live work Shanghai, anyway. If conscious decision, wise one. A final point. As Villarreal conceded, US effort must still raise roughly half $61 million budget. I suspect – Villarreal charge effort – reluctant wallets become less so. Regardless, though, raises still unresolved question: namely, actual fundraising rules US pavilion effort? Back 2007, State Department indicated would sign participation agreement Expo 2010, Inc funds raised pavilion. Apparently, ill-conceived policy changed. I say apparently because, now, State Department refused release "action plan" governs fundraising rules related US pavilion Shanghai. As result official intransigence, Freedom Information Act request filed obtain UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05758930 Date: 06/30/2015 UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05758930 Date: 06/30/2015 document(s?) <http://shanghaiscrap.com/?p=3103> . UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05758986 Date: 06/30/2015 RELEASE IN PART B6 From: H <hrod17@clintonemail.com> Sent: Tuesday, July 14, 2009 5:40 AM To: 'JilotyLC@state.gov' Subject: Fw: Back DC Pls print me. Original Message From: Roach, Stephen To: H Cc: ValmoroU@state.gov <ValmoroU@state.gov> Sent: Wed Jul 08 10:45:51 2009 Subject: Re: Back DC Dear Secretary Clinton, Your assistant, Lona Valmoro, I exchanging emails trying find time meet Washington July 30. I hopeful something worked out. In meantime, I wanted take offer provide thoughts China prior upcoming SED July 27-28. I send note Beijing (midway four-day visit) via Blackberry -- apologies typos. 1. Mounting signs social instability intensified China's growth imperatives. Beijing insiders concerned Xinjiang uprising; Hu Jintao's pre-G-8 exit validates concerns. Coming heels last year's problems Tibet, social instability longer dismissed isolated occurrence. In cases, sources claim growth shortfalls exacerbated ethnic disturbances. China's recent fiscal stimulus -- especially infrastructure initiatives West -- attempts address this. Growth long modern China's antidote risks social instability. 2. A massive external demand shock dilutes growth antidote China needs contain social instability. In fact, global recession adds new risk factor China's social instability equation. The government confirmed reports 20 million layoffs migrant workers export-intensive Guangdong Province -- direct outgrowth collapse Chinese exports past year (from growth +25% mid-2008 contraction -25% May 2009). Driven record capitulation American consumer -- real US consumption -1.8% past four quarters (a 58-year record plunge) -- China's biggest source end-market export demand hit extraordinary shock. To extent come count -- remains best guess, although less dramatic US consumption adjustment saw past year -- external demand pressures continue undermine China's growth imperatives feed heightened concerns social instability. 3. China's stimulus package "quick fix" exacerbate already worrisome structural imbalances. The focus stimulus two unbalanced sectors -- fixed investment exports, collectively account 80% Chinese GDP. Fully 72% RMB4 trillion fiscal initiative announced last November goes infrastructure. And aggressive incentives directed exporters (i.e., tax rebates, "buy China" procurement incentives, SME credit support, etc.). Moreover, huge push State-directed bank lending -- full- year 2009 lending target hit mid-April! This latter initiative underscores risks deteriorating loan quality associated banking problems road. Meanwhile, despite public claims contrary, little done stimulate one sector China needs -- internal private consumption. Social safety net efforts still puny -- recent healthcare plan translates US$30 per person three years National Social Security Fund enough assets provide $90 lifetime social security benefits per worker! This forces fear-driven -- precautionary -- saving that, turn, inhibits consumer-led impetus Chinese rebalancing urgently needs. UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05758986 Date: 06/30/2015 UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05758986 Date: 06/30/2015 4. All points asymmetrical global rebalancing -- worrisome prognosis post-crisis world. Despite problems, US actually tempering greatest macro imbalance -- excess consumption. At time, China unfortunately upping ante two unbalanced sectors -- investment exports. Sadly, could set still unbalanced global economy another serious accident not-so-distant future. Sorry rambled much. There good deal points -- wanted give highlights ahead SED. Good luck -- else seems going around world. Hope see 30th. Best regards, Stephen S. July 14, 2009 Netanyahu's Speech Peace: Is Anyone Listening? By Lanny J. Davis http://www.washingtontimes.com/news/2009/jul/13/netanyahus-speech-for-peace-is-anyone- listening/?feat=home_columns&page=2&FORM=ZZNR http://pundits.thehill.com/2009/07/13/netanyahu%e2%80%99s-speech-for-peace-is-anyone-listening/ <http://www.washingtontimes.com/photos/2009/jul/07/50034/> AGENCE FRANCE-PRESSE: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu determined "it made sense" press U.S. assistance, senior Israeli official said. UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05759019 Date: 06/30/2015 UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05759019 Date: 06/30/2015 I really don't get it. On June 14, less month meeting President Obama, Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu gave one comprehensive, thoughtful highly personal speeches supporting Israeli-Palestinian peace process Israeli prime minister recent years, perhaps ever. One would thought speech would big news U.S., Europe elsewhere. Mr. Netanyahu first time clearly stated would support two-state solution, albeit understandable requirements guarantee Israel's security, despite leaving different impression last month's U.S. visit. Yet, reaction governments media U.S. Europe functional equivalent tree falling forest one listening. Where covered, writing emphasized cynical focused half-empty, rather half-full, glass. So let's take closer look could turn significant, game-changing speech. It divided, essentially, four parts: personal, historic, diplomatic economic. The personal aspect speech deals issue peace. At one point, Mr. Netanyahu spoke directly Palestinian people: "We want live peace, good neighbors. We want children children never experience war: parents, brothers sisters never know agony losing loved ones battle; children able dream better future realize dream; together invest energies plowshares pruning hooks, swords spears." And reminded Palestinians family, peace war quite personal: "I know face war. 1 experienced battle. I lost close friends. I lost brother. I seen pain bereaved families. I want war. No one Israel wants war." Mr. Netanyahu also spent time speech history, relitigate ancient argument lived Palestine first longest time. Rather, Mr. Netanyahu explained "root conflict" based fundamental misstatement undeniable historical facts. Palestinians taught Israel founded largely alien foreigners, foisted native Palestinians Europeans feeling guilty Holocaust. That misstatement central rationale Arab Palestinian unwillingness publicly recognize Israel Jewish state. In fact, points out, "the attacks us began 1920s," 20 years Holocaust. And undeniable historical fact "the Jewish people land Israel go back 3,500 years" - Abraham, Isaac Jacob, forefathers Jews; David Solomon, ancient Israel's two greatest kings; Isaiah Jeremiah, two UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05759019 Date: 06/30/2015 UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05759019 Date: 06/30/2015 Jewish religion's greatest spiritual prophets, lived Judea Samaria, today called West Bank. "The right Jewish people state land Israel derive cascade catastrophes befell people," prime minister said. "There say Holocaust occurred, state Israel would never established. But I say state Israel would established earlier, Holocaust would occurred." Third, prime minister addressed two simple requirements peace Israel Palestinians: recognition security. As first, put quite simply: "A fundamental prerequisite ending conflict public, binding unequivocal Palestinian recognition Israel nation-state Jewish people." As security, also quite simple: Palestine must demilitarized, guaranteed international community, open skies, military alliances hostile powers, "effective security measures prevent weapons smuggling territory - real monitoring, occurs Gaza today." Once two issues recognition security Israel guaranteed, rest difficult issues seem come much easier: new settlements, wiggle room natural growth current settlements caused families growing; equitable treatment assistance placing refugees land homes outside Israel (to preserve essence historic Israel Jewish state). And always controversial issue Jerusalem, Mr. Netanyahu deftly ambiguous: "Jerusalem, capital Israel, must remain undivided, continued religious freedom faiths." That seem exclude Palestinian de facto control certain parts Jerusalem certainly holy places. Finally, prime minister expressed clear concrete vision economic prosperity Palestinians partnership Israel. Indeed, stated economic prosperity come even final peace agreement reached. "An economic peace substitute political peace important element achieving it. Together undertake projects overcome scarcities region, like water desalination, maximize advantages, like developing solar energy, exploiting geographic location laying gas petroleum lines establishing transportation links Asia, Africa Europe.... UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05759019 Date: 06/30/2015 UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05759019 Date: 06/30/2015 "Together develop industrial areas generate thousands jobs develop tourist sites attract millions visitors eager walk footsteps history - Nazareth Bethlehem, around walls Jericho walls Jerusalem, banks Sea Galilee, baptismal site banks Jordan." Who cannot moved words? Perhaps Mr. Netanyahu right - new sequencing peace process: First, economic partnership prosperity Israelis Palestinians; peace, way around. It could accident Mr. Netanyahu chose deliver remarkable speech Begin-Sadat Center Bar-Ilan University. It slightly 30 years ago, March 26, 1979, Prime Minister Menachem Begin, leader right-wing Likud "Consolidation" Party, joined Egyptian President Anwar Sadat signed historic peace agreement Israel Egypt. Now another man right, another Likud prime minister three decades later, seems poised make lasting peace Israel Palestinians long eluded predecessors. One wonders whether Mr. Netanyahu might also thinking: If Richard Nixon could go China base right trusted him, I bring peace prosperity Israelis Palestinians. Let's hope - pray - right. Lanny J. "but Africa got one anyway." http://www.google.com/hostednews/ap/article/ALeqM5j8RYJFZuXpCg_LY2peUQNwQx5SagD9A289D00 Preaching reform, Clinton wins African hearts By DONNA BRYSON (AP) –1 hour ago JOHANNESBURG — In Liberia, Hillary Clinton brought crowds despite torrential rain. In Congo, came away deeply shaken meeting rape victims. Kenya's prime minister said Africa didn't need lectures West democracy, Africa got one anyway. At home, U.S. secretary state's visit may overshadowed aftermath husband's mission North Korea bring home two imprisoned U.S. journalists. But seven-nation Africa tour, ending Friday stopover West African island republic Cape Verde, made one splash another. Coupled Barack Obama's visit last month, two trips Africa earliest administration secretary state president, underlining Washington's pledges pay attention continent. In U.S., headline-making moment trip testy response question Bill Clinton. But Africa, quickly became footnote. What people wanted hear support democracy, clean government ending many civil wars. Clinton's ambitious itinerary resembled China's foreign minister, makes extensive annual tours country's allies continent. But China tends sidestep issues corruption democracy, Clinton confronted head-on. Kenyan Prime Minister Raila Odinga, speaking hours Clinton arrived, said Africa need lectured democracy. After met, that. "The absence strong effective democratic institutions permitted UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05759145 Date: 06/30/2015 UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05759145 Date: 06/30/2015 ongoing corruption, impunity, politically motivated violence lack respect rule law," Clinton said. "These conditions ... continuing hold Kenya back." Odinga switched conciliatory tone, saying African countries could learn Clinton's example conceded defeat Obama U.S. presidential primaries. "That lesson Africa needs learn seriously," said. "In Africa, many countries, elections never won, rigged. The losers never accept lost. If this, able develop democracy truly African continent." In Angola, told Foreign Minister Assuncao Afonso dos Anjos country needed write new constitution, prosecute human rights crimes hold proper presidential election. "So, Mr. Minister, work cut us," said. And Nigeria, Africa's biggest oil producer, said "the disconnect Nigeria's wealth poverty failure governance federal, state local level." To Africa's reformers, often embattled minority, heartening words. Emma Ezeazu, campaigns free fair elections native Nigeria, said Clinton's visit showed U.S. officials "are becoming pro-active relationship Nigeria, particular subject governance democracy. They paying attention." Tiseke Kasambala, Johannesburg-based researcher Human Rights Watch, commended grasp human rights abuses Africa — headline-makers, like Zimbabwe Congo, lesser publicized offenders Angola. In Goma, Congo town region ravaged gang rapes amid continuing fighting army rebels, Clinton announced $17 million American aid help victims. She toured squalid camp 18,000 refugees heard one tell her, "We really want return home, that's asking America help stop fighting." "That's I'm here," Clinton replied. "I want able go home." In Cape Town, South Africa, big, joyous crowds turned housing project. In Liberia, founded 1847 freed American slaves, rain-drenched crowds waved U.S. Liberian flags Clinton's motorcade. The crowds Nigeria Angola fewer, community religious leaders seemed excited Clinton heard her. Nancy Kachingwe, Malawian development group ActionAid, applauded Clinton's "very strong emphasis around women's rights." Some former President George W. Bush's Africa initiatives, particularly AIDS, widely praised Africa. But also sharp differences world trade, global warming, Bush administration's anti- terrorism strategy. Washington wants buy Africa's oil gain access markets, fears instability places like Somalia could fuel anti-U.S. terrorism. Clinton won points stressing U.S. pursues interests, sees virtue "working listening friends allies, creating multipolar world, multi-partner world." Clinton Ends Africa Tour, Vowing Stay Involved By JEFFREY GETTLEMAN The New York Times Published: August 15, 2009 SANTA MARIA, Cape Verde - After grueling seven-nation, 11-day trip, Secretary State Hillary Rodham Clinton wrapped Africa tour Friday reaffirming promise renovate American relations continent. "I leave Africa remarkable trip even committed," Mrs. Clinton said leaving Cape Verde. "I seen joy energy Africans have, evidenced boogieing, hard work perseverance," said, referring recent comment husband, former President Bill Clinton, knew "boogie" African dancers. "And we've seen worst humanity itself," added, presumably referring Congo, Mrs. Clinton met victims brutal civil war seem end. Mrs. Clinton seemed satisfied accomplished mission: strengthening American relations crucial allies continent, like Nigeria South Africa, sending message "tough love," called it, nations like Kenya Congo. Over all, said, United States wants work closely African nations partner, simply patron dispenser aid. In exchange, said, African leaders must deliver democracy good government. UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05759228 Date: 06/30/2015 UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05759228 Date: 06/30/2015 Mrs. Clinton vowed stay top Africa, even gets back Washington, closely monitoring issues addressed tour. She also pointed Cape Verde, set palm-studded islands best known beaches enormous tourist hotels, example good leadership do. "This possible," said. "You create economic growth sense human dignity possibility." Kenya. South Africa. Angola. Congo. Nigeria. Liberia. And finally Cape Verde. Mrs. Clinton saw eyes Africa's promising countries - troubled ones. In Kenya, pushed government prosecute perpetrators postelection violence last year. In South Africa, big issue Zimbabwe South African government help ease crisis there. In Angola, theme good governing practices oil, strategic concern United States given many inroads China made elsewhere Africa hunger natural resources. In Congo, Mrs. Clinton passionate need end nation's rape epidemic. "The secretary's visit heart world's deadliest war zone eastern Congo potential game-changer conflict," said John Prendergast, founder Washington-based Enough project. "Her commitment addressing root causes conflict minerals power electronics industry refreshing contrast usual disaster sympathy tourism visiting dignitaries." "Now," added, "comes hard part: making good promises living high expectations engendered visit." In Nigeria, Mrs. Clinton pressed electoral changes. In Liberia, praised country's president, Ellen Johnson Sirleaf, woman Africa elected head state. The Liberian visit special warmth, almost like meeting long-lost cousins. Liberia founded 19th century freed American slaves, country's flag, people's names even police uniforms plastic- brimmed hats reminiscent American versions. Mrs. Clinton received possibly exuberant welcome there, Liberian man long wooden horn followed around visit, blowing loud funny noises whenever said something striking. "I love - horn - I want take guy wherever I go," said. In Cape Verde, Mrs. Clinton seemed bones pick. For once, said, cheat sheet country included list far positives negatives. The country fewer 500,000 people escaped turmoil engulfed much Africa. The all-inclusive, poolside buffet resorts feel like something found Canci.ln Bahamas. Mrs. Clinton called Cape Verde "a model democracy economic progress Africa." On Friday, every stop, started speech saying, "I bring greetings President Obama." She called "son Africa" said Obama administration, United States determined help Africa reach promise. #4# UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05759228 Date: 06/30/2015

Afghan speech FOR IMMEDIATE RELEASE September 11, 2009 Contact: Senator Levin's Office Phone: 202.224.6221 Senate Floor Speech - Surge Afghan Army Remarks prepared delivery Today mark solemn anniversary. Eight years ago morning, nation attacked terrorist extremists motivated hatred bent destruction. It always appropriate remember shock day, innocent lives lost, efforts nation made since day ensure Afghanistan, nation hosted terrorists, cannot become safe haven terrorists seeking attack us. But today especially appropriate occasion take stock efforts, consider best continue them. I recently returned trip Afghanistan, I joined colleagues Senators Jack Reed Ted Kaufman. The situation Afghanistan serious. Security deteriorated. But take right steps, ensure Afghanistan revert Taliban-friendly government could provide safe haven al Qaeda terrorize us world. The Obama administration's new strategy, focusing securing Afghan population's safety partnering Afghan security forces effort, important start reversing situation Afghanistan. The change strategy led forces, words General McChrystal's Counterinsurgency Guidance, "live, eat train together [with Afghan security forces], plan operate together, depend one another, hold accountable....and treat equal partners success." The Guidance goes say success Afghan security forces "is goal." • UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05759468 Date: 06/30/2015 UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05759468 Date: 06/30/2015 To achieve goal increase accelerate efforts support Afghan security forces efforts become self-sufficient delivering security nation — consider whether increase U.S. combat forces levels already planned next months. Counseling That Helps Dying Live By Devin Talbott Strobe Talbott Saturday, August 29, 2009 Many opponents health-care reform concentrated fire provision House legislation would provide government reimbursement doctors offer end-of-life counseling. How society deals confronting death understandably controversial. Unfortunately, debate degenerated cacophony demagoguery distortion, including invocations Hitler fear-mongering "death panels." As result attacks, number senators key determining bill emerge Congress abandoned support end-of-life counseling. Our family's experience year provided vivid perspective value service misguidedness campaign it. Brooke Shearer <http://www.washingtonpost.com/wp- dyn/content/article/2009/05/19/AR2009051903475.html> -- wife, mother grandmother -- fighting cancer year. She undergone major surgery, numerous scans biopsies, two debilitating courses chemotherapy. Her doctors among best fields. Their expertise not, however, extend fine points of, latest advances in, pain management. Brooke determined maintain highest possible quality life family whatever time together. With goal mind, sought advice treatment palliative-care specialists Washington Home Community Hospices. Their ingenuity skill adjusting medications significantly alleviated discomfort final months. Working closely primary physicians, hospice staff helped Brooke anticipate likely course disease way allowed make decisions exercise degree control condition family's adjustment it. When oncologist concluded chemotherapy working, Brooke put fully hands Washington Home outpatient. Regular house calls hospice doctors, nurses social workers enabled stay active professional projects, spend time friends family, end life home, considerable comfort us. Original Message From: Mills, Cheryl D <MillsCD@state.gov> To: H Sent: Mon Sep 07 16:09:23 2009 Subject: FW: 2-page memo contracting FYI — I Caitlin looking entire book: see b/I From: Slaughter, Anne-Marie Sent: Monday, September 07, 2009 12:20 PM To: Mills, Cheryl D; Sullivan, Jacobi Cc: Abedin, Huma Subject: 2-page memo contracting Jake Cheryl, Allison Stanger professor Middlebury book coming contracting — spent last 3 years tracking data full scope contracting problem anyone else done sophisticated thinking need do. But meantime, given issue current right now, I thought S might benefit reading this. AM Smart-Sourcing Diplomacy Development While Americans know it, business foreign policy increasingly private hands. In 2000, State Department spent $1.3 billion contracts $102.5 million grants. By 2008, grant spending grown $2.5 billion contract spending grown $5.6 billion. In 2000, USAID spent $0 grants[1] $478.6 million contracts. By 2008, figures climbed $5.2 billion $3.2 billion, respectively (source: USAspending.gov[2]). UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05759571 Date: 06/30/2015 UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05759571 Date: 06/30/2015 Contracting still perceived something peripheral policy itself, contracting grants comprise 75 percent State's total budget, 2008, clearly longer case. The privatization trend predates Bush Administration part appropriate response globalization's possibilities generally changing nature American power. But last eight years, laissez-faire outsourcing execute two ambitious wars carried day, oversight management often outsourced well implementation. Today, State Department especially USAID dependent contractors, outsourcing, turn, remade work environment federal employees. Negative consequences private sector granted power without responsibility, diminished overtaxed DSS, demoralized USAID, looming catastrophe Iraq Afghanistan, reconstruction money first flowed everyone's pockets except ordinary citizens. What done? Smart-sourcing, in-sourcing To align practices interests, centrality outsourcing contemporary business government must properly acknowledged. America's allies today include range non-governmental actors, for-profit non- profit, recipients taxpayer dollars. While policy something government devised (the "what") contractors executed (the "how"), longer case information age. Especially development realm, success failure today turns US strategy, effectively places web non-governmental personnel key policy-making positions. Since development democracy demand engagement employment local populations, turning clock back bringing whatever possible back house would therefore cure worse disease. We don't need new prescription glasses; need new eye chart. A smart-sourcing approach defines "how" policy strategic issue proceeds two fronts simultaneously. First, smart-sourcing means building capacity managing OMB's July guidelines contracting call multi- sector workforce. State Department contracting, programming, information technology functions must redefined collaborative ventures, State might effectively orchestrate mission-oriented networks across public-private divide. Second, smart-sourcing involves identifying tasks never outsourced bringing back in-house. It may easiest in-source according political expediency, temptation must avoided. Clear guidelines limits outsourcing must delineated strategic rather ad hoc choices made. Both reforms virtue directly advancing objectives outlined OMB Director Peter Orszag's July memoranda. More specifically, State Department committed smart-sourcing should: Support promote OMB efforts improve contracts grants data quality, well development USA spending.gov include subcontracts subgrants. Transparency accountability critical values smart-sourcing orientation, anti-corruption efforts abroad enhanced credibility perceived upholding values home. UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05759571 Date: 06/30/2015 UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05759571 Date: 06/30/2015 Restructure USAID capacity manage contracts well write checks. Capacity involves FTE counts. State needs recruit, train, retain workforce twenty-first century network managers ensure quality work stages given project. Rebuild DSS State phase reliance armed contractors war zones. Our current practices blur line legitimate illegitimate use force, terrorists want. Craft contracts employ foreigners trying help. Sustainable development follows bottom-up engagement local populations, top-down advice US experts. A sense local ownership often best fostered foreign nationals written contracts grants rather directly employed USG. Consider lessons MCC expanded contributions NGO community charting USAID's future. Both devolve decision-making local level involve less prominent USG footprint. If organizations like Clinton Global Initiative Gates Foundation advance American interests effectively traditional direct government intervention, overseas direct investment may dated policy instrument. Follow money identify DOD reconstruction contracts rightfully belonged State's domain bolster already compelling argument greater civilian resources. There smart power without smart-sourcing. Bottom line: The information revolution rendered big government vs. small government debates beside point. To paraphrase President Obama's inaugural address, don't need big State Department small State Department State Department works. A smart-sourcing approach reform strengthen operational link policy resources, enabling State exploit networks disposal ways advance interests United States. Nothing could strategic. Sinek UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05759586 Date: 06/30/2015 UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05759586 Date: 06/30/2015 We sad spreading news passing Marion Sinek, beloved mother, grandmother, friend, tireless public servant. She believed dignity human being, respect all, social justice, family. The following text formal announcement passing: Marion Sinek passed away peacefully August 17, 2009 age 78 long illness. She born Berlin, Germany, came US beginning WWII. She graduated Forest Hills High School Syracuse University full scholarship. After graduate work London School Economics, worked Radio Free Europe UN Association-USA NY. Marion became active public affairs, serving various roles League Women voters, including President LWV NY State. She later ran office, serving eight years Town Board member New Castle becoming Supervisor 2000 2004. She later worked Sen. Hillary Clinton's office election law issues, remained active Democratic politics organizations. She served Compensation Advisory Panel Westchester County Board Legislators, served boards The Chappaqua Orchestra Holocaust Human Rights Education Center. She lived Chappaqua almost 38 years. She predeceased husband Herbert; survived children Ron Nicole (Arnaboldi), spouses Jennifer Leo, seven grandchildren. Burial private. A memorial held September. In lieu flowers, donations memory may made Memorial Sloan-Kettering Cancer Center. We know join us mourning passing wonderful human being. Nicole Sinek Arnaboldi Ron Sinek Leo Arnaboldi Jennifer Sinek Peter Arnaboldi Brenton Arnaboldi Andrew Arnaboldi Heather Sinek Meg Sinek Connor Sinek Adrian Arnaboldi UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05759586 Date: 06/30/2015 UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05759586 Date: 06/30/2015 UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05759586 Date: 06/30/2015

Original Message From: Minyon Moore To: bstrider Cc: H Sent: Tue Sep 08 15:58:11 2009 Subject: FW: BusinessWeek's "Best Places Launch Career" BusinessWeek Ranks Department State #5 Best Place Launch Career: The Department ranked top among federal agencies #5 among employers one best places begin career. The ranking based three-part methodology includes combined survey data careers services directors, undergraduate students, employers. For information, please visit http://www.businessweek.com/magazine/toc/09_37/B4146career.htm?chan=magazine+channel_top+stories <http://www.businessweek.com/magazine/toc/09_37/B4146careerhtm?chan=magazine+channel_top+stories> Burns, We missed calling. FOR IMMEDIATE RELEASE DELOITTE & TOUCHE TOPS BUSINESSWEEK'S ANNUAL LIST OF "BEST PLACES TO LAUNCH A CAREER" New York, New York, September 3, 2009— The big four accounting firms dominate BusinessWeek's fourth annual ranking "Best Places Launch Career." Deloitte & Touche jumped No.1 spot, unseating Ernst & Young ranked No.2. PricewaterhouseCoopers KPMG took third fourth spot, respectively. UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05759596 Date: 06/30/2015 UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05759596 Date: 06/30/2015 With rich benefits, extensive training programs, combined recruiting effort makes 10,000 hires even tough year, Big Four hard beat, Deloitte harder most. With substantially higher pay-18% Deloitte's entry-level hires year earn north $65,000—plus industry's biggest signing bonuses generous time-off policy, it's wonder Deloitte favorite students career services directors. It doesn't hurt Deloitte's entry-level hiring took smallest hit year, 1.1% first half compared double-digit drops No.2 Ernst & Young No.4 KPMG. To compile ranking, BusinessWeek polled 60 college career services directors across country; collected data survey 60,000 U.S. undergrads Universum USA, Philadelphia research company; required employers submit statistics everything pay benefits training programs retention. The number ranked employers sharply year, owing decision raise bar eligibility. And tougher competition—combined handful new employers shifts sentiment among students career services directors—resulted shakeup standings. Some companies, including No.11 Accenture No.19 Prudential moved 35 spots, No.34 Marriott No.48 Lockheed Martin 28 40 spots, respectively. Even top 10 underwent big changes year. Marriott Lockheed out, Google, declined participate. But three new employers entered winner's circle. The State Dept. Teach For America, places college grads troubled school districts, midst ramped-up recruiting campaigns, J.P. Morgan, unit ofJPMorgan Chase, reaped survivor's benefit: It's one big investment banks left standing. BusinessWeek's "Best Places Launch Career" ranking September 14, 2009 issue, newsstands September 4th. Expanded content available BusinessWeek.com, including full methodology, profiles employer, interactive table, slide shows, video roundtable recruiters. As young man, McLaughlin known love outdoors dinner table quips entertained family. As young adult, attended Sarah Lawrence College studied theater moved friend New York City, following college. His family said McLaughlin never lost zest adventure, regularly white water rafting, skydiving, backpacking studying Karate. McLaughlin later moved San Francisco, met wife Lauren married July 2002. His short film "Shadow Puppets Doom" shown film festivals won "Best Screenplay" award Mann County Film Festival, family said. At time death filming pilot reality television show. Let's speak time. Rep. Joe Wilson's Rebel Yell Inside racist klavern Joe Wilson joined By Max Blumenthal Since Republican Rep. Joe Wilson South Carolina bellowed President Barack Obama, "You lie!" president's nationally televised speech healthcare, fourth term backbencher emerged hero among conservative grassroots. One enthusiastic endorsements Wilson's histrionics came Sons Confederate Veterans (SCV), group Wilson <a href=http://crooksandliars.com/david-neiwert/obama-heckler- joe-wilson-member-neo>belonged to</a> several years. "Mr. Wilson, never apologize allowing love truth overrun desire polite," SCV Tea Party <a href=http://scvteaparty.com/?p=165>declared</a> website. "It liar must apologize, one identifies liar!" Who SCV? A once-proud organization Confederate history buffs re-enactors spent organization's money restore Civil War-era battlefields Confederate cemeteries, 2006 SCV substantially <a href=http://www.spIcenter.org/intel/intelreport/article.jsp?pid=1027 >taken over</a> organized cadre white supremacist radicals (read <a href=http://www.spIcenter.org/intel/intelreport/article.jsp?pid=154 >here</a> background) sought turn nation's oldest Southern historical society veteran white supremacist activist Kirk Lyons called "a modern, 21st century Christian war machine capable uniting Confederate community leading ultimate victory." When racist junta seized much SCV's leadership positions, Southern Poverty Law Center released <a UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05759668 Date: 06/30/2015 UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05759668 Date: 06/30/2015 href=http://www.spIcenter.org/intel/intelreport/article.jsp?sid=90 >extensive list</a> SCV officials belonged "hate groups." Lyons, key leader white supremacists took SCV, <a href=http://www.thenation.com/doc/20050829/blumenthal/single >harbored dreams</a> creating seemingly benign front group sophisticated version Ku Klux Klan. "I great respect Klan historically, but, sadly Klan today ineffective sometimes even destructive," Lyons told German neo-Nazi magazine 1992. "It would good Klan followed advice former Klansman Robert Miles: 'Become invisible. Hang robes hoods cupboard become underground org anization." With SCV, Lyons discovered didn't go underground all. Once Lyons helped install close friend, Ron Wilson, president SCV, organization's political newsletter, <a href=http://fpacscv.org/southernmercury/ >The Southern Mercury</a> (where Wilson served senior editor), transformed propaganda mill crude white supremacist cant. Mailed dues-paying members SCV — presumably including Rep. Joe Wilson — went defunct 2008, Mercury published articles describing blacks genetically inferior whites, calling African-Americans "a childlike people," warned Obama runs re-election, race riots "exceedingly violent nature" would immediately ensure, leaving "entire sections cities ruins." Here highlights Southern Mercury: "After turn 20th century, white Southerners disfranchised segregated blacks, perhaps mildest reaction possible at=2 Othat time blacks' transgressions. The blacks — childlike people — selling votes Democrats en masse $.25 apiece national elections." —"Where We Stand Now, And How We Got Here," Frank Conner, Southern Mercury, September/October 2003 "Previously, anthropologists routinely recorded notable differences IQ among races; Columbia, liberal cultural anthropologist named Franz Boas...decreed differences IQ among races, biological differences blacks whites superficial nature... Meanwhile, liberals media heaped special praise upon black athletes, musicians, singers, writers — treated typical black race. The liberals creating false image blacks America highly competent people held back prejudiced white Southerners." --Conner, September/October 2003 "It clear Barack Obama elected President, would extremely anti-white would demand reparations slavery press hard affirmative action degree would hurt young whites seeking jobs admission College Graduate Schools." — "Americans Face The Worst Presidential Candidates In History," Robert Slimp, Southern Mercury, May/June 2008 "I believe [Obama's] rhetoric anti-white legislative proposals would stir racial riots. If running re- election, riots would turn exceedingly violent nature would seriously damage race relations America, leave entire sections cities ruins." --Slimp, May/June 2008 Rep. Joe Wilson could resigned SCV soon organization's takeover open white supremacists began. But didn't. Or could withdrawn membership SCV's flagship journal turned racist rag. But didn't. Instead, serving state senator, Wilson led SCV-inspired campaign 2000 keep Confederate flag flying South Carolina's state capitol. "The Southern heritage, Confederate heritage, honorable," Wilson <a href=http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/americas/503579.stm>proclaimed</a> time, responding critics Confederate flag.
