Thanks Dan A New Approach Missile Defense By Hillary Clinton Iran's development short- medium-range ballistic missiles poses clear growing threat security European allies forces stationed region. That President Obama announced yesterday United States ready deploy missile defenses Europe specifically geared toward stopping missiles. This threat cannot ignore. Previous missile defense efforts focused protecting intercontinental ballistic missiles capable reaching United States, intelligence shows threat long-range weapons progressed quickly feared. In contrast, evidence indicates Iran developing short- medium- range missiles eventually enable target Europe, Caucuses Middle East, including U.S. NATO forces. We deeply appreciate willingness Czech Polish Governments host original missile defense architecture soil, decision deploy systems better meet growing threat came result long careful review policies, capabilities, requirements. This decision alter unshakeable commitment United States security vital NATO allies. Rather, reflects determination jointly meet threats endanger us all. UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05759705 Date: 06/30/2015 UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05759705 Date: 06/30/2015 The old focus long-range missile defense systems left significant gaps ability defend shorter-range threats, exposing allies forces stationed Europe. Many experts also expressed concerns testing record effectiveness long-range interceptors deployed Poland. Our new approach different number ways. First, use well-tested missile defense systems, Standard Missile-3, current threats. And unlike old fixed, silo-based interceptors, mobile able shift threats evolve. Second, previous efforts sought by-pass NATO favor bilateral agreements, Obama Administration plans make coordination NATO central element approach. By working allies build workable cost-effective missile defense system Europe, better contribute protection NATO allies increase regional stability. For 60 years, NATO alliance force peace, prosperity security Europe around world commitment collective security: attack one ally attack all. An attack London Warsaw attack New York Washington. NATO demonstrated commitment September 11 terrorist attacks, first time, alliance invoked Article V NATO sent assets United States help protect us additional terrorist attacks. Unfortunately, old long-range defense plan created impression "two-tiers" security within alliance focusing theoretical threats could one day affect mainland United States, leaving European allies vulnerable real short- medium-range missiles. Our new plan corrects imbalance. We continue monitor counter longer-term threats, work allies protect NATO territory. We focus imminent threat, also developing capacity adjust quickly threat evolves. Finally, engage Russia part new approach. Russia also vulnerable Iran's short- medium- range missiles seek cooperate address common threat. I pleased Russians agreed Moscow Summit joint threat assessment ballistic missile challenges 21st century, including Iran. This positive first step I look forward future progress. In short, new missile defense plan realistic threats face, reliable tools use, inclusive allies pledged protect. While pursue new path, also redouble diplomatic efforts engage Iran focus leaders clear choice: whether join international community responsible member continue path isolation. But security allies forces cannot wait. That moving ahead new approach missile defense. 728 words UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05759705 Date: 06/30/2015

UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05759768 Date: 06/30/2015 RELEASE IN PART B6 From: H <hrod17@clintonemail.com> Sent: Sunday, September 20, 2009 7:32 PM To: 'sta Ibott Subject: Re: MD oped I'm proud company we're keeping! Thx chance speak Brookings. All best, H Original Message From: Strobe Talbott To: H2 Sent: Sun Sep 20 14:14:26 2009 Subject: FW: MD oped Apparently can't get away me. We're sharing FT op-ed page tomorrow. Here's piece.... Thanks Friday. Much favorable comment. Good luck UNGA. President Barack Obama's announcement new system protecting America's allies Iranian missiles ignited charges scaling back one inherited George W. Bush concession Russians. In fact, Obama plan big improvement Bush one, designed counter evolving Iranian threat, mollify Russian anxieties. Mr Bush's decision put 10 missile interceptors Poland associated radar Czech Republic based concern Iran developing long-range rockets could hit US. The Bush system would less effective shorter-range Iranian missiles, would left much Europe, notably including America's ally Turkey, unprotected. Over last several years, Iranians shifted efforts developing long-range rockets deploying large numbers shorter-range ones pose immediate danger southeastern Europe Middle East, well US forces stationed there. Unlike Mr Bush's, Mr Obama's plan quickly field missile-defence capability address existing threat. It upgraded deal longer-range Iranian missiles future. The Central Europeans reacted decision apprehension alarm recognize replacement conceptually flawed plan credible one strengthens bonds transatlantic defence. The view Moscow clouded outright paranoia. Military experts suspected US rockets Poland, advertised defensive, could used offensively, even pre-emptively, Russia. Laying rest far-fetched scenario prime motivation Mr Obama's decision, been. However, removing gratuitous irritant bilateral relations, president improved prospects US- Russian arms control negotiations underway Geneva. Those talks could produce December new treaty reducing numbers strategic — is, intercontinental — weapons. If ratified US Senate (which easy, given ferocity partisan wars Washington), US Russia track reductions future. Mr Obama Russian President Dmitri Medvedev, due meet New York week, jointly called eventual goal eliminating nuclear weapons. As successors take steps direction, grapple stark paradox nuclear age: mutual deterrence depends side vulnerable retaliation other. If either side enough defences trump side's offence, mutuality deterrence breaks one sides hair-trigger, making war likely crisis. UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05759768 Date: 06/30/2015 UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05759768 Date: 06/30/2015 American statesmen pounded inescapable truth heads initially sceptical Soviet counterparts 40 years ago. The result Anti-Ballistic Missile (ABM) treaty signed Richard Nixon Leonid Brezhnev 1972. By limiting defensive capability superpowers, ABM treaty necessary companion piece series treaties setting ceilings offensive weaponry. Because nuclear weapons expected us forever, ABM treaty meant last perpetuity. While Soviets converted logic restricting defence, Ronald Reagan not. The late US president championed development space-based comprehensive shield would make offensive weapons — therefore mutual deterrence —"impotent obsolete." Many experts believed Reagan's vision, derisively nicknamed Star Wars, impossible dream. So successor, George H. W. Bush, treated program benign neglect negotiating Russians Strategic Arms Reduction Talks (START) begun Mr Reagan. The second president Bush reversed father's policy. He greatly weakened START process, pulled US ABM treaty sought revive national missile defence (NMD) system. His decision build interceptor radar sites Poland Czech Republic was, one aides told time, large measure "pouring concrete eventually global NMD." Key officials Obama administration — including president himself, studied arms control college — understand linkage reduction offences regulation defences. However, avoided raising issue context last week's decision. That partly want plan judged merits, vis-à-vis Iranian threat. But enough fights Republicans without energizing right wing trying reinstate principles ABM treaty. Yet sooner later US administration grasp nettle regulating strategic defences. Otherwise, continued reductions strategic nuclear offences either impossible or, worse, dangerous. The author president Brookings Institution. Susman Job Description Personal Assistant Ambassador The incumbent serves Personal Assistant Ambassador United States Court St. James's London, UK. The American Embassy London one State Department's largest important missions, providing key diplomatic platform 20 USG agencies hosting 15,000 official American visitors per year, including numerous Presidential Vice-Presidential trips, Congressional Delegations, Cabinet-level visits. The incumbent reports directly Ambassador maintains close confidential working relationship Ambassador. He/she assists Ambassador prioritizing managing many demands time attention, carrying special projects assigned Ambassador. Ideally, incumbent prior relevant work experience Ambassador, thus knowledge Ambassador's professional preferences style. The incumbent coordinates her/his work Ambassador's Office Management Specialist others needed. Major Duties Responsibilities Assists Ambassador correspondence contacts wide range associates. From prior experience, determines items correspondence require priority treatment personal touch Ambassador. Drafts correspondence factors mind makes recommendations types communication, i.e., phone call personal note, would appropriate, given Ambassador's relationship interlocutor. Helps Ambassador add personal touches remarks speeches, outside audiences Embassy staff. Suggests relevant references examples Ambassador's prior professional experience assist carrying priorities Embassy Administration. Helps bring Ambassador's experience unique voice planning documents, Chief Mission statement Mission Program Plan. Best, Matt Somalia faces worst food crisis 18 years: UN (AFP) – 1 day ago ROME — Drought, conflict displacement causing worst humanitarian crisis war-torn Somalia 18 years, UN food agency warned Monday. Some 3.6 million people, half Somali population, need emergency aid including 1.3 million people displaced fighting Horn Africa country, Food Agriculture Organisation said statement. Around 1.4 million Somali farmers face severe drought, 655,000 poor urban dwellers face high prices basic food staples, FAO said. Hundreds thousands Somalis fled homes past three years violence involving hardline Islamist movements many total country's 18 years almost uninterrupted civil chaos. Hunger also stalks countries east Africa Horn Africa region, UN agency said. UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05759850 Date: 06/30/2015 UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05759850 Date: 06/30/2015 CNPC, won bid January develop North Azadegan oilfield, holds 70 percent share project NICO holding 20 percent, lnpex Japan remaining 10 percent. The South Azadegan project slated produce 260,000 barrels crude oil per day, development cost around $2.5 billion. The field, along Iraqi border, holds reserves estimated approximately 42 billion barrels oil, one world's largest finds last 30 years. Iran provides 14 percent China's demand oil. The deal couched buy-back terms, CNPC hand operation field NIOC development receive payments oil production years cover investment. China's investment Iran's energy sector increased western countries, led US, sanctioned Iran peaceful nuclear program. Afghan authorities imposed ban Tuesday two decrees, first barring journalists reporting violence country 6:00 a.m. 8:00 p.m. (0130-1530 GMT) polling day. The second ordered journalists stay away scenes attacks. The government says measures intended prevent reports violence scaring Afghans away voting. Taliban fighters vowed disrupt election.• The United Nations said Afghans right information, restricting media could undermine confidence poll. "People need access information, polling day polling day. The credibility elections directly linked information access to," said Aleem Siddique, spokesman U.N. mission Kabul. "Its unclear us legal basis would directive Afghanistan's constitution guarantees freedom expression freedom press. We making point Afghan authorities," said Wednesday. Afghan police taken aggressive attitude towards reporters recent days. Several journalists beaten police scene suicide car bombing Tuesday siege gunmen Wednesday. The Secretary's Call Sheet Iraqi Foreign Minister Hoshyar Zebari Purpose Call: To express condolences regarding deaths Iraqi MFA personnel August 19 attack Iraqi Foreign Ministry. want personally express heartfelt condolences savage attack Iraqi Ministry Foreign Affairs today tragic loss many Iraqi lives around Baghdad particularly Ministry Foreign Affairs. El I remember fondly meeting MFA April — I proud first senior U.S. official attend meeting there, I deeply saddened hear Ministry attacked. CI This trying day Iraqis Government Iraq, brutal attacks like deepen need dedicated Iraqi like Ministry, remain committed new Iraq. 0 Know United States continue stand Iraq faces challenges. Background: On Wednesday, August 19, appears series VBIED additional rocket attacks Baghdad resulted bloodiest day Baghdad since June 30 withdrawal U.S. forces urban areas. Although exact numbers confirmed, media reporting approximately 75 people killed across Baghdad 100 injuries. The devastating attack appears Iraqi MFA, VBIED exploded front main gate. Zebari's Chief Staff estimated 35-40 fatalities 40 injuries resulting attack, 70% building damaged. In April, first senior U.S. official hold meeting MFA. Deputy Foreign Minister Labid Abbawi, attended meeting MFA who's wife led meeting Iraqi war widows, reportedly slightly injured quite shaken attack. He may lost number staff members. I've thought and, I silver bullet, thoughts. -- My impression Pakistanis cooperative lately assisting us target AQ Pakistan that, hold back, less function affinity toward AQ AQ imbedded.. -- In particular, seem reluctant target AQ nestled groups want cultivate event "leave" Afghanistan need influence there. Assuming adequate intelligence, go bank accounts, travel reachable assets individual Pakistani officers, raising stakes supporting militants without creating inordinate backlash. Blunter measures coercion, like conditioning assistance, likely counterproductive. Given level distrust us among Pakistani people, would see another sharp swing U.S. pendulum would harden attitudes make greater cooperation difficult Pakistani people accept. -- There may greater leverage giving Pakistanis incentives aggressive. Of course, military's calculation important. I'm sure shopping list days would need balance would move needle AQ undercutting effort get shift strategic focus away India.. At time, forward leaning possible support counterinsurgency capabilities (equipment, training, whatever material, intelligence assistance give move Wazeristan -- including relief displaced persons). If finally take step, possible demonstrate arrows aligned theirs.. -- On civilian side, desire greater control Kerry-Lugar money used played strategic advantage. If give greater sense directing use funds -- without greatly undercutting effectiveness -- strengthens position press AQ. UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05760082 Date: 06/30/2015 UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05760082 Date: 06/30/2015 -- Finally, defining relationship India. Are measures Indians could take would reduce Pakistani anxieties Indian front thus better enable focus threats East, including AQ anti-Indian militant groups like LET? Are confidence building measures information sharing troop movements would reduce uncertainty support Pakistani public narrative shift emphasis India militancy? To extent India seeks Pakistan move vigorously militants, could see steps advancing interests. This tricky territory may worth pursuing. Sandy UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05760082 Date: 06/30/2015

Nicholas Watt <http://www.guardian.co.uk/profile/nicholaswatt>, Patrick Wintour <http://www.guardian.co.uk/profile/patrickwintour> Allegra Stratton <http://www.guardian.co.uk/profile/allegrastratton> guardian.co.uk <http://www.guardian.co.uk>, Wednesday 4 November 2009 21.30 GMT The Conservatives <http://www.guardian.co.uk/politics/conservatives> accused French government tonight "castrating" Britain's position within EU adopting "autistic" approach would take Britain radar. Speaking Guardian, Pierre Lellouche, France's Europe minister, described "pathetic" Tories' EU plans announced today, warning would succeed "for minute". Giving vent frustration across EU, far expressed private, Lellouche — said reflecting Nicolas Sarkozy's "sadness regret" — accused William Hague, shadow foreign secretary, "bizarre autism" discussions. He said: "They one line repeat one line. It bizarre sense autism." Lellouche, one Anglophile members Sarkozy's government, made remarkable intervention David Cameron <http://www.guardian.co.uk/politics/davidcameron> outlined fresh Tory approach EU wake full ratification Lisbon treaty. A future Conservative government would seek strengthen British sovereignty repatriate series powers social employment legislation, Tory leader said. Cameron said seeking immediate "bust-up" EU, would allow repatriation powers negotiations last long five years. But position enough Tory MEP Daniel Hannan, quit role party's legal affairs spokesman Europe, saying intended fight referendums enable Britain become "self-governing". France's centre-right government condemned Cameron's plans, saying would marginalise Britain within EU. Abandoning diplomatic niceties, Lellouche said: "It's pathetic. It's sad see Britain, important Europe, cutting rest disappearing radar map .... This culture opposition ... It result long period opposition. I know come back, I hope trip short." He said Cameron's approach line Tories' decision abandon main centre-right EPP grouping European parliament, Sarkozy's UMP party member. "They done European parliament. They essentially castrated UK influence European parliament," said. Lellouche said told Hague personally position "waste time us". "I told William Hague: go away two three years, political economic situation you're going self you'll come back. Go ahead it. That message ... You want marginalised? Well, go it. But it's waste time us," French minister said. Lellouche made clear Tories hope securing support plans. "It's going happen minute. Nobody going indulge rewriting [treaties for] many, many years. Nobody going play institutions again. It's going take leave honest say that," said. "It time tumultuous waters around us. Wars, terrorism, proliferation, Afghanistan, energy Russia, massive immigration, economic crisis. It time destiny Europe defined — whether exist third world's GDP capable fighting climateion trade, every ... issue surface Earth. "We need united, otherwise wiped marginalised. None us alone. Whether you're big small, lesson same. And [Britain's] risk one marginalisation. Irrelevance." He explained: "Finally institutional package, took 15 years looking navel getting everybody bored death sterile debate" In sign France's determination resist Tory plans opt key EU legislation, Lellouche warned French would attempt reduce Britain's EU budget rebate negotiation next parliament. He pointed France net EU contributor tune €5bn (E4.5bn), unlike Britain receives rebate. "If get government ferociously anti European vote kind legislation I think relationship going difficult. Sid CONFIDENTIAL November 5, 2009 For: Hillary From: Sid Re: Agenda Merkel The Transatlantic Economic Council Chancellor Angela Merkel's major initiative Germany held EU presidency 2007. She got President George W. Bush agree formation. But council languishes. Has US appointed representative? The council coordinating regulatory matters trade, way. State could work up. http://www.europolitics.info/dossiers/usa-obama/transatlantic-economic-council-facing-uncertain-future-art147529- 77.html EUROPOLITICS / USA Obama <http://www.europolitics.info/europolitics/usa-obama.html> Imprimer l'article <javascript:print();> I Imprimer cet article <javascript:print();> Trade Transatlantic Economic Council facing uncertain future By Brian Beary Washington I Friday 16 January 2009 As Barack Obama coasting victory last November, leader Socialist MEPs, Martin Schulz, urged "make sure Europe top in-tray". Two months on, considerable doubt whether Obama indeed take advice leave Europe lingering towards bottom pile. Nowhere danger striking UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05760155 Date: 06/30/2015 UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05760155 Date: 06/30/2015 Transatlantic Economic Council (TEC), body German Chancellor Angela Merkel persuaded President George Bush set April 2007 remove regulatory barriers transatlantic trade. STILL NO TEC CHAIR Obama widely praised moving quickly, comparison previous new presidents, nominate new administration. Yet spokesman told Europolitics still appointed future co-chair TEC. In interim, Michelle O'Neill, Deputy Undersecretary Department Commerce, tasked ensuring continuity. The EU Co-Chair Commission Vice-President Gunter Verheugen. Given dozens nominations already announced, may sign among long list priorities, TEC, significant EU-US initiative emerge recent years, feature highly. It noted Obama chair Senate Subcommittee Europe, 2007 2008, organise single hearing, something rival presidential campaign, Senator Hillary Clinton, tried - failed - score political points. The Democrats, grown protectionist-minded trade, commanding majority US Senate House Representatives. Obama, Democrat, careful cultivate good relations take granted support, desperately needs push ambitious economic policy agenda. It Congress 2007 introduced 100% rule, requiring US-bound containers leaving European ports scanned loaded onto departing ship. This thorn EU's side ever since features TEC agenda. In current climate, Congress unlikely clamouring scrap rule may even wish extend 2012 implementation deadline EU asking. Anxious burn bridges, Obama could well go along Congress order avoid unnecessary fight. AMERICANS NOT SO HOT ON TRADE Congress' protectionism magically appear vacuum. It reflective mounting fears among US public impact free trade US jobs. Their fears entirely groundless. American manufacturing jobs indeed going overseas - notably India China. And unemployed US perilous predicament Europe government unemployment benefits less generous temporary. Moreover, Americans, unlike Europeans, health care paid employer lose job also lose health care. Hardly surprising, therefore, 59% Americans think trade good country, compared 78% French British, 80% Czechs 85% Germans, Pew Research Centre survey shown. This bearish sentiment knock-on effect trade dossiers. For example, makes Congress less amenable scrapping law requiring US airlines 'actual control' US citizens - something EU urging current Open Sky II aviation liberalisation talks. It makes US lawmakers likely take action prevent European companies winning lucrative US defence contracts. This happening already epic tussle Boeing Airbus Pentagon's US$35 billion refuelling tanker contract (see separate article). EU officials clinging hope Obama, president, adopt global outlook drag Democratic Congress along rather way around. A VICTIM OF DULLNESS? The TEC, despite failed deliver much many hoped for, remains extremely useful tool. By emphasising regulatory rather tariff barriers, shows understanding real problems lie today's trading environment. The EU US could use TEC create global standard hugely important sectors, toys food. "The alternative," Dan Hamilton, director Centre Transatlantic Relations Johns Hopkins University Washington notes, "is end Chinese standards". Yet TEC one weakness one underestimate: dullness. Discussing highly technical regulatory divergences, whether wash chickens chlorine water, may Chancellor Merkel's cup tea French President Nicolas Sarkozy showed little interest French EU Presidency. Without strong impetus someone Obama's team power make things happen, TEC - like old soldier - might actually die fade away. EU-US economy While much talk rising power China India, transatlantic economy still far outstrips rest world size wealth. The EU27 US accounted nearly 57% world gross domestic product 2007, transatlantic economy made 47% world exports 52% world imports. The net worth per household US US$565,000, France US$518,000, U.K. US$599,000, compared US$18,000 China, US$31,000 Russia US$44,000 Brazil. Cunningham - 10/06/09 03:45 PM ET UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05760158 Date: 07/31/2015 UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05760158 Date: 07/31/2015 You may never heard Under Secretary Commerce International Trade, Under Secretary Treasury International Affairs. You may vaguely assumed Deputy United States Trade Representative, Assistant Secretary State Western Hemisphere Affairs, ambassador Brazil, never thought much do. But ask American CEOs business leaders turn Washington help getting fair shake foreign markets untying global trade knots, learn officials rely on. Yet today, every export dollar trade-supported job essential America's economic recovery, key positions sit empty. And, surprisingly, five seats empty stalls behind-the-scenes maneuvers Senate Republicans — usually key allies U.S. business. In case, names went months ago. The nominees strong credentials many demonstrated strong bipartisan support. The reasons holds delays vary. But even blocking actions unrelated, collectively deny American businesses effective overseas advocates. •Miriam Sapiro, unanimously approved Finance Committee July Deputy United States Trade Representative responsibility trade agreements enforcement Europe Americas (including NAFTA), one-man hold Sen. Jim Bunning (R-Ky.) Canadian tobacco bill. •Arturo Valenzuela, nominee Assistant Secretary State Western Hemisphere, overwhelmingly approved Senate Foreign Relations Committee July, Sen. Jim DeMint (R-S.C.) one-man hold Valenzuela protest administration's Honduras policy. •Thomas Shannon, nominee ambassador Brazil, also blocked Sen. DeMint Honduras. Shannon hardly political, career foreign service officer President Bush's top official Latin America NSC State Department. •Francisco Sanchez, nominated April Under Secretary Commerce International Trade, responsible advancing U.S. export trade opportunities around world. Republican staff Sen. Chuck Grassley (R-Iowa) Finance Committee repeatedly delayed hearing. •Lael Brainard, nominated March Under Secretary Treasury International Affairs, also held Republican staff Finance Committee. With empty chair powerful position — previously held future Treasury Secretaries Timothy Geithner Lawrence Summers — ability coordinate response financial crisis hampered time can't afford it. Who hurt holds staff delays? Certainly president, facing worst economic crisis 50 years, stalled trade agenda, economic political turmoil many parts Latin America, including hot-button crisis Honduras. But U.S. businesses also hurt. When American companies find commercial trade disputes abroad, face unfair competition foreign companies discriminatory practices regulators, turn directly roster above. With chairs empty, U.S. businesses problems abroad find facing classic Goldilocks problem — Cabinet secretaries big (and busy), officials small impact right levels. Moreover, international economic issues greatest interest U.S. businesses precisely ones hampered vacancies: balanced coordinated growth Great Recession, promotion job- generating U.S. exports, delayed trade agreements Colombia Panama, barriers Brazil's huge market, trade tensions Canada (our largest trading partner) security border issues Mexico (our second-largest), among many others. Huma Abed Original Message From: Philippe Reines To: H Cc: CDM Sent: Thu Nov 05 05:50:54 2009 Subject: Time ; Jake Sullivan I've attached gorgeous cover PDF Hillary's Moment: Clinton Faces World By Joe Klein Time Magazine Wednesday, Nov. 04, 2009 It Halloween night Jerusalem, Benjamin Netanyahu came dressed peacemaker. "We're prepared start peace talks immediately," notoriously reluctant Israeli Prime Minister proclaimed, U.S. Secretary State Hillary Clinton standing side, poker-faced. "I think ... get get it." It ploy, course. The Palestinians tangled themselves, yet again. They elections looming, leader, Mahmoud Abbas, hang tough: demanding total freeze Israeli settlement-building West Bank — precisely Obama Administration previously said favored. Netanyahu offering partial freeze, including new settlements East Jerusalem, desired capital future Palestinian state. This nonstarter Palestinians, holographic glow step forward. It "unprecedented" offer, Netanyahu trumpeted, joy chess master springing trap.(See photos 60 years Israel.) It tough moment Clinton, playing second fiddle Bibi-does-Gandhi show. President Barack Obama softened language settlements weeks earlier: instead total freeze, talked Israeli "restraint" settlement-building. And Clinton seemed cement Administration's retreat, agreeing Netanyahu's proposal was, indeed, "unprecedented," even though U.S. still favored total freeze. The important thing, added, parties get table quickly possible. The onus back Palestinians — Palestinians quickly expressed outrage Obama Administration's retreat. Their Arab neighbors soon joined in, causing Clinton backtrack two days later, telling reporters Israeli plan "falls far short" U.S. expectations, although still insisted calling "unprecedented," neither diplomatic wise. Suddenly Obama Administration seemed wobbly Middle East; clearly, Clinton bullish Netanyahu's proposal (which negotiated months Middle East envoy George Mitchell seen, privately, Americans real progress). But Administration's mission get parties peace talks without preconditions. The Israelis favor talks. The Palestinians setting preconditions. And Clinton violated essential rule job: boring almost always better.(See photos life career former Secretary State Madeleine Albright.) Clinton's Three Qualities UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05760165 Date: 06/30/2015 UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05760165 Date: 06/30/2015 For past 40 years, awkward Middle East press conference helped define job Secretary State. You go Jerusalem Ramallah; stand "guardedly optimistic" public; private, try move comma, Israelis Palestinians move semicolon block comma. The result almost always same: gridlock. The breakthroughs, come, emanate others. Walter Cronkite asks Anwar Sadat he'd willing go Jerusalem ... Sadat, everyone's surprise, says yes. The Israelis Palestinians hold secret meetings Oslo reach appears breakthrough — they're talking! — becomes another dead end. The job Secretary State thankless glamorous; ways, Department State, noble antique, still trying come terms invention telephone. In era Twitter haiku-messaging rules, diplomacy moves speed, requires nuanced complexity, literature. Power drifted State National Security Council Pentagon, especially wartime. Only Clinton's recent predecessors distinguished themselves. Henry Kissinger, National Security Adviser belatedly became Secretary State, Richard Nixon's schizophrenic alter ego; George Shultz strong policy voice Reagan Administration; James Baker clout George H.W. Bush's best friend world-class dealmaker. Most others frustrated forgettable. And yet Hillary Clinton we're talking — second popular American world, eternally compelling supremely talented character, subject constant speculation, walking headline. Her presence job makes crucial more. It cliché say naming Clinton, Obama brought popular potential opponent tent. The conventional wisdom, cynical half, thereby succeeded neutering her, theory bolstered Clinton's reticence first nine months job, special envoys like Mitchell Richard Holbrooke heavy lifting diplomacy. But naming Clinton, Obama also gave great power, cuts ways: becomes dissatisfied role Administration's policies, become torpedo aimed Oval Office. Colin Powell similar power real gripe — Iraq war — never used it. Clinton gripe, Obama Administration settles policy differences begin emerge among key players, Powell conundrum looms: How Clinton choose use power? How Obama react does? Traditionally, Secretary State judged ability formulate policy, negotiate deals manage striped-pants bureaucracy. Clinton history global strategist, although performance 2008 campaign indicates bit conservative President, foreign policy realist Wilsonian idealist. It also early judge skill manager negotiator — although performance Jerusalem indicates needs lessons Middle East Haggling 101. There are, however, three qualities could make memorable Secretary State. She brings vision departmental reform — need elevate foreign aid programs status rigorous scrutiny diplomacy — could change striped pants chinos developing world. She also first elected politician hold office since Edmund Muskie briefly Carter Administration, enabled better understand interact politicians run places like Afghanistan Pakistan. But important, international celebrity much higher profile recent predecessors ability — second President's — change negative attitudes U.S. abroad. She potential become powerful public diplomat U.S. fielded quite time, although performance far, home abroad, occasionally perplexing. At home, often seemed tentative deferential. In conversation Secretary Defense Robert Gates aired CNN early October, Clinton's cautious formality took backseat Gates' brisk, humorous confidence policy issues. Abroad, seems far confident, times point recklessness, Jerusalem. (See photos last days Hillary Clinton's campaign.) Independence Candor In last week October, Secretary Clinton moved squarely center world stage, attempting, behest special envoys, improve rocky alliance Pakistan nudge Middle East pugilists talks. In course trip, first stray wisps hint Clinton wanted begin asserting UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05760165 Date: 06/30/2015 UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05760165 Date: 06/30/2015 independence, Administration, facing roadblocks across world, struggled firmer foreign policy tone opening nine months might called Rodney King — "Can't get along?" — phase. During three days Pakistan, ran gauntlet town-hall meetings media interviews may unprecedented, use word week, U.S. Secretary State. The trip, planned Holbrooke Pakistan specialist Vali Nasr, offered unusually subtle itinerary U.S. diplomatic mission. A visit Sufi mosque bombed Sunni extremists, example, sent powerful message Pakistan's moderate Islamic majority. "We saw praying there," academic named Shala Aziz told me, "and, first time, I'm thinking, The Americans hearts."(See photos suicide bombings Islamabad.) The big news Clinton allowed hammered hostile questions students, talk-show hosts Pashtun elders — that, occasion, pushed back, raising incredibly sensitive issues, like one Pakistani government knew Osama bin Laden was, even though country since 2002. Press accounts either emphasized embarrassment Secretary State's getting pummeled fixed Clinton's undiplomatic bluntness. But missed point: candor, willingness listen acknowledge criticism, begun undermine prevailing Pakistani image U.S. arrogant bossy, interested Pakistani military fight war al-Qaeda Taliban true strategic partnership. The contrast especially sharp George W. Bush's eight years unqualified support military dictatorship Pervez Musharraf. "In past, Americans came, would talk generals go home," said Farahnaz Ispahani, government spokeswoman Member Parliament. "Clinton's willingness meet everyone, hostile not, made big impression — she's Hillary Clinton, real history affinity country, means much more." Transformative Experience There toasts state dinners Pakistan, alcohol. There opening statements, though, Clinton's — delivered impromptu first night trip tossing aside notes — surprisingly emotional. Earlier day, President Asif Ali Zardari, widower Benazir Bhutto, presented Secretary album photos first visit Pakistan, 1995, framed photo Bhutto two sons Clinton daughter Chelsea. "It bring tears eyes," Clinton said state dinner honor presidential palace, "because I admired wife. She gave life ..." She faltered then, choking up, quickly pulled together, talking "reasons — provide opportunities all." Clinton's first trip Pakistan First Lady 1995 transformative experience — beginning, I believe, process made plausible candidate Secretary State. I traveled trip; set off, seemed depressed even private usual. The Democrats cratered 1994 congressional elections, trounced efforts enact universal health care plan. It personal defeat; Clinton traveled country trying sell plan, crowds shouted cursed her. Privately admitted shocked hatred. The trip South Asia seemed bit vacation — Chelsea's spring break — also retreat demure, First Lady–like role two years health care policy czar, although proceeded decidedly wonky, Hillarian fashion. Jackie Kennedy gone India famously ridden elephant; Hillary Clinton traveled five countries packed schedule visits NG0s. "That greatest trip, unbelievable," Clinton says now. We sitting hotel suite day Jerusalem gaffe, Secretary electric-blue shift rather usual formal jacket pants. She wearing glasses appeared rather freckly without makeup. "I guess trip animated informed everything I've done since," said. She emerged trip reinvigorated, new mission. By end 1995, U.N. Conference Women Beijing, First Lady propounded new Clinton Doctrine: "Women's rights human rights."(See photos Beijing's changing skyline.) Clinton easy interview. She preternaturally cautious, consequence Methodist propriety 20 years insane public scrutiny. She like talk herself, tell one interesting story Bhutto. When husband governor Arkansas, Bill Chelsea visited London stood sidewalk outside UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05760165 Date: 06/30/2015 UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05760165 Date: 06/30/2015 Bhutto's hotel, waiting Pakistani Prime Minister arrive. "She wearing yellow embroidered shalwar kameez chiffon scarf. I fan, standing sidewalk everyone else. It time I ever anything like that," Clinton says. When Clinton Bhutto met formally, first day 1995 trip, hit immediately, part Bhutto also obsessed impact Islamist tide women children. I remember asking Bhutto day biggest change country past 25 years, said, "I used able walk street wearing jeans, without headscarf. Now I can't." When I asked why, said — bluntly — "The Saudis," aggressively funding religious schools. Of course, Bhutto's acquiescence to, participation in, general corruption Pakistani government part reason public schools inadequate madrasahs became popular. (See photos aftermath Benazir Bhutto's assassination 2007.) Ironically, rise Sunni extremist groups like al-Qaeda brought Clinton's interests — microfinance, education health care — center national-security policy first time. The impetus came State Department military, counterinsurgency doctrine demanded social services war zones — schools, justice, economic development — reinforce military's efforts secure population. As result, immediate chemistry Clinton General David Petraeus, author Army's counterinsurgency manual, became one prime military mentors served Senate Armed Services Committee. At one point, well Obama made presidential intentions known, I asked Petraeus potential Democratic candidate understood mind worked, said, "You mean, aside Hillary?" It Clinton brought together Petraeus Holbrooke ("my two alpha males," calls them) first time — home Washington Friday Obama Inauguration. The affection respect gained military serving Senate helped make relationship State Pentagon less fraught usual — although Defense Secretary Gates' insistence need bigger State Department budgets hasn't hurt. In fact, relations Pentagon gone smoother, times, Clinton's relationship White House staff. Clinton particularly irritated ridiculously strict vetting process thwarted favored candidate USAID director, Paul Farmer, getting job. "It sorts niggling things," says Clinton adviser, "like, Farmer one point brought $10,000 cash Haiti. The money needle-exchange program, amount illegal." Another Clinton's military mentors, retired General Jack Keane, told me, "I'm Republican. I disagree practically everything, she'd make hell Commander Chief." There palpable toughness woman, hard edge contrasts President's instinctive impulse toward conciliation. One sharpest exchanges presidential campaign came Obama accused Clinton echoing "bluster" George W. Bush said U.S. would able "obliterate" Iran used nuclear weapons Israel. Clinton's edgier tone evident start Administration: took sharper position President Israeli settlement freeze claiming, May, Obama wanted "to see stop settlements. Not settlements, outposts, natural-growth exceptions." And then, Jerusalem, use word unprecedented seemed rhetorical leap beyond No Drama ground rules.(Read "Clinton's Collateral Damage.") The White House entirely thrilled either statement. But White House staff several steps removed negotiating process. The Palestinians weak divided. The Israelis difficult, always: whenever Mitchell raises East Jerusalem talks Israeli Foreign Minister, Israeli stands walks room. Despite Netanyahu's momentary, tactical enthusiasm peace talks, Likud Party always favored de facto incorporation Palestinian lands state Israel. Hillary's Choice The tensions White House State raise fascinating question going forward. Obama Clinton substantive agreement President's diplomacy-first philosophy policy issues — although neither willing disclose content private conversations — style often predicts substance foreign policy; neither Obama's gauziness Clinton's inconsistent bluntness overseas seems particularly solid. There growing UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05760165 Date: 06/30/2015 UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05760165 Date: 06/30/2015 perception Administration's policies thwarted across board: Afghanistan mess, Iran seems ready scuttle nuclear negotiations, there's progress Middle East, Syrians North Koreans remain recalcitrant, Russians offered freebie missile defense, Chinese given pass human rights apparent quid pro quos. The White House argues progress made: Iran defensive, North Korea said return six-party talks. Clinton argues, correctly, need "strategic patience." But thing Obama really show efforts far Nobel Prize Potential — small thing — wisdom refrained anything wildly stupid invading Iraq. The President willing use military force — Predator drones decimated al-Qaeda's leadership testify lack squeamishness — Administration supposed efficacy using subtler expressions U.S. power. That doesn't happen overnight, Obama's policies considered success, happen sooner later, way explained public. There also growing sense President's inexperience beginning show — overall policy, represents views broad, moderate national-security consensus ranging Brent Scowcroft John Kerry, execution details. The Afghan strategy review public taken long; Middle East peace hunt become wild goose chase. A letter Iran's Supreme Leader productive gesture gets response; doesn't, seems weak supplicatory. A call Israelis freeze settlements effective accompanied credible threat reduction aid. "You can't seen pushing countries around — demanding [that] Israel freeze settlements, demanding Hamid Karzai reform government — get results," says Leslie H. Gelb, author Power Rules. "The leaders countries tough, successful politicians, they'll begin take less seriously." (See photos 1979 revolution Iran.) Clinton unwilling acknowledge problems, staff loath admit occasional mistakes. Her praise President fulsome, aides say relationship Obama really — really — strong. But also burblings emanations Clinton's staff friends, Foggy Bottom body language, suggest need Administration produce second act Rodney King phase. And White House perplexed uncharacteristic lack discipline indicated Clinton's occasional overseas gaffes. These tensions well within boundaries normal, creative policymaking. There absolutely indication Secretary frustrated point jumping ship — returning politics candidate governor New York, rumored. Quite contrary, seems intent making history Secretary State. To that, though, authority home abroad. She become President's primary foreign policy voice. Over first nine months Obama Administration, seven different Obama officials spoken Sunday talk shows foreign policy. Clinton Sunday shows once. "Either one person sending foreign policy message, clear approval President," says former Republican Secretary State, "or message."(See photos eight months Obama's diplomacy.) Aides Obama say would like see Sunday shows often. (Indeed, Clinton's staff acknowledged asked appear two additional times traveling unable so.) Ultimately, though, television metaphor larger questions need resolved: How much former rivals — extremely guarded private people — really trust other; and, Clinton, emerge President's alter ego foreign policy? At point, strongest member Obama's national-security team Gates — he's Republican unlikely spokesman presidential confidant anything beyond Pentagon issues. General Jim Jones settled National Security Adviser, he's political animal — every President needs close foreign policy adviser understands intersection long-term strategy, politics diplomatic chess. Clinton's value Administration clear Pakistan. She wowed public skeptical questioning $7.5 billion purely economic humanitarian aid Administration promised. "How much damage control able trip?" asked Meher Bokhari, television-news-show host, end Clinton's meeting Pakistani women. The Secretary seemed nonplussed bluntness question. "I don't know," said. "I hope some." Sid Sullivaral@state.gov <SullivanJJ@state.gov> CONFIDENTIAL November 5, 2009-11-05 For Hillary: From: Sid CC: Lissa Re: Berlin speeches Below notes speeches Berlin. The themes I stress these: importance Berlin Brandenburg Gate symbols freedom; weight history (always felt Germans); contribution US salience Western alliance; meaning 1989 today especially continuity Western alliance; segue past future. What I done might added references Angela Merkel (a courageous woman east embodies highest values West); specific policies. Those fitted in. So, ideas language: Twenty years ago wall fell. It turning point Germany Europe also United States wall—the reason construction reason destruction—is central common history—and common future. UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05760179 Date: 06/30/2015 UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05760179 Date: 06/30/2015 Richard von Weizsaecker said, "As long Brandenburg Gate closed, German question remain open." Today I say finality, German question closed, Brandenburg Gate wide open! The gate open, Europe open, future together open. In forty years Berlin airlift fall Berlin Wall, Atlantic partnership proved successful alliance freedom history. That alliance was, shall crowning achievement American foreign policy. And German – American relationship always served foundation. Our alliance represents reconciliation former enemies, inspiration peoples continents devastated war hatred, must never taken granted. In twenty years since fall wall created architecture enduring peace. Instead wall built gateway future. President Kennedy said 1963 future free men everywhere say, "Ich bin emn Berliner." Today Berlin gained new even powerful meaning. Forever future, opening Gate symbol return dream freedom, Berlin Germany, entire world. The Gate, must remember, built symbol freedom. And tyrannies used Gate symbol believed represented eternal power. The Gate first erected symbol French Revolution; became symbol imperial ambitions Napoleon marched army through. It symbol Prussian militarism monarchy. It seized Nazi Party symbol 1000 year rule. And became symbol Communist totalitarianism built wall separate people Berlin though freedom could contained one part city. Here, Berlin, Cold War coldest. We celebrate fact wall marred proud city taken world's enthusiastic wrecking crew. The United States always believed freedom Berlin believed future freedom. The courageous citizens East Germany, Poland nations Communist bloc demonstrated dedication free peaceful solution conflicts stand dictatorship. America stood resolutely ally every moment struggle moved swiftly help peoples Europe reunite 1989. We celebrate steadiness purpose, restraint respect ultimate goals allowed Cold War end peace. For victory won essential triumph. 1989 special. It rarest historical events: revolution descend violence. As result Gate survives cautionary monument history's darkest moments brightest. Today celebrate revolution 1989, turning point transformed Brandenburg Gate symbol hope democracy promise freedom. Berliner Luft, air Berlin, always unique. I feel smell spirit freedom streets. The great American poet Carl Sandburg called Berlin Chicago Europe. Chicago I born raised. I sense energy, openness dedication hard work great cities. Another Chicagoan, President Barack Obama, drawn Berlin last July, city said made feel like citizen world citizen future. I proud visit new Embassy Brandenburg Gate, located exactly Wall used run. Our presence forever underscore determination spark freedom city 1989 help light torches freedom throughout world. The revolution 1989 mark end history. Having made history together, summoned secure freedom future generations. As vital beginning 21st century last half 20th, Western alliance called new tasks. The dreams 1989 reached far—and farther reach. Old hatreds conflicts—in Balkins, Caucauses, Middle East, East Asia, Africa—still simmer. We much demonstrate learned last century. Without freedom, without rule law, without opportunity people support families – without basic human rights-- anger, aggression violence prevail. Once zealots tried use Gate symbolize message. But courage determination people Berlin stalwart allies, Gate stands true revolution spirit. The long twilight struggle tear wall make Europe whole free inspires us, new century, help peoples gain measure security, respect progress. We need Berlin ever today. We need courage, fortitude, commitment rights men— women—we need example. We hardly end history West. Standing here, wall stood more, light Gate, learned history's deepest lessons. Our alliance, linked shared struggle, dedicated ideals freedom democracy, strong world built, faces new world challenges. And ready meet conquer them. We know done before. We free men—and women—and proud say, We Berliners. UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05760179 Date: 06/30/2015

I've followed case Torture homefront cries justice Comments <http://www.suntimes.com/news/marin/1734591,CST-EDT-caro126.article> August 26, 2009 BY CAROL MARIN <mailto:cmarin@suntimes.com> Sun-Times Columnist The feds can't -- yet -- deport Michigan restaurateur Ibrahim Parlak native Turkey. But frighteningly closer. And irony screams out. Carol Mann On Monday, day Eric Holder, President Obama's attorney general, announced would appoint special counsel investigate whether torture used CIA extract confessions foreign suspects, U.S. appeals court behest U.S. government ruled didn't problem sending Parlak back country tortured -- imprisoned 17 months, shocked electrodes, hung arms sexually violated. A Turkish Kurd, Parlak granted political asylum 1992. It government got cozier Turkey, re-classified Kurdish separatist movement "terrorist" attacks Sept. 11. With 9/11, Ibrahim Parlak's horror began anew. Suddenly looked different newly created Department Homeland Security Justice Department's Immigration courts. Instead seeing hard-working, tax-paying Chamber Commerce member ran Cafe Gulistan, small Middle Eastern restaurant resort town Harbert, Mich., tlie feds saw international menace. In 2004, FBI grabbed Parlak locked up. If hadn't volunteer team lawyers, including Reagan-appointed former U.S. attorney, former FBI anti- terrorism legal adviser bipartisan intervention Michigan's Sen. Carl Levin, liberal Democrat, Rep. Fred Upton, conservative Republican, Parlak would still jail. Thanks them, 47-year-old father 12-year-old girl temporarily free. But barely. The newest outrage 2-1 decision issued Cincinnati's 6th Circuit Court Appeals day Holder launched torture inquiry. B5 UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05760248 Date: 06/30/2015 UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05760248 Date: 06/30/2015 The majority opinion issued two Bush appointees put bench 9/11. Judge Julia Smith Gibbons Judge Jeffrey Sutton upheld Justice Department's Immigration courts ruling Parlak failed disclose relationship now-labeled terrorist organization even though never proven member. Let's remember something immigration courts. They independent. They work whoever attorney general. And past rulings Parlak came two now-controversial Bush appointees, John Ashcroft Alberto Gonzales. The fairness immigration rulings ripped none Judge Richard Posner 7th Circuit Court Appeals, one nation's brilliant judges. By September 2005, Posner noted "a staggering 40 percent 136 petitions" reversed due to, according one ruling, willingness ignore "the basic facts." Echoing Posner dissenting judge Parlak appeal. Judge Boyce F. Martin, Carter appointee, writes clarity conviction, arguing government's "awesome power used railroad man country." Like surgeon, Martin dissects Justice Department's immigration courts majority opinion colleagues, ends saying, "I remain hopeful, nevertheless, case sad remnant era paranoid, overzealous, error-riddled misguided anti-terrorism immigration enforcement gone wayside. It shame that, even hope proves true, late Ibrahim Parlak." Parlak's legal team appeal. Meanwhile, Holder, like Ashcroft Gonzales him, new boss immigration courts. As investigates questions U.S. torture abroad, here's hoping Holder examines ongoing domestic legal torture Ibrahim Parlak. Original Message From: Abedin, Huma <AbedinH@state.gov> To: H Sent: Mon Nov 09 17:20:48 2009 Subject: Samual heyman November 09, 2009 Samuel J. Heyman, stood corporate raider preferred hold companies bought run rather sell quick profit, died Sunday Mount Sinai Hospital Manhattan. He 70. Mr. Heyman's death confirmed wife, Ronnie, said died complications open heart surgery. Mr. Heyman recently chairman GAF Corporation, manufacturer roofing materials, chemical company spun GAF, called International Specialty Products. Both companies based Wayne, N.J. A group led Mr. Heyman bought GAF 1983 took private 1987 stock market crashed. He later spun GAF's chemical business separate company, I.S.P. During period, corporate raiders tended buy companies, cut operational costs sell profit. But Mr. Heyman won battle GAF's management control company, told The New York Times: "There strong potential chemicals, plan make grow." Mr. Heyman, also lawyer, diverse business holdings, including Heyman Properties, owns shopping malls Northeast grew business inherited father. "He extremely methodical. There rhyme reason everything did," said Leon Black, chairman Apollo Management, private equity firm, longtime friend Mr. Heyman's investment banker. Mr. Black added: "He combined strong legal background strong analytical business strength, fierce negotiator. But really made Sam kick builder. It building, whether companies, real estate, art collection family." Mr. Heyman born March 1, 1939, Danbury, Conn., Annette Lazarus Heyman. His father real estate developer. After graduating Yale 1960 Harvard Law School 1964, Mr. Heyman went work Justice Department Robert F. Kennedy served chief assistant United States attorney Connecticut. He cut career short father needed take real estate development business. Mr. Heyman made biggest mark 1983 battle GAF. A group shareholders led Mr. Heyman became frustrated management's resistance selling biggest assets, including chemicals business. UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05760283 Date: 06/30/2015 UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05760283 Date: 06/30/2015 Mr. Heyman waged aggressive campaign company's chairman ultimately forced removal shareholder vote - rare victory shareholders time executives public companies considered virtually untouchable. Once Mr. Heyman took control GAF, reversed course held chemicals business, ultimately making big contributor company's profit. He also moved quickly cut costs revamp business, saying time "impatient man. When I see place money saved, I don't waste time." Mr. Heyman also gave away money. In 1999, founded Partnership Public Service, provides fellowships encourage students pursue careers public service. For charity work, Mr. Heyman won President's Citizens Award 2008. His philanthropic interests included establishment Samuel Ronnie Heyman Center Corporate Governance Benjamin N. Cardozo School Law. He wife also collected art. Among holdings works Mark Rothko Jackson Pollock. In addition wife, former Ronnie Feuerstein, Mr. Heyman survived mother, Annette Heyman Palm Beach, Fla.; four children, Lazarus Heyman, Eleanor Propp, Jennifer Millstone Elizabeth Winter; nine grandchildren. But frighteningly closer. And irony screams out. Carol Mann On Monday, day Eric Holder, President Obama's attorney general, announced would appoint special counsel investigate whether torture used CIA extract confessions foreign suspects, U.S. appeals court behest U.S. government ruled didn't problem sending Parlak back country tortured -- imprisoned 17 months, shocked electrodes, hung arms sexually violated. UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05760312 Date: 06/30/2015 UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05760312 Date: 06/30/2015 A Turkish Kurd, Parlak granted political asylum 1992. It government got cozier Turkey, re-classified Kurdish separatist movement "terrorist" attacks Sept. 11. With 9/11, Ibrahim Parlak's horror began anew. Suddenly looked different newly created Department Homeland Security Justice Department's Immigration courts. Instead seeing hard-working, tax-paying Chamber Commerce member ran Cafe Gulistan, small Middle Eastern restaurant resort town Harbert, Mich., feds saw international menace. In 2004, FBI grabbed Parlak locked up. If hadn't volunteer team lawyers, including Reagan-appointed former U.S. attorney, former FBI anti- terrorism legal adviser bipartisan intervention Michigan's Sen. Carl Levin, liberal Democrat, Rep. Fred Upton, conservative Republican, Parlak would still jail. Thanks them, 47-year-old father 12-year-old girl temporarily free. But barely. The newest outrage 2-1 decision issued Cincinnati's 6th Circuit Court Appeals day Holder launched torture inquiry. The majority opinion issued two Bush appointees put bench 9/11. Judge Julia Smith Gibbons Judge Jeffrey Sutton upheld Justice Department's Immigration courts ruling Parlak failed disclose relationship now-labeled terrorist organization even though never proven member. Let's remember something immigration courts. They independent. They work whoever attorney general. And past rulings Parlak came two now-controversial Bush appointees, John Ashcroft Alberto Gonzales. The fairness immigration rulings ripped none Judge Richard Posner 7th Circuit Court Appeals, one nation's brilliant judges. By September 2005, Posner noted "a staggering 40 percent 136 petitions" reversed due to, according one ruling, willingness ignore "the basic facts." Echoing Posner dissenting judge Parlak appeal. Judge Boyce F. Martin, Carter appointee, writes clarity conviction, arguing government's "awesome power used railroad man country." Like surgeon, Martin dissects Justice Department's immigration courts majority opinion colleagues, ends saying, "I remain hopeful, nevertheless, case sad remnant era paranoid, overzealous, error-riddled misguided anti-terrorism immigration enforcement gone wayside. It shame that, even hope proves true, late Ibrahim Parlak." Parlak's legal team appeal. Meanwhile, Holder, like Ashcroft Gonzales him, new boss immigration courts. As investigates questions U.S. torture abroad, here's hoping Holder examines ongoing domestic legal torture Ibrahim Parlak. Johnnie Mae youngest daughter Garland Lee Nettie Mann Walker Red Oak, Arkansas, part Hot Springs southeast shores Lake Hamilton. She predeceased parents siblings, Claude, Eddie, Grady, Hansel, Clara, Isli, Doyle. She predeceased loving husband 67 years, Stephen Fowler Spargo, Jamie Billy Gibbs, daughter sonin-law, son-in-law Allen Brown DeLamar. The Spargos, natives Hot Springs, made Arkadelphia home Steve joined Reynolds Aluminum Company 1954. Mrs. Spargo survived son daughter-in-law, Byron Mary Lynda Spargo, Baton Rouge, La., daughters, Nancy Spargo DeLamar, Little Rock, Dr. Linda Spargo, Oxford, Miss. Her grandchildren include Megan DeLamar Schroeder husband, Trey, Texarkana; Hattie Alton Oxford, Miss.; Johni Beth Gibbs fiance Jeremy Teague Sheridan; Gwendy Clingman husband, Ed, Mechanicsville, Va.; Leslie Spargo Baton Rouge. Johnnie Mae especially proud great-grandchildren: Frances Eleanor Schroeder Ryan Lauren Clingman. She fierce loyal advocate every one offspring truly believed could anything world wanted be. She member First Methodist Church Arkadelphia. Johnnie Mae pre-school teacher many years Margo Nelson's Wonderland School Arkadelphia. She also helped community constant reliable election poll worker. Even though Johnnie Mae determined perceived retiring little granny, family universe. She strong, vibrant woman black hair coiffed top head clicking high heels, beautiful skin progeny hope inherit. She believed living fullest end, good works, helping encountered ways could, imbuing children grandchildren strong work ethic deep empathy less fortunate. Many people Arkansas recipient one lemon butter pound cakes something kind one girls. When won 2003 Clark County Democrat Year, Johnnie Mae described cross Eva Peron Mary Poppins. Johnnie Mae made mark Arkadelphia, determined children would enjoy fullest experiences Norman Rockwellian setting provided. She threw endeavor children grandchildren wanted pursue. When Becky Fuller, Rebecca Ward, first person city win statewide election Girl's State, Johnnie Mae organized city-wide homecoming celebration complete parade Arkadelphia delegates included daughter Nancy. When Johnnie Mae's daughter Jamie wanted pursue rodeo barrel racing, Nonnie perfected ability sew cowgirl outfits also cheering-on daughter stands. When daughter Linda wanted serve cheerleader Arkadelphia High School Ouachita Baptist University, Johnnie Mae Steve's house became nerve-center events athletic. When daughter Nancy returned Arkadelphia 1964 seven-month-old Megan raise, Johnnie Steve provided nurturing, loving home daughter granddaughter. Megan grandchild gave Johnnie Mae proudest title: Johnnie Mae became "Nonnie." Nonnie queen tribe three generations women known "Spargo Girls." When great-granddaughters Frances Eleanor born 1999, Nonnie determined twin girls would use exclusive communication method. I particularly pleased see Congressional Budget Office estimated bill reduce deficit $127 billion next ten years much $650 billion decade following, saving hundreds billions extending coverage 31 million Americans. From day one, goal enact legislation offers stability security insurance affordable coverage don't, lowers costs families, businesses governments across country. Majority Leader Reid, Chairmen Baucus Dodd, countless Senators worked tirelessly craft legislation meets principles. Just yesterday, bipartisan group 20 leading health economists released letter urging passage meaningful reform praising four key provisions Senate legislation: fee insurance companies offering high-premium plans, establishment independent Medicare commission, reforms health care delivery system, overall deficit neutrality. The economists said provisions 'will reduce long-term deficits, improve quality care, put nation firm fiscal footing.' Those precisely goals seeking attain. The challenges facing health care system aren't new — fail act they'll surely get even worse, meaning higher premiums, skyrocketing costs, deeper instability coverage. Much criticism, home abroad, concerning Afghan policy review tended focus accusations White House dithering which, nearly three half months, entirely without foundation. As General McChrystal found cost, Obama inner circle Chicago pols take kindly second-guessed whose advice seek, every right reject. There reason doubt McChrystal's gloomy prediction — generally endorsed Whitehall — without extra 40,000 Nato troops Afghan mission doomed failure. In words, use phrase- °logy popular Chicago, he's dead meat. • Obama, meanwhile, made deliberations secretive three people whole Washington — and, ergo, rest world — know precisely mind, none talking. Even President George \N. Bush, frequently criticised arrogance unilateralism, better this. From 9/11 Iraq war, kept Tony Blair trusted allies (there weren't many, let's face it) fully briefed planning — much Blair accused colluding invade Iraq spring 2002. • But Obama regular video-conferences bringing Downing Street date latest White House thinking. No special envoys making secret visits London keep key players informed. Instead wait, like everyone else, puffs smoke White House — expected around Thanksgiving holiday — find Obama really intends Afghanistan. He is, many ways, AWOL ally. Did Obama bother consult Britain cancelling missile shield system Eastern Europe (the early-warning detection system is, all, based RAF Fylingdales North Yorkshire Moors)? No not. The Poles, rightly sensitive security used bargaining chip negotiations super-power neighbours, make late-night call Hillary Clinton eve announcement — Poles understandably turned call, breach manners protocol. In keenness befriend Russian President Dmitry Medvedev, Obama taken account widespread European unease concerning mood resurgent nationalism sweeping Moscow? Not chance. • And judge recent peregrinations around Far East, seems Obama far interested making new friends taking trouble keep old acquaintances. The enthusiasm displayed bumped Dmitry Medvedev, Russia's Prime Minister, week's Apec summit Singapore considerably greater shown many European allies. Not Medvedev indignity conducting important bilateral discussions kitchens surrounded vats boiling noodles. And Beijing Obama spent convivial evening President Hu Jintao, discussing evolution histories China America. Being American ally never seemed unrewarding. • There will, though, inevitably come time Obama discovers America's true friends really are. Sooner later deal considerably taxing issues Islamist militancy, rogue nuclear states tangible threats West's security. At point, Obama discover simple essential truth. The world divides support American values freedom democracy, seek destroy them. • Few nations committed supporting values blood treasure Britain. This country, especially British troops fighting alongside American counterparts, deserve far better president's disregard. • Con Coughlin Daily Telegraph's executive foreign editor author Khomeini's Ghost: Iran since 1979 (Macmillan). • The Spectator, 22 Old Queen Street, London, SW1H 9HP. Sir Christopher Meyer said "unforgiving nature" build-up American forces told prepare war meant "we found scrabbling smoking gun". He added: "It another way saying 'it's Saddam prove he's innocent, we've bloody well got try prove he's guilty.' And – Americans, British – never really recovered course smoking gun." The US first prepared invasion January date later moved March. "Ail said, looked timetable inspections, impossible see [Hans] Biix [chief weapons inspector] could bring process conclusion, better worse, March." Meyer said favour removing Saddam. He thought need 9/11 weapons mass destruction justify confronting Iraq. Saddam lived commitments given first Gulf war. He "the means will" build weapons even hid time. Meyer said know made UK fix "on large land force standards". He believed would damaged Britain's standing US sent fewer troops Iraq, actively opposing war would done. UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05760481 Date: 06/30/2015 UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05760481 Date: 06/30/2015 Section 7008 Department State, Foreign Operations, Related Programs Appropriations Act, 2009 (Div. H, P.L. 111-8) provides: "None funds appropriated otherwise made available pursuant titles III VI Act shall obligated expended finance directly assistance government country whose duly elected head government deposed military coup decree: Provided, That assistance may resumed government President determined certifies Committees Appropriations subsequent termination assistance democratically elected government taken office: Provided further, That provisions section shall apply assistance promote democratic elections public participation democratic processes: Provided further, That funds made available pursuant previous provisos shall subject regular notification procedures Committees Appropriations." The charge, set new outbreak tensions United States Pakistan, made unpublicized diplomatic protest late June Prime Minister Yusuf Raza Gilani top Pakistani officials. The accusation comes particularly delicate time, administration asking Congress approve $7.5 billion aid Pakistan next five years, Washington pressing reluctant Pakistani military focus attentions fighting Taliban, rather expanding nuclear conventional forces aimed India. While American officials say weapon latest dispute conventional one — based Harpoon antiship missiles sold Pakistan Reagan administration defensive weapon cold war — subtext argument growing concern speed Pakistan developing new generations conventional nuclear weapons. "There's concerted effort get guys slow down," one senior administration official said. "Their energies misdirected." At issue detection American intelligence agencies suspicious missile test April 23 — test never announced Pakistanis — appeared give country new offensive weapon. UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05760490 Date: 06/30/2015 UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05760490 Date: 06/30/2015 American military intelligence officials say suspect Pakistan modified Harpoon antiship missiles United States sold country 1980s, move would violation Arms Control Export Act. Pakistan denied charge, saying developed missile itself. The United States also accused Pakistan modifying American-made P-3C aircraft land-attack missions, another violation United States law Obama administration protested. Whatever origin, missiles would significant new entry Pakistan's arsenal India. They would enable Pakistan's small navy strike targets land, complementing sizable land-based missile arsenal Pakistan developed. That, turn, would likely spur another round arms race India United States trying, unsuccessfully, halt. "The focus concern potential unauthorized modification maritime antiship defensive capability offensive land-attack missile," said another senior administration official, also spoke condition anonymity matter involves classified information. "The potential proliferation end-use violations things watch closely," official added. "When concerns, act aggressively." A senior Pakistani official, also speaking condition anonymity interchanges Washington delicate highly classified, said American accusation "incorrect." The official said missile tested developed Pakistan, modified North Korean designs build range land-based missiles could strike India. He said Pakistan taken unusual step agreeing allow American officials inspect country's Harpoon inventory prove violated law, step administration officials praised. Some experts also skeptical American claims. Robert Hewson, editor Jane's Air Launched Weapons, yearbook Web-based data service, said Harpoon missile necessary range land-attack missile, would lend credibility Pakistani claims developing new missile. Moreover, said, Pakistan already modern land-attack missiles developed acquired China. "They're beyond need reverse-engineer old U.S. kit," Mr. Hewson said telephone interview. "They're sophisticated that." Mr. Hewson said ship-to-shore missile Pakistan testing part concerted effort develop array conventional missiles could fired air, land sea address India's much formidable conventional missile arsenal. The dispute highlights level mistrust remains United States Pakistani military American officials like portray increasingly reliable partner effort root forces Taliban Al Qaeda Pakistani territory. A central element American effort get military refocused internal threat facing country, rather threat country believes still faces India. Pakistani officials insisted making shift. But evidence continues point heavy investments nuclear conventional weapons experts say utility battle insurgents. Over years, United States provided total 165 Harpoon missiles Pakistan, including 37 older- model weapons delivered 1985 1988, said Charles Taylor, spokesman Defense Security Cooperation Agency. The country's nuclear arsenal expanding faster nation's. In May, Pakistan conducted test firing Babur medium-range cruise missile, weapon military experts say could potentially tipped nuclear warhead. The test conducted May 6, visit Washington President Asif All Zardari, made public Pakistani officials three days meetings ended avoid upsetting talks. While may technically possible arm Harpoons small nuclear weapons, outside experts say would probably necessary. Yet another undercurrent among mandarins disdainful resentment indifference Britain, sentiment beyond Labour Tories emerged view permanent establishment Whitehall elsewhere. Mandelson Watch: After Miliband declined reach EU foreign secretaryship (though Sarkozy wanted take Brown averse, even favorable), Mandelson personally campaigned among Europeans. Mandelson eager Miliband take EU post, allowing Mandelson appointed foreign minister. When Miliband refused, Mandelson's ambition thwarted, tried seize EU position himself, without backing Europe Gordon. The Europeans thought mad. Suddenly, recalled bad strange behavior UK commissioner EU. When Christine Ashton named, Mandelson briefed press lack credentials, etc. Ashton, happens, worked press try help Mandelson gotten mess led first resignation.
