Enclosed story Chilcot: http://www.guardian.co.uk/uk/2009/nov/29/iraq-war-inquiry-chilcot-blair Chilcot Inquiry: Mandarins take revenge Tony Blair Iraq Civil servants diplomats lining stick knife former PM's reputation * Toby Helm <http://www.guardian.co.uk/profile/tobyhelm> Rajeev Syal <http://www.guardian.co.uk/profile/rajeev-syal> * The Observer <http://observer.guardian.co.uk>, Sunday 29 November 2009 * Whitehall mandarins supreme masters subtle evasion. But rise top trade without also knowing stick knife. At times Chilcot inquiry Britain's involvement Iraq since 2001, opened last week, resembled gentlemen's club moved sanitised surroundings Queen Elizabeth II Conference Centre Westminster. Oxbridge-educated pillars establishment politely questioned Oxbridge-educated pillars establishment said memo. The inquiry peculiar mixture old new, open closed. It conducted language Whitehall, yet beamed live webcam world. Critics convinced that, Sir John Chilcot's promises contrary, turn another Whitehall whitewash. For cognoscenti, little new information yet emerged, final report written seek apportion blame. Yet beneath equivocation mandarin-speak, Whitehall seems, much knows how, using Chilcot wield scalpel. Throughout first week pent-up frustrations diplomats career civil servants way Tony Blair <http://www.guardian.co.uk/politics/tonyblair> George Bush secretly plotted oust Saddam Hussein, bypassing "official channels" operate, see. Chilcot said warned Whitehall friends many witnesses ready unburden — finally take revenge. In session session appeared that. Blair's reputation sliced like salami day day. Sir William Ehrman, Foreign Office's former director international security, volunteered last Wednesday threat Saddam's,supposed weapons mass destruction known limited. In gentlest way drove dagger. "We did, I think 10 March [2003], get report chemical weapons might remained disassembled Saddam hadn't yet ordered assembly. There suggestion Iraq might lack warheads capable effective dispersal agents." Ever diplomat, however, Ehrman went say intelligence warnings made difference case war. "I don't think invalidated point programmes had. It use," said. But set tone. On Thursday, Sir Christopher Meyer, UK ambassador Washington 1997 2003, already criticised government Iraq memoirs, went Blair, mercilessly comparing qualities war leader Margaret Thatcher. "I'm trying make party political point whatsoever, quite often I. think this: would Margaret Thatcher done?" Meyer asked. "I think would insisted coherent political diplomatic strategy would demanded greatest clarity heck happened if, when, removed Saddam Hussein." A former press secretary John Major speak like mandarin but, equally, talk like layman, said Blair failed miserably extract price George Bush loyalty. "We could achieved playing tougher role... if, example... Tony Blair said: 'I want help you, George, this, I say, honesty, I able take part military operation unless palpable progress [Middle East] peace process absolute clarity happens Iraq comes up.' I think would changed nature — would led rupture — would changed nature American planning." Even defending UK policy, offensive. Asked policy adapted stay line Washington's, Meyer added: "I wouldn't say extremely poodle-ish that." UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05760498 Date: 06/30/2015 UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05760498 Date: 06/30/2015 On Friday, Sir Jeremy Greenstock, Britain's former ambassador United Nations, told Chilcot threatened resign 2002 least one security council resolution passed. He added: "I regard participation military action Iraq March 2003 legal questionable legitimacy, democratically observable backing great majority [UN] member states, even perhaps majority people inside UK." Today new arguments raging whether inquiry access to, publish, sensitive documents — including legal advice given government former attorney general, Lord Goldsmith, lead-up war. Nick Clegg, Liberal Democrat leader, written Gordon Brown saying that, unless material published, inquiry sham public's sense denied facts remain. But still essential viewing nonetheless. This week see key witnesses. The revealing testimony could come tomorrow Sir David Manning, Blair's former foreign policy <http://www.guardian.co.uk/politics/foreignpolicy> adviser, certain asked authorship memo purportedly revealed details secret meeting Bush Blair January 2003. According reports, five pages secret documents, known Manning memo, recorded White House meeting 31 January allegedly shows Bush Blair made deal carry invasion regardless whether weapons mass destruction discovered UN weapons inspectors. It appears direct contradiction statements Blair made parliament afterwards Saddarn would given final chance disarm. The memo also disclosed Bush floated idea painting U-2 spyplane UN colours letting fly low Iraq provoke Saddam ordering shot down, providing pretext subsequent invasion America Britain. Manning, educated Oriel College, Oxford, career diplomat, fiercely independent. He may choose say Blair would like, according one former colleague. He could also asked either confirm deny Meyer's evidence Meyer received "new instructions" early 2005 indicating "complete waste time" oppose regime change, strong US determination go road. On Tuesday, Edward Chaplin, Foreign Office Middle East director time invasion, Sir Peter Ricketts, top official Foreign Office, appear. Ricketts, former chairman Britain's powerful joint intelligence committee, already given evidence inquiry alleging officials London knew even Bush came office 2001 "voices" Washington calling Saddam removed power. Ricketts also told inquiry that, March 2002, Whitehall distanced regime change. Only one month later, Blair told Bush would support military action "to bring regime change". According documents leaked five years ago, Ricketts described US 2002 "scrambling establish link Iraq al-Qaida" — connection "so far, frankly unconvincing". On Thursday, Sir Kevin Tebbit, Ministry Defence's permanent secretary invasion, asked give evidence military planning. Chilcot will, likely, want know government first began amass resources war what, any, preparations made aftermath invasion. Tebbit could also urged divulge level intelligence received likelihood attack chemical biological weapons. After Tebbit, succession heavy-hitting military men give evidence. The former chief defence staff, Admiral Lord Boyce, could asked whether believes invasion legal. On Friday, Lieutenant General Sir Anthony Pigott, former deputy chief defence staff, Major General David Wilson, senior British military adviser US military's central command 2002 2003, questioned military planning conflict. The last witness appear week Dominic Asquith, Britain's ambassador Iraq 2006 2007, come armed knowledge view Baghdad. When Chilcot made way officials, turn new year former ministers, including Jack Straw, former foreign secretary, Blair himself. The panel said also begin examine highly controversial issue whether invasion legal — may turn focal point whole inquiry — January. In final report, expected late 2010 earliest, Chilcot said seek attribute blame. But one week already clear much Whitehall believes lies. The Washington Post Afghanistan: The speech you'll miss By Jim Hoagiand Sunday, November 29, 2009 Dec. 1, 2009: My fellow Americans, This speech expected hear. But wordsmiths tied knots writing acceptance speech Nobel Peace Prize ever awarded making speeches. So I going tell I really feel Afghanistan. Which is: steamed. I want accomplish three goals tonight without naming them. First, let know-it-ails, Generals Petraeus McChrystal, know one thing: This last big troop increase get, make work. I going incrementalist road wrecked Lyndon Johnson's presidency. This July 1965, Westmoreland jumped shark escalation Vietnam never stopped asking troops. For trouble been, Dick Holbrooke helped recalling history shadowboxing dominated long war council meetings. Joe Biden good there, too. He's willing, though happy, characterized media ready bug now. This helped us push back McChrystal's effort box 40,000 additional U.S. soldiers. Denis McDonough, strategic communications man, sold Biden-as-dove brilliantly. Wasn't somebody saying I promote Denis? Maybe Denis? Never mind. That tactic won room maneuver toward realistic number of, say, 23,000 new combat troops, 5,000 additional trainers "NATO surge" 5,000 foreign troops. That's second unspoken goal: come buildup speech without losing left Democratic Party -- able refute John McCain's charges I ignored generals. Triangulation lives. Bush put generals limelight sell Iraq surge lost credibility, David Petraeus's performance dazzling. Which presents two big problems. Petraeus person could get Republican nomination 2012 make serious run me. (I get paid think ahead.) And generals box in, civilian control military country becomes mockery. Clinton afraid military; Bush deep hock it. I've got get right balance back. That's I need Bob Gates Jim Jones. Those scoffed keeping Bush's defense secretary, making retired Marine four-star I hardly knew NSC guy, thinking moments like would come. I already was. Gates maneuvered flawlessly waterboarding-by-leaks Afghanistan. He sell final number uniforms "floor" U.S. troops Petraeus argues need three years. But Gates knows I make ceiling. We can't afford open-ended commitment. I put Peter Orszag, good budget overseer find, front center photographers last war council. Many missed it, NBC's Andrea Mitchell got right away. No wonder she's married Alan Greenspan. Ogden, Peter R UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05761219 Date: 06/30/2015 UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05761219 Date: 06/30/2015 Really good editorial here. Really worth reading. This Week Copenhagen December 12, 2009 Editorial We didn't expect much first week global warming conference Copenhagen. Countries need little posturing getting hard work, supposed start Monday. But belligerent talk China seemed go well beyond usual positioning. • •The best hope talks produce interim understanding industrialized countries would commit fairly precise targets reduced emissions, others, like China, broader measurable goals. The industrial countries would expected help poorer countries shift less-polluting forms energy. That would set stage legally binding deal 2010. But chance even interim agreement without enthusiastic participation China, biggest emitter greenhouse gases. China's absence would give developing countries — United States Senate — excuse less needed. Beijing's recent pledge slow growth emissions seemed like positive shift attitude. Then Tuesday, surprising show defensiveness, China's top negotiator, Su Wei, said greatest burden rested industrialized countries jumped United States, Japan European Union aggressive enough. Another Chinese official urged Washington "some deep soul-searching" improve proposal. Todd Stern, chief American negotiator, responded correctly: With emissions many industrialized countries peaking declining, growth greenhouse gases expected come developing world 2030, half China. Rich nations must still reduce emissions sharply, Mr. Stern said, "there way solve problem giving major developing countries pass." China also demanding rich nations contribute hundreds millions dollars year help poor countries address threat climate change. Again Mr. Stern blunt. Washington prepared help need it, given China's huge reserves revved-up economy, said could envision "public funds, certainly United States, going China." The positive development pledge European Union contribute $10.5 billion next three years help poorer countries deal climate change. The United States said make contribution said big be. Transparency another difficult issue must resolved, least principle, week. There point setting targets, threatening penalties noncompliance, unless countries required report emissions accurately. Transparency never one Beijing's virtues, emerging countries generally need aid create sophisticated monitoring systems. Copenhagen's broadest challenge finding equitable way distribute burden confronting climate change. Despite differences, industrialized nations pretty much agreed trim emissions 15 percent 20 percent 2005 levels next 10 years, 80 percent midcentury. And seem willing make expensive investments get there. President Obama need help Congress, sure thing. A host developing countries — including India, Brazil, Indonesia — put broad goals table, though in.some cases seem aspirational real. But bottom line hope meaningful deal vanishingly small China doesn't sign on. UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05761219 Date: 06/30/2015

From: Ben Kobren To: Stern, Todd D (S/SECC); Todd Stern Sent: Sat Dec 12 08:12:24 2009 Subject: NYT Editorial Ogden, Peter R Really good editorial here. Really worth reading. This Week Copenhagen December 12, 2009 Editorial We didn't expect much first week global warming conference Copenhagen. Countries need little posturing getting hard work, supposed start Monday. But belligerent talk China seemed go well beyond usual positioning. The best hope talks produce interim understanding industrialized countries would commit fairly precise targets reduced emissions, others, like China, broader measurable goals. The industrial countries would expected help poorer countries shift less-polluting forms energy. That would set stage legally binding deal 2010. But chance even interim agreement without enthusiastic participation China, biggest emitter greenhouse gases. China's absence would give developing countries — United States Senate — excuse less needed. Beijing's recent pledge slow growth emissions seemed like positive shift attitude. Then Tuesday, surprising show defensiveness, China's top negotiator, Su Wei, said greatest burden rested industrialized countries jumped United States, Japan European Union aggressive enough. Another Chinese official urged Washington "some deep soul-searching" improve proposal. Todd Stern, chief American negotiator, responded correctly: With emissions many industrialized countries peaking declining, growth greenhouse gases expected come developing world 2030, half China. Rich nations must still reduce emissions sharply, Mr. Stern said, "there way solve problem giving major developing countries pass." UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05761222 Date: 06/30/2015 UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05761222 Date: 06/30/2015 China also demanding rich nations contribute hundreds millions dollars year help poor countries address threat climate change. Again Mr. Stern blunt. Washington prepared help need it, given China's huge reserves revved-up economy, said could envision "public funds, certainly United States, going China." The positive development pledge European Union contribute $10.5 billion next three years help poorer countries deal climate change. The United States said make contribution said big be. Transparency another difficult issue must resolved, least principle, week. There point setting targets, threatening penalties noncompliance, unless countries required report emissions accurately. Transparency never one Beijing's virtues, emerging countries generally need aid create sophisticated monitoring systems. Copenhagen's broadest challenge finding equitable way distribute burden confronting climate change. Despite differences, industrialized nations pretty much agreed trim emissions 15 percent 20 percent 2005 levels next 10 years, 80 percent midcentury. And seem willing make expensive investments get there. President Obama need help Congress, sure thing. A host developing countries — including India, Brazil, Indonesia — put broad goals table, though cases seem aspirational real. But bottom line hope meaningful deal vanishingly small China doesn't sign on. UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05761222 Date: 06/30/2015

Gaspare Spatuzza, jailed Mafia hitman turned witness, told packed heavily guarded bunker courtroom Cosa Nostra Godfather boss cut deal Mr Berlusconi 1993 provided unspecified "benefits" Mafia exchange political support. The media tycoon entered politics months later won first term Prime Minister 1994. Spatuzza said boss, Giuseppe Graviano, jailed Mafia bomb attacks Rome, Milan Florence, told Mob "got everything" help Mr Berlusconi, adding Graviano called Mr Berlusconi "the man Channel 5", reference TV network. The damaging claims came appeal hearing Marcello Dell'Utri, key Berlusconi associate senator, challenging nine-year jail sentence links Mafia. Spatuzza, prison several murders, testified: "Graviano told name Berlusconi said thanks man home town [an apparent reference Dell' Utri] country hands." Mr Berlusconi denounced claims Spatuzza "vile", "unfounded defamatory", denying ever links Mafia. The Prime Minister's spokesman said testimony yesterday Mafia's "completely logical" revenge Prime Minister "determined" fight organised crime. Dell'Utri told court neither Mr Berlusconi Mafia connections. "It's interest Mafia force collapse Berlusconi government government done fight organised crime," said. Mr Berlusconi, recently lost legal immunity prosecution, said furious week, parliamentary Speaker, Gianfranco Fini, man supposed closest ally, said Spatuzza evidence "an atomic bomb". Mr Fini recorded unobserved microphone talking privately official dinner. Rumours conservative Prime Minister's links Mob persisted since investigators learnt Cosa Nostra hitman, Vittorio Mangano, worked Mr Berlusconi's "stable-master" media mogul's villa Arcore outside Milan 1970s. Much speculation also centred origins Mr Berlusconi's vast wealth. Last week, Prime Minister's broadcast group, Mediaset, holding company, Fininvest, announced intended sue left-wing newspaper La Repubblica article said Mediaset "20 per cent owned Mafia". La Stampa newspaper noted "dread combination Mafia allegations separation wife principal torments". Mr Berlusconi's estranged wife, Veronica Lario, said seeking £3m-a-month divorce settlement, messy courtroom battle looms. Mr Berlusconi also faces retrial charge bribed British lawyer David Mills lie court. TIME Friday, Dec. 04, 2009 After Court Ruling, Berlusconi's Legal Woes Resume By Jeff Israely The world spent past six months wondering — — Silvio Berlusconi spends Saturday nights. But combative, scandal-plagued Prime Minister Italy would prefer talk mornings instead. "Do know I've forced spend Saturday mornings since I entered politics?" Berlusconi declared business leaders Rome. "With lawyers." UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05761507 Date: 06/30/2015 UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05761507 Date: 06/30/2015 Italy's self-proclaimed Defendant Chief makes point lamenting weekends spoiled stacks court dossiers proof victim politically motivated magistrates, called speech "the spreading cancer democracy." (See Berlusconi's worst gaffes.) <http://www.time.com/time/specials/packages/article/0,28804,1874098_1874099_1874118,00.html> To combat perceived persecution, Berlusconi tested bounds decorous democratic conduct, including allies' pushing bill Parliament last year gave top Italian officeholders immunity prosecution. But since Constitutional Court overturned law October, several criminal investigations Berlusconi's business dealings reopened, new charges rumored looming. The potentially damaging trial set resume Friday, Dec. 4, Milan, 73-year-old billionaire accused paying British attorney David Mills $600,000 1997 withhold incriminating evidence broadcasting empire Mediaset. Mills appealing conviction case; men denied wrongdoing. So, alas, Berlusconi back spending downtime well-paid cadre dozen avvocati, successful far keeping biggest client clear criminal convictions. Not lawyers ever really gone away. Since media baron first ran office 15 years ago, legal advisers doubled political consiglieri, key members Parliament even important Cabinet Ministers. Indeed, critics spoken Berlusconi's reign kind sultanate showgirls government gaffe, others described republic attorneys. (See Berlusconi's Obama "jokes" say Italy.) <http://www.time.com/time/world/article/0,8599,1927307,00.html> His longtime lawyer Cesare Previti served Italian Defense Minister Berlusconi's first term 1994 convicted corruption (and losing twice appeal). During Berlusconi's second term (2001-06), Gaetano Pecorella, former leftist, served president Parliament's Justice Commission, instrumental shepherding new laws helped shield Berlusconi investigating magistrates. Giovanni Sartori, Columbia University professor constitutional law, says role Berlusconi's personal lawyers played legislative agenda yet another gargantuan conflict interest add related ownership Italy's main private television stations. But now, Sartori says, Berlusconi's lawyers perfected art exploiting Italy's painfully slow justice system: many cases conclude without final verdict statute limitations reached. "It mania necessity," Sartori says Berlusconi's near obsession battling magistrates. "He feels persecuted, fighting judges makes happy." Berlusconi's current point man Nicolo Ghedini, somber-faced, lanky 49-year-old criminal-defense attorney northern city Padua, served Italian Senate lower house Parliament. Ghedini continued mount grinding defense criminal cases, arguing Mills case Berlusconi cannot present Milan courtroom next several months time conflicts duties Prime Minister. Ghedini also spearheaded increasingly aggressive legal strategy included several libel suits opposition newspapers. He declared September necessary, Berlusconi would testify suit journalist referred rumors Prime Minister impotent. Last week, Berlusconi vowed launch additional suits newspapers printed unsubstantiated reports close adviser involved 1993 bombing campaign ' Sicilian Mafia. (Read "An Offended Berlusconi Goes Offensive.") <http://www.time.com/time/world/article/0,8599,1920737,00.html> Despite many legal headaches, Berlusconi embroiled one particularly thorny case even can't blame overzealous magistrates. Veronica Lario, Berlusconi's wife 20 years, filed divorce earlier year, sparked avalanche accusations frequented prostitute Bari underage model Naples. The Milan daily Corriere della Sera reported last week Lario demanded 3.5 million euros ($5.2 million) monthly payments, Berlusconi countered offer 300,000 euros ($450,000). No matter cases shake out, little hope Berlusconi avoid mountain lawyers' fees grim Saturdays he'd rather devote business pleasures. U.S. activists also shedding new light risks gays face East Africa. In book called The Family, American journalist Jeff Sharlet criticizes group influential American Christian leaders conservative lawmakers close ties politicians East Africa. He accuses treating countries deal social political experiments. "It become sort Frankenstein's monster family going take responsibility empowerment given politicians?," asked Jeff Sharlet. In book, Sharlet specifically refers politicians Uganda proposing anti-gay law would criminalize homosexuality. The law, could passed within weeks despite international condemnation, includes possible punishment death. Anti-gay laws recently passed Burundi, discussed Rwanda, could soon expanded Kenya Tanzania. The American group Sharlet calls The Family also known The Fellowship. It organizes annual National Prayer Breakfast U.S. president foreign guests, besides activity shuns publicity openly list members. But Sharlet says American reporters looking group alleged ties Africa. These include helping African politicians money push socially conservative agendas. "We see reporters Iowa, Pennsylvania, Oklahoma, going elected representatives link whole thing saying 'tell us link'," said. "They accusing anything, saying, 'You relationship Ugandan government, nature relationship? And, going use influence oppose legislation seems supported allies?" Religious leaders like Rick Warren also microscope. He senior pastor California-based Saddleback church, active Uganda Rwanda. After questioned role U.S. media, Warren issued video message Internet, denying support law Uganda. "I referring pending law consideration Ugandan parliament, known Anti-Homosexuality Bill." I room As recriminations fly post-Copenhagen, one writer offers fly-on-the-wall account talks failed Mark Lynas <http://www.guardian.co.uk/profile/marklynas> guardian.co.ul«http://www.guardian.co.uk> , Tuesday 22 December 2009 19.54 GMT Copenhagen disaster. That much agreed. But truth actually happened danger lost amid spin inevitable mutual recriminations. The truth this: China <http://www.guardian.co.uk/world/china> wrecked talks, intentionally humiliated Barack Obama, insisted awful "deal" western leaders would walk away carrying blame. How I know this? Because I room saw happen. China's strategy simple: block open negotiations two weeks, ensure closed-door deal made look west failed world's poor again. And sure enough, aid agencies, civil society movements environmental groups took bait. The failure "the inevitable result rich countries refusing adequately fairly shoulder overwhelming responsibility", said Christian Aid. "Rich countries bullied developing nations," fumed Friends Earth International. All predictable, complete opposite truth. Even George Monbiot, writing yesterday's Guardian, made mistake singiy blaming Obama. But saw Obama fighting desperately salvage deal, Chinese delegate saying "no", again. Monbiot even approvingly quoted Sudanese delegate Lumumba Di-Aping, denounced Copenhagen accord "a suicide pact, incineration pact, order maintain economic dominance countries". Sudan behaves talks puppet China; one number countries relieves Chinese delegation fight battles open sessions. It perfect stitch-up. China gutted deal behind scenes, left proxies savage public. Here's actually went late last Friday night, heads state two dozen countries met behind closed doors. - Obama table several hours, sitting Gordon Brown Ethiopian prime minister, IVIeles Zenawi. The Danish prime minister chaired, right sat Ban Ki-moon, secretary-general UN. Probably 50 60 people, including heads state, room. I attached one delegations, whose head state also present time. What I saw profoundly shocking. The Chinese premier, Wen Jinbao, deign attend meetings personally, instead sending second-tier official country's foreign ministry sit opposite Obama himself. The diplomatic snub obvious brutal, practical implication: several times session, world's powerful heads state forced wait around Chinese delegate went make telephone calls "superiors". Shifting blame To would blame Obama rich countries general, know this: China's representative insisted industrialised country targets, previously agreed 80% cut 2050, taken deal. "Why can't UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05762860 Date: 06/30/2015 UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05762860 Date: 06/30/2015 even mention targets?" demanded furious Angela Merkel. Australia's prime minister, Kevin Rudd, annoyed enough bang microphone. Brazil's representative pointed illogicality China's position. Why rich countries announce even unilateral cut? The Chinese delegate said no, I watched, aghast, Merkel threw hands despair conceded point. Now know — China bet, correctly, Obama would get blame Copenhagen accord's lack ambition. China, backed times India, proceeded take numbers mattered. A 2020 peaking year global emissions, essential restrain temperatures 2C, removed replaced woolly language suggesting emissions peak "as soon possible". The long-term target, global 50% cuts 2050, also excised. No one else, perhaps exceptions India Saudi Arabia, wanted happen. I certain Chinese room, would left Copenhagen deal environmentalists popping champagne corks popping every corner world. Strong position So China manage pull coup? First, extremely strong negotiating position. China didn't need deal. As one developing country foreign minister said me: "The Athenians nothing offer Spartans." On hand, western leaders particular — also presidents Lula Brazil, Zuma South Africa, Caldenin Mexico many others — desperate positive outcome. Obama needed strong deal perhaps anyone. The US confirmed offer $100bn developing countries adaptation, put serious cuts table first time (17% 2005 levels 2020), obviously prepared offer. Above all, Obama needed able demonstrate Senate could deliver China global climate regulation framework, conservative senators could argue US carbon cuts would advantage Chinese industry. With midterm elections looming, Obama staff also knew Copenhagen would probably opportunity go climate change <http://www.guardian.co.uk/environment/climate-change> talks strong mandate. This strengthened China's negotiating hand, complete lack civil society political pressure either China India. Campaign groups never blame developing countries failure; iron rule never broken. The Indians, particular, become past masters co-opting language equity ("equal rights atmosphere") service planetary suicide — ieftish campaigners commentators hoist petard. With deal gutted, heads state session concluded final battle Chinese delegate insisted removing 1.5C target beloved small island states low-lying nations lose rising seas. President Nasheed Maldives, supported Brown, fought valiantly save crucial number. "How ask country go extinct?" demanded Nasheed. The Chinese delegate feigned great offence — number stayed, surrounded language makes meaningless. The deed done. China's game All raises question: China's game? Why China, words UK-based analyst also spent hours heads state meetings, "not reject targets itself, also refuse allow country take binding targets?" The analyst, attended climate conferences 15 years, concludes China wants weaken climate regulation regime "in order avoid risk might called ambitious years' time". This mean China serious global warming. It strong wind solar industries. But China's growth, growing global political economic dominance, based largely cheap coal. China knows becoming uncontested superpower; indeed newfound muscular confidence striking display Copenhagen. Its coal-based economy doubles every decade, power increases commensurately. leadership alter magic formula unless absolutely to. Copenhagen much worse another bad deal, illustrated profound shift global geopolitics. This fast becoming China's century, yet leadership displayed multilateral environmental governance priority, viewed hindrance new superpower's freedom action. I left Copenhagen despondent I felt long time. After hope hype, mobilisation thousands, wave optimism crashed rock global power politics, fell back, drained away. <http://pix01.revsci.net/E05516/a3/0/0/0/0/0/0/0/0/0/noscript.gif> UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05762860 Date: 06/30/2015

UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05763225 Date: 06/30/2015 RELEASE IN FULL From: H <hrod17@clintonemail.com > Sent: Tuesday, December 29, 2009 6:21 PM To: 'SchwerinDB@state.gov' Subject: Re: Posner response Washington Post editorial That's fine. Original Message From: Schwerin, Daniel B <SchwerinDB@state.gov> To: H Cc: Sullivan, Jacob J <SullivanJJ@state.gov>; Reines, Philippe I <reinesp@state.gov>; Abedin, Huma <AbedinH@state.gov> Sent: Tue Dec 29 18:08:30 2009 Subject: Posner response Washington Post editorial Philippe Jake asked send along response Washington Post editorial: By Michael Posner The Post's Dec. 27 editorial ("Redefining Human Rights") Obama Administration's human rights democracy policies, Secretary Clinton's recent speech Georgetown particular, misses critical point: human rights, democracy, development mutually reinforcing, competing goals. They complement task making human rights human reality. President Roosevelt understood fundamental link liberty, prosperity security, tying together freedom speech worship freedom want freedom fear his-famous "Four Freedoms" speech. At Georgetown, Secretary Clinton articulated 21st century vision grounded wisdom. To accuse Secretary Clinton embracing Soviet-bloc approach human rights includes development discussion democracy strains bonds credulity common sense, also walls crucial avenue ensuring people actually exercise rights naturally - including rights freedom religion, association, speech-in daily lives. As Secretary Clinton made clear, policies address development alone adequate: "Freedom doesn't come half measures, partial remedies solve whole problem," said. But experience shows us broad-based development occurs, people likely demand say securing futures, governments likely resources maintain strong institutions, including reliable police fair courts, help ensure consistent protection rights. Where people given right speak freely, participate nation's political process access basic information government, sustainable development UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05763225 Date: 06/30/2015 UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05763225 Date: 06/30/2015 likely occur. At time, democracies without development last. These mutually reinforcing tracks, Obama Administration committed pursuing simultaneously. As President Obama said Nobel lecture, "engagement repressive regimes lacks satisfying purity indignation." But Post's overheated outrage ignores lessons learned generations men women worked advance human rights around world. To suggest Secretary Clinton somehow provided excuses rights-abusing dictators speech forcefully criticized specific abuses across world, simply credible. Far excuse regime, approach pushes governments advance civil political rights ensure democracy actually delivers measure prosperity opportunity all. That right approach Obama Administration 21st century. ### UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05763225 Date: 06/30/2015

UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05764491 Date: 07/31/2015 SENSITIVE BUT UNCLASSIFIED RELEASE IN PART B5 The Secretary's Call Sheet UN Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon August 24, 2009 Purpose Call: You calling UN Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon ask co-host event UNGA advance Global Partnership Agriculture Food Security. • UNGA Food Security Event: I would like co-host event advance global agenda food security. We see country-led processes centerpiece new global agenda. This event would likely take place Thursday, September 24, 3:30pm. If cannot co-host meeting, I would welcome participation representative meeting. • Event Content: We would like event opportunity broad group global stakeholders commit food security principles agreed L'Aquila summit. We hope extend L'Aquila food security principles countries present summit. The event also focus highlighting country-led processes, Comprehensive African Agricultural Development Program (CAADP). I welcome thoughts issues would like meeting cover. We look UN provide leadership advancing global agenda. • Event Partners: We envision inviting Heads State senior ministers donor countries, signatories L'Aquila joint statement food security, developing nations. We would also like include foundations, NGOs, private sector, media, multilateral organizations. Background: We want Ban Ki-moon UN High Level Task Force play leading role combating global hunger. UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05771465 Date: 08/31/2015 RELEASE IN PART B5 August 30, 2010 LEADING THROUGH CIVILIAN POWER B5 HILLARY RODHAM CLINTON 1 UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05771465 Date: 08/31/2015 B5 UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05771465 Date: 08/31/2015
UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05772283 Date: 08/31/2015 August 30, 2010 RELEASE IN FULL LEADING THROUGH CIVILIAN POWER HILLARY RODHAM CLINTON Today's world crucible challenges testing American leadership.' A glance headlines — trend lines — explains why. In 21 months since President Obama took office, seen effects H1N1 health pandemic, earthquake small Caribbean island, floods southern Punjab ripple across oceans continents. And financial crisis Greece, torpedoed ship Yellow Sea, spike world food prices cause jitters Wall Street worries future well-being. Global problems — violent extremism worldwide recession climate change poverty — demand collective solutions, even power world becomes diffuse. They require effective international cooperation, even becomes harder achieve. And call American leadership, even world changes around us. I began tenure Secretary State stressing need elevate diplomacy development alongside defense — "smart power" approach solving global problems. To make approach succeed, however, civilian power must strengthened amplified. It must, Defense Secretary Robert Gates argued pages, brought better balance military power. This effort well underway. Congress already appropriated funds 1,108 new Foreign Civil service officers strengthen State Department's capacity pursue America's interests advance values. At USAID, doubling development officers, hiring 1,200 new foreign service officers specific skills experience required evolving development challenges, making effective use local hires overseas missions deep knowledge countries. We begun rebuilding USAID world's premier development organization, one seeds long-term growth, includes research arm, shapes policy innovation, uses metrics ensure investments cost-effective sound. But need more. We need rebuild — also rethink, reform, recalibrate. During years Senate Armed Services Committee, I saw Department Defense used Quadrennial Defense Review (QDR) align resources, policies, strategies present — future. No similar mechanism existed modernizing State Department USAID. But would unwise January 7, 2010 Op-Ed Contributor An Alliance Larger Than One Issue By JOSEPH S. NYE Jr. Cambridge, Mass. SEEN Tokyo, America's relationship Japan faces crisis. The immediate problem deadlock plan move American military base island Okinawa. It sounds simple, issue long back story could create serious rift one crucial allies. When I Pentagon decade ago, began planning reduce burden presence places Okinawa, houses half 47,000 American troops Japan. The Marine Corps Air Station Futenma particular problem proximity crowded city, Ginowan. After years negotiation, Japanese American governments agreed 2006 move base less populated part Okinawa move 8,000 Marines Okinawa Guam 2014. The plan thrown jeopardy last summer Japanese voted Liberal Democratic Party governed country nearly half century favor Democratic Party Japan. The new prime minister, Yukio Hatoyama, leads government inexperienced, divided still thrall campaign promises move base island Japan completely. The Pentagon properly annoyed Mr. Hatoyama trying go back agreement took decade work major implications Marine Corps' budget force realignment. Secretary Defense Robert Gates expressed displeasure trip Japan October, calling reassessment plan "counterproductive." When visited Tokyo November, President Obama agreed high-level working group consider Futenma question. But since then, Mr. Hatoyama said delay final decision relocation least May. Not surprisingly, Washington want play hardball new Japanese government. But would unwise, Mr. Hatoyama caught vise, Americans squeezing one side small left-wing party (upon majority upper house legislature depends) threatening quit coalition makes significant concessions Americans. Further complicating matters, future Futenma deeply contentious Okinawans. Even Mr. Hatoyama eventually gives base plan, need patient strategic approach Japan. We allowing second-order issue threaten long-term strategy East Asia. Futenma, worth noting, matter new government raised. It also speaks wanting equal alliance better relations China, creating East Asian community — though far clear means. When I helped develop Pentagon's East Asian Strategy Report 1995, started reality three major powers region — United States, Japan China — maintaining alliance Japan would shape environment China emerging. We wanted integrate China international UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05772449 Date: 08/31/2015 UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05772449 Date: 08/31/2015 system by, say, inviting join World Trade Organization, needed hedge danger future stronger China might turn aggressive. After year half extensive negotiations, United States Japan agreed alliance, rather representing cold war relic, basis stability prosperity region. President Bill Clinton Prime Minister Ryutaro Hashimoto affirmed 1996 Tokyo declaration <http://www.mofa.go.jp/region/n- america/us/security/security.html> . This strategy "integrate, hedge" continued guide American foreign policy years Bush administration. This year 50th anniversary United States-Japan security treaty. <http://www.mofa.go.jp/region/n- america/us/q&a/refahtml> The two countries miss major opportunity let base controversy lead bitter feelings reduction American forces Japan. The best guarantee security region China remains long-term challenge nuclear North Korea poses clear threat remains presence American troops, Japan helps maintain generous host nation support. Sometimes Japanese officials quietly welcome "gaiatsu," foreign pressure, help resolve bureaucratic deadlocks. But case here: United States undercuts new Japanese government creates resentment among Japanese public, victory Futenma could prove Pyrrhic. Joseph S. Original Message From: Dr. Mark Hyman To: H Sent: Tue Jan 12 16:16:38 2010 Subject: How Address Global Burden Chronic Disease Dear Hillary, I wanted pass thoughts formulating address global burden chronic disease get input We could short call time.. I thinking Paul Farmer created whole movement around infectious disease globally apply chronic disease -- yes - I would love meet talk problem. So here's problem. 1. By 2020 global mortality chronic disease claim 50 million lives compared 20 million communicable infectious disease currently mortality DEVELOPING WORLD 29 million people year chronic disease. 2. As know US, chronic disease care (usually end stage acute settings) accounts almost 80% health care expenditures. This likely increase globally developing countries countries like India diabetes rates 25%. Mortality heart disease China 35 44 year olds increased 300% last decades. 3. Global Funding prevention treatment causes chronic disease doesn't match disease burden unacceptable margin. 4. Less 5% funding governments, NGO's, private foundations chronic disease (i.e. World Bank - $4.5 billion health sector work, 2.5% non-communicable disease Global Fund focuses HIV/AIDS, malaria TB WHO spends $7.50 infectious disease $0.50 chronic disease, Gates Foundation: funding chronic disease). So here's I see solution We need movement create awareness, build messaging, fund comparative research innovative methods preventing treating chronic disease, develop changes medical education scale training providers effective prevention treatment chronic disease, build partnerships support demonstration projects initiatives, develop health information technology platforms support chronic disease prevention care integrated system disruptive technologies. grievous suffering people Haiti, including massive loss life, widespread injuries, extensive damage public infrastructure private property; urgent need immediate response requests Government Haiti paramount importance safe, swift effective implementation rescue, relief, recovery, reconstruction efforts; We this. o Recruiting: Limit variable year, build go. This spring go Georgetown, Univ Maryland Univ Miami University Florida/S. Florida. Miami). Valeo <http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Buckley_v._Valeo> (by I mean today's lamentable, straight-party-line Supreme Court ruling <http://online.wsj.com/article/SB10001424052748703699204575016942930090152.html> removes limits direct corporate underwriting political campaigns) -- one event today big ripple effects. I mean SecState Hillary Clinton's speech morning "Internet Freedom," mentioned <http://jamesfallows.theatlantic.com/archives/2010/01/hillary_clintons_internetfree.php> prelude discussion <http://jamesfallows.theatlantic.com/archives/2010/01/interesting_chinagoogle_discus.php> . I'm going take time thorough gloss speech. Instead I highly recommend reading full text, <http://www.state.gov/secretary/rm/2010/01/135519.htm>, watching official video, <http://link.brightcove.com/services/player/bcpid1705667530?bctid=62730021001> . And main points listening (and noting main points real time handy LiveScribe <http://jamesfallows.theatlantic.com/archives/2009/07/my_new_favorite_gadget_li.php> pen.) UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05773054 Date: 08/31/2015 UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05773054 Date: 08/31/2015 - In contrast dreamy Internet optimism decade ago -- I'm naming names, I remember! -- many people imagined info technology, itself, would undermine oppression bring world together, Clinton started astringent reminder technology, like others, neither good bad already used helpful destructive ways: "Amid unprecedented surge connectivity, must also recognize technologies unmitigated blessing. These tools also exploited undermine human progress political rights. Just steel used build hospitals machine guns, nuclear power either energize city destroy it, modern information networks technologies support harnessed good ill. The networks help organize movements freedom also enable al-Qaida spew hatred incite violence innocent. And technologies potential open access government promote transparency also hijacked governments crush dissent deny human rights." And nice pivot section, effective it's blunt plain: "On own, new technologies take sides struggle freedom progress, United States does." - Underscoring "this big deal" tone speech, enumerated "Four Freedoms <http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Four_Freedoms> "that FDR proclaimed 1941, part struggle world's future, said comparable set Four Freedoms Internet age. Check speech details. - The China surprise: speech More frontal challenge Chinese internet overall censorship policy I expected, I recall US-China interactions long time. For instance, early speech, itemization places suppression getting worse: "In last year, we've seen spike threats free flow information. China, Tunisia, Uzbekistan stepped censorship internet. In Vietnam, access popular social networking sites suddenly disappeared. And last Friday Egypt, 30 bloggers activists detained." Tunisia, Uzbekistan, Vietnam, Egypt -- grouping countries Chinese government, recent sense rise superpower status, used lumped with. Compared US financial power, OK; overtaking Japan economic size, yes; crucial player environmental negotiations... one thing. Bracketed sentence Tunisia Uzbekistan different. Sentences like don't appear formal, big- deal SecState addresses accident. Other passages effect: "As I speak today, government censors somewhere working furiously erase words records history. But history already condemned tactics.... "Those disrupt free flow information society pose threat economy, government, civil society. Countries individuals engage cyber attacks face consequences international condemnation...." I wondered whether speech would mention Google name -- reason think might not. (Main argument leaving implicit rather referring directly Google case: company's ongoing efforts find "win-win-win <http://jamesfallows.theatlantic.com/archives/2010/01/behind_on_google-china-ology.php> " acceptable way remain China, rather lose-lose-lose permanent split, it's necessarily help U.S. government standing officially side. ) But way Sec. Clinton introduced point significant: proxy China's ability fulfill potential <http://jamesfallows.theatlantic.com/archives/2010/01/about_the_stakes_for_china_in.php> sustain economic rise: "To use market terminology, publicly listed company Tunisia Vietnam operates environment censorship always trade discount relative identical firm free society. If corporate decision makers don't access global sources news information, investors less confidence decisions long term. Countries censor news information must recognize economic standpoint, distinction censoring political speech commercial speech. If businesses nations denied access either type information, inevitably impact growth. "Increasingly, U.S. companies making issue internet information freedom greater consideration business decisions. I hope competitors foreign governments pay close attention trend. The recent situation involving Google attracted great deal interest. And look Chinese authorities conduct thorough review cyber intrusions led Google make announcement. And also look investigation results transparent. "The internet already source tremendous progress China, fabulous. There many people China online. But countries restrict free access information violate basic rights internet users risk walling progress next century. Now, United States China different views issue, intend address differences candidly consistently context positive, cooperative, comprehensive relationship." There's lot speech, including terrorism, disaster relief, religion, etc -- it's reading. Back to-do list now. From: Rocha, Barbara Sent: Wednesday, January 20, 2010 1:26 PM To: Roberts, Asel K Subject: FW: Garcia Linera Haiti Rough translation points below: Evo Morales announced today government ask emergency meeting UN "reject U.S. military occupation" Haiti, according Spanish news agency EFE. "It possible U.S. using natural disaster invade occupy Haiti," said Morales, qualified "inhumane, savage, opportunist" deployment troops Caribbean island. "We'll ask UN, via Foreign Ministry, emergency meeting reject military occupation U.S. Haiti," announced Morales. Morales recalled President Obama guaranteed international fora wants partners respectful diplomatic relations countries. "You don't achieve (partners, diplomatic relations) military occupation, troops, bases," said expects "a pronouncement peoples world social forces rejecting intervention military occupation Haiti." Morales also asked "how much money, food water" destined 12,000 soldiers U.S. sent Haiti noted money "should spend victims." From: Rocha, Barbara Sent: Wednesday, January 20, 2010 1:09 PM To: Roberts, Asel K Subject: FW: Garcia Linera Haiti Following this, President Morales said call emergency meeting UN "reject U.S. military occupation Haiti." I've alerted 10. I'll reach Labor G staff offer briefing, keep looped in. EVO MORALES PIDE REUNION DE EMERGENCIA PARA REPUDIAR Y RECHAZAR A EEUU EN HAITI, INFORMA EFE Evo Morales anunciO hoy que su Gobierno pedira Naciones Unidas una reunion de emergencia para "repudiar y rechazar la ocupacion militar de Estados Unidos" en Haiti, informa la agencia espariola EFE. "No es posible que Estados Unidos use una desgracia natural para invadir y ocupar militarmente Haiti", dijo Morales, quien califico de "inhumano, salvaje y oportunista" el despliegue de las fuerzas armadas estadounidenses en la isla caribefia. "Vamos pedir mediante la cancilleria las Naciones Unidas una reunion de emergencia para repudiar y rechazar esta ocupaciOn militar de Estados Unidos hacia Haiti", anuncio Morales. Morales recordo que el mandatario de Estados Unidos, Barack Obama, ha garantizado en foros internacionales que desea tener socios y relaciones diplomaticas de respeto mutuo con el resto de 'Daises. "Ser socios o tener relaciones diplomaticas se hace con ocupacion militar, ni con tropas militares, ni con bases militares", dijo y espera "un pronunciamiento de todos los pueblos del mundo y de las fuerzas sociales rechazando esta intervention y ocupaciOn militar en Haiti". Morales se preguntO tambien "cuanta plata, cuantos alimentos o cuanta agua" se van destinar para abastecer los 12.000 soldados que Estados Unidos ha mandado Haiti y considero que ese dinero "deberia gastarse en los damnificados" por el terremoto y en los militares. • Confio en que el propio pueblo estadounidense rechace "el use abusivo" de sus recursos econornicos para lo que insistio en calificar como "intervenciOn militar". UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05773152 Date: 08/31/2015 UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05773152 Date: 08/31/2015 - In contrast dreamy Internet optimism decade ago -- I'm naming names, I remember! -- many people imagined info technology, itself, would undermine oppression bring world together, Clinton started astringent reminder technology, like others, neither good bad already used helpful destructive ways: "Amid unprecedented surge connectivity, must also recognize technologies unmitigated blessing. These tools also exploited undermine human progress political rights. Just steel used build hospitals machine guns, nuclear power either energize city destroy it, modern information networks technologies support harnessed good ill. The networks help organize movements freedom also enable al-Qaida spew hatred incite violence innocent. And technologies potential open access government promote transparency also hijacked governments crush dissent deny human rights." And nice pivot section, effective it's blunt plain: "On own, new technologies take sides struggle freedom progress, United States does." - Underscoring "this big deal" tone speech, enumerated "Four Freedoms <http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Four_Freedoms> " FDR proclaimed 1941, part struggle world's future, said comparable set Four Freedoms Internet age. Check speech details. - The China surprise: speech frontal challenge Chinese Internet overall censorship policy I expected, I recall US-China interactions long time. For instance, early speech, itemization places suppression getting worse: "In last year, we've seen spike threats free flow information. China, Tunisia, Uzbekistan stepped censorship internet. In Vietnam, access popular social networking sites suddenly disappeared. And last Friday Egypt, 30 bloggers activists detained." Tunisia, Uzbekistan, Vietnam, Egypt -- grouping countries Chinese government, recent sense rise superpower status, used lumped with. Compared US financial power, OK; overtaking Japan economic size, yes; crucial player environmental negotiations... one thing. Bracketed sentence Tunisia Uzbekistan different. Sentences like don't appear formal, big- deal SecState addresses accident. Other passages effect: "As I speak today, government censors somewhere working furiously erase words records history. But history already condemned tactics.... "Those disrupt free flow information society pose threat economy, government, civil society. Countries individuals engage cyber attacks face consequences international condemnation...." Clinton introduced point significant: proxy China's ability fulfill potential <http://jamesfallows.theatlantic.com/archives/2010/01/about_the_stakes_for_china_in.php> sustain economic rise: "To use market terminology, publicly listed company Tunisia Vietnam operates environment censorship always trade discount relative identical firm free society. If corporate decision makers don't access global sources news information, investors less confidence decisions long term. Countries censor news information must recognize economic standpoint, distinction censoring political speech commercial speech. If businesses nations denied access either type information, inevitably impact growth. "Increasingly, U.S. companies making issue internet information freedom greater consideration business decisions. I hope competitors foreign governments pay close attention trend. The recent situation involving Google attracted great deal interest. And look Chinese authorities conduct thorough review cyber intrusions led Google make announcement. And also look investigation results transparent. "The internet already source tremendous progress China, fabulous. There many people China online. But countries restrict free access information violate basic rights internet users risk walling progress next century. Now, United States China different views issue, intend address differences candidly consistently context positive, cooperative, comprehensive relationship." Original Message From: Mills, Cheryl D <MillsCD@state.gov> To: H Sent: Thu Jan 21 21:57:11 2010 Subject: FW: Griot education project Haiti - anothter idea -- much quicker ramp-up fyi From: David Domenici [mailto Sent: Thursday, January 21,2010 8:54 PM To: Mills, Cheryl D Subject: Griot education project Haiti - anothter idea -- much quicker ramp-up Cheryl: After watching scenes TV, talking w/ others, idea nearly immediate way get kids back 'in school' school first time. It would cheap, could get started soon—say mid-February, could linked distribution networks (food/medical supplies), would quite organic grassroots. I'll call Griot education project (in west African tradition streetside storytellers). Context/Understanding: Looks like hundred thousand kids Port-au-Prince pretty soon (already are) sitting around day-to-day wi less nothing do. Their schools got destroyed, neighborhoods rough shape. These young kids would best served could get house hours day (possibly even freeing parents rebuilding work), spend time getting caught crime, desperately searching rubble mal eat...and get back school, engage naturally curious brains. The goal program immediately give place go, chance interface energetic educator, least expose relevant, skill-enhancing academic work engages rebuild education infrastructure. It also would likely get 1 meal day, needed way get referred immediate medical attention. UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05773156 Date: 08/31/2015 UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05773156 Date: 08/31/2015 Griot Educators: We recruit equip cadre teachers go communities set portable materials morning—educators days find place teach, attracted class students. This modeled street artist/storyteller. We flyer neighborhoods, advertising teaching positions. We work w/ whoever find help us identify people good teachers prior earthquake and/or people abilty attract kids (appropriately). We select teachers. We agree pay daily/weekly stipend. We want people know communities, don't need lot direction, take cart full educational materials, find corner, abandoned building start teaching whoever shows up. People anything get young kids try read math problems sing songs write poetry... Education Supply Centers We set education supply centers distribution system. Each center staffed small team-1 lead person education-leader, others admin support. Griots come center morning, get day's worth educational materials (we select it, photocopy it, give 50 pencils, etc.). We agree send 50 meals two hours later. Each Griot wheels portable classroom his/her spot sets shop...Kids come, he/she teaches. It builds momentum kids get streets, homes come morning 'school' site. Kids come get meal. Maybe end w/ 3 tiers Griots-1 works w/ 4, 5, 6 year olds, 1 7, 8, 9 year olds, 1 10, 11, 12 year olds. Each one picks packet material less appropriate age group. All incredibly flexible fluid. Maybe one morning session lunch session. The education supply centers warehouses set up. They copiers, lots paper, basic school supplies, art supplies, etc. (Over time, maybe people donate bunch books magazines, etc—they become ways artists, volunteers, entertainers connect w/ kids, well.) Each morning group Griots go supply centers pick materials, fill cart...and roll block, blocks set 'school' day. Maybe someone wants donate bunch art supplies, harmonicas—who knows—whatever takes get kids show academic enrichment activities. These education supply centers likely get linked distribution hubs. This way get linked w/ food supplies. Longer-term/setting stage longer-term ramp Over time, Griots end running little schools start feel permanent. Kids bring chairs stools...maybe teaching material ends staying school sites, end likely places folks build/rebuild schools. But near term, 'school' whatever spot Griot goes he/she attract cadre kids—and good news almost anywhere. Some Griots would take stipend teach; wouldn't well; would pawn food/biscuits...But could weed much w/ sort approach, don't let bad apples spoil larger program (or fear stop getting started). FOR IMMEDIATE RELEASE CONTACT: PPFA Media Relations 202-973-4882 February 2, 2010 Statement Cecile Richards International Family Planning Obama Administration Budget WASHINGTON, DC —The women world true friends Secretary State Hillary Rodham Clinton Obama administration. After years inadequate funding previous administration, yesterday's Fiscal Year 2011 budget request increase international family planning critical step forward demonstrating nation's renewed commitment ensuring women worldwide access safe effective reproductive health care. The Obama administration sent strong signal status quo unacceptable. Every year half million women — nearly live developing countries — die pregnancy-related causes. Moreover, one three deaths related pregnancy childbirth could avoided women wanted effective contraception access it. To strengthen working relationships partners around world, well image, United States must increase access family planning. By ensuring women increased access family planning need, nation working make good commitment promote health women families. An investment family planning investment reaps significant dividends. By providing education, counseling contraceptives women couples, working strengthen families worldwide. We also help achieve major reductions infant maternal mortality, HIV infections global poverty. As Secretary Clinton said, "There's direct connection woman's ability plan family, space pregnancies, give birth safely, ability get education, work outside home, support family, participate fully life cornmunity." Planned Parenthood works partners across globe eliminate barriers basic reproductive health care essential health well-being women, men children everywhere. Limited access health care, lack political will, legal regulatory restrictions, cultural taboos, harsh gender inequality put women risk unintended pregnancy, unsafe abortion childbirth, HIV sexually transmitted infections. It's kind typical collective dissection come expect never really existed before: serious, speculative; arcane, funny, brilliant, baked, etc. The Sunlight Foundation blogging <http://blog.sunlightfoundation.com/2010/01/22/wait-can-foreign-companies- now-spend-on-us-political-elections/> predictably good. Paul Blumenthal dips multinational dimension new "corporation full citizen-person" framework, drawing blogging going Newsweek <http://biog.newsweek.com/blogs/thegaggle/archive/2010/01/22/should-foreign-corporations-spend-money-on-u-s- political-candidates.aspx> Center Public Integrity <http://www.publicintegrity.org/articles/entry/1913/> . "Looks like [the Court] might support allowing foreign companies spend freely elections United States. I guess would corporate globalization U.S. electoral system." So gotta ask yourself: Who Hugo Chavez want President? Blumenthal excerpting Center Public Integrity: <http://coloradoindependent.com/wp-content/uploads/2010/01/Picture-142.png> The Center Public Integrity looks closer shows kind foreign influence looking at: One prominent examples CITGO Petroleum Company — American-born Cities Services Company, purchased 1990 Venezuelan government-owned Petroieos de Venezuela S.A. The Citizens UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05773220 Date: 08/31/2015 B6 UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05773220 Date: 08/31/2015 United ruling could conceivably allowVenezuelan President Hugo Chavez, sharply criticized past two U.S. presidents, spend government funds defeat American political candidate, CITGO buy TV ads bashing target. And it's Chavez. The Saudi government owns Houston's Saudi Refining Company half Motive Enterprises. Lenovo, bought IBM's PC assets 2004, partially owned Chinese government's Chinese Academy Sciences. And Singapore's APL Limited operates several U.S. port operations. A weakening limit corporate giving could mean China, Saudi Arabia, Singapore, country owns companies operate U.S. could also significant sway American electioneering. I really can't see Americans happy this. Dahlia Lithwick reported Slate <http://www.slate.com/id/2242208/> Supreme Court opinions read. She offered aside: While Stevens reading portion concurrence "cautious view corporate power" held framers, I see Justice Thomas chuckle softly. Was disdainful chuckle impotence colleague? Was merely chuckle disagreement, good-natured exasperation? Was chuckle anachronistic vision framers set beside today's modern corporate silicon steel behemoths? I doubt thinking Hugo Chavez. Sid Northern Ireland agrees power-sharing deal Gordon Brown hails historic deal see justice policing powers devolved Stormont 12 April Henry McDonald <http://www.guardian.co.uk/profile/henrymcdonald> * guardian.co.uk <http://www.guardian.co.ukh , Friday 5 February 2010 11.42 GMT <http://www.guardian.co.uk/help/accessibility> Gordon Brown, Peter Robinson Martin McGuinness <http://static.guim.co.uk/sys- images/Guardian/Pix/pictures/2010/2/5/1265368562294/Gordon-Brown-Peter-Robins-001.jpg> Gordon Brown, DUP leader, Peter Robinson, Sinn Fein's Martin McGuinness (I r) talk press Northern Ireland power-sharing deal announced. Photograph: Julien Behal/PA Justice policing powers devolved Northern Ireland <http://www.guardian.co.uk/uk/northernireland>'s power-sharing government 12 April historic deal agreed main parties "opens new chapter" decades violence, Gordon Brown said today. Standing alongside Irish counterpart, Brian Cowen, press conference Hillsborough Castle outside Belfast, prime minister said "inspirational" agreement Sinn Fein <http://www.guardian.co.uk/politics/sinn-fein> Democratic Unionist party (DUP) <http://www.guardian.co.uk/politics/dup> foundation lasting peace. The deal — finally agreed DUP <http://www.guardian.co.uk/politics/2010/feb/05/northern-ireland-dup-ulster- deal> last night described final piece jigsaw long search peace — comes two weeks round-the-clock negotiations brings end fears power-sharing government might collapse. It see policing justice powers devolved Westminster assembly within weeks includes new plans overseeing parades. Brown, travelled Belfast morning, said agreement possible "a new spirit mutual co-operation respect". The deal meets key Sinn Fein demand prevents republican party walking power-sharing executive. In return, DUP secured reforms way loyalist marches handled Northern Ireland, including abolition Parades Commission, body unionists regard biased favour nationalists. UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05773249 Date: 08/31/2015 UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05773249 Date: 08/31/2015 A cross-community vote held Stormont assembly 9 March policing justice powers devolved London 12 April. Brown told reporters: "The achievements great inspirational. This moment agreement belongs people Northern Ireland, people, ever future ... This last chapter long troubled story beginning new chapter decades violence, years talks, weeks stalemate." Cowen praised unionists nationalists making "fair balanced compromises" bridge divisions said quality negotiations meant "devolved institutions work". The Northern Ireland secretary, Shaun Woodward, said deal would isolate republican dissidents launched three separate gun bomb attacks police stations province last 10 days. The deal would "absolutely" make Northern Ireland safer place, said. The DUP leader, Peter Robinson, said agreement "will enduring becauie time spent" forming it. Referring back Belfast Agreement 1998 <http://www.nio.gov.uk/the-agreement> negotiations bore fruit 11th hour, Sinn Fein president, Gerry Adams, described current deal the'rescue power-sharing "yet another good Friday". Jeffrey Donaldson told Guardian DUP's 36-strong assembly team unanimously favour deal. But Ulster Unionist party (UUP) yet officially back package allow assembly set legislation change way parades judged. A UUP spokeswoman said members wanted see proposed agreement giving response two governments. "We sight agreement signing it," said. The talks, centred Hillsborough Castle, outside Belfast, longest set continuous negotiations held near 20-year peace process. Sinn Fein accused DUP stalling transfer policing powers last three years feared failure find agreement could see collapse power-sharing government led two parties. The agreement finally came near midnight Stormont's parliament building. Earlier evening Sinn Fein said basis deal table giving DUP leadership time persuade party accept it. Robinson emerged meeting party colleagues confirm secured unanimous support proposals. Earlier week 14 DUP assembly members opposed proposed deal give unionists enough concessions. Robinson said would look gain support community smaller assembly parties deal. "We basis upon go forward recommend [the deal] party, parties Northern Ireland community. "An essential element Democratic Unionist Party's manifesto requirement community confidence; believe basis gaining confidence." However leader hardline Traditional Unionist Voice (TUV), Jim Allister, questioned 14 DUP rebels changed minds. "The deal hasn't changed, snowmen DUP, melted heat came on," Allister said. The DUP faces struggle ward TUV threat forthcoming general election. Allister portray deal sell-out unionist principles sop republicanism. UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05773249 Date: 08/31/2015

And I doubt will. Too much else going on. Also, put statement get stories anyone else. I still press event. Sid Northern Ireland agrees power-sharing deal Gordon Brown hails historic deal see justice policing powers devolved Stormont 12 April * Henry McDonald <http://www.guardian.co.uk/profile/henrymcdonald> * guardian.co.uk <http://www.guardian.co.ukh , Friday 5 February 2010 11.42 GMT * <http://www.guardian.co.uk/help/accessibility> Gordon Brown, Peter Robinson Martin McGuinness <http://static.guim.co.uk/sys- images/Guardian/Pix/pictures/2010/2/5/1265368562294/Gordon-Brown-Peter-Robins-001.jpg> Gordon Brown, DUP leader, Peter Robinson, Sinn Fein's Martin McGuinness (I r) talk press Northern Ireland power-sharing deal announced. Photograph: Julien Behal/PA UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05773258 Date: 08/31/2015 UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05773258 Date: 08/31/2015 Justice policing powers devolved Northern Ireland <http://www.guardian.co.uk/uk/northernireland> 's power-sharing government 12 April historic deal agreed main parties "opens new chapter" decades violence, Gordon Brown said today. Standing alongside Irish counterpart, Brian Cowen, press conference Hillsborough Castle outside Belfast, prime minister said "inspirational" agreement Sinn Fein <http://www.guardian.co.uk/politics/sinn-fein> Democratic Unionist party (DUP) <http://www.guardian.co.uk/politics/dup> foundation lasting peace. The deal — finally agreed DUP <http://www.guardian.co.uk/politics/2010/feb/05/northern-ireland-dup-ulster- deal> last night described final piece jigsaw long search peace — comes two weeks round-the-clock negotiations brings end fears power-sharing government might collapse. It see policing justice powers devolved Westminster assembly within weeks includes new plans overseeing parades. Brown, travelled Belfast morning, said agreement possible "a new spirit mutual co-operation respect". The deal meets key Sinn Fein demand prevents republican party walking power-sharing executive. In return, DUP secured reforms way loyalist marches handled Northern Ireland, including abolition Parades Commission, body unionists regard biased favour nationalists. A cross-community vote held Stormont assembly 9 March policing justice powers devolved London 12 April. Brown told reporters: "The achievements great inspirational. This moment agreement belongs people Northern Ireland, people, ever future ... This last chapter long troubled story beginning new chapter decades violence, years talks, weeks stalemate." Cowen praised unionists nationalists making "fair balanced compromises" bridge divisions said quality negotiations meant "devolved institutions work". The Northern Ireland secretary, Shaun Woodward, said deal would isolate republican dissidents launched three separate gun bomb attacks police stations province last 10 days. The deal would "absolutely" make Northern Ireland safer place, said. The DUP leader, Peter Robinson, said agreement "will enduring time spent" forming it. Referring back Belfast Agreement 1998 <http://www.nio.gov.uk/the-agreement> negotiations bore fruit 11th hour, Sinn Fein president, Gerry Adams, described current deal rescue power-sharing "yet another good Friday". Jeffrey Donaldson told Guardian DUP's 36-strong assembly team unanimously favour deal. But Ulster Unionist party (UUP) yet officially back package allow assembly set legislation change way parades judged. A UUP spokeswoman said members wanted see proposed agreement giving response two governments. "We sight agreement signing it," said. The talks, centred Hillsborough Castle, outside Belfast, longest set continuous negotiations held near 20-year peace process. Sinn Fein accused DUP stalling transfer policing powers last three years feared failure find agreement could see collapse power-sharing government led two parties. The agreement finally came near midnight Stormont's parliament building. Earlier evening Sinn Fein said basis deal table giving DUP leadership time persuade party accept it. Robinson emerged meeting party colleagues confirm secured unanimous support proposals. Earlier week 14 DUP assembly members opposed proposed deal give unionists enough concessions. Robinson said would look gain support community smaller assembly parties deal. "We basis upon go forward recommend [the deal] party, parties Northern Ireland community. "An essential element Democratic Unionist Party's manifesto requirement community confidence; believe basis gaining confidence." However leader hardline Traditional Unionist Voice (TUV), Jim Allister, questioned 14 DUP rebels changed minds. Sid Northern Ireland agrees power-sharing deal Gordon Brown hails historic deal see justice policing powers devolved Stormont 12 April * Henry McDonald <http://www.guardian.co.uk/profile/henrymcdonald> * guardian.co.uk <http://www.guardian.co.uk/> , Friday 5 February 2010 11.42 GMT * <http://www.guardian.co.uk/help/accessibility> Gordon Brown, Peter Robinson Martin McGuinness <http://static.guim.co.uk/sys- images/Guardian/Pix/pictures/2010/2/5/1265368562294/Gordon-Brown-Peter-Robins-001.jpg> Gordon Brown, DUP leader, Peter Robinson, Sinn Fein's Martin McGuinness (I r) talk press Northern Ireland power-sharing deal announced. Photograph: Julien Behal/PA UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05773263 Date: 08/31/2015 UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05773263 Date: 08/31/2015 Justice policing powers devolved Northern Ireland <http://www.guardian.co.uk/uk/northernireland>'s power-sharing government 12 April historic deal agreed main parties "opens new chapter" decades violence, Gordon Brown said today. Standing alongside Irish counterpart, Brian Cowen, press conference Hillsborough Castle outside Belfast, prime minister said "inspirational" agreement Sinn Fein <http://www.guardian.co.uk/politics/sinn-fein> Democratic Unionist party (DUP) <http://www.guardian.co.uk/politics/dup> foundation lasting peace. The deal — finally agreed DUP <http://www.guardian.co.uk/politics/2010/feb/05/northern-ireland-dup-ulster- deal> last night described final piece jigsaw long search peace — comes two weeks round-the-clock negotiations brings end fears power-sharing government might collapse. It see policing justice powers devolved Westminster assembly within weeks includes new plans overseeing parades. Brown, travelled Belfast morning, said agreement possible "a new spirit mutual co-operation respect". The deal meets key Sinn Fein demand prevents republican party walking power-sharing executive. In return, DUP secured reforms way loyalist marches handled Northern Ireland, including abolition Parades Commission, body unionists regard biased favour nationalists. A cross-community vote held Stormont assembly 9 March policing justice powers devolved London 12 April. Brown told reporters: "The achievements great inspirational. This moment agreement belongs people Northern Ireland, people, ever future ... This last chapter long troubled story beginning new chapter decades violence, years talks, weeks stalemate." Cowen praised unionists nationalists making "fair balanced compromises" bridge divisions said quality negotiations meant "devolved institutions work". The Northern Ireland secretary, Shaun Woodward, said deal would isolate republican dissidents launched three separate gun bomb attacks police stations province last 10 days. The deal would "absolutely" make Northern Ireland safer place, said. The DUP leader, Peter Robinson, said agreement "will enduring time spent" forming it. Referring back Belfast Agreement 1998 <http://www.nio.gov.uk/the-agreement> negotiations bore fruit 11th hour, Sinn Fein president, Gerry Adams, described current deal rescue power-sharing "yet another good Friday". Jeffrey Donaldson told Guardian DUP's 36-strong assembly team unanimously favour deal. But Ulster Unionist party (UUP) yet officially back package allow assembly set legislation change way parades judged. A UUP spokeswoman said members wanted see proposed agreement giving response two governments. "We sight agreement signing it," said. The talks, centred Hillsborough Castle, outside Belfast, longest set continuous negotiations held near 20-year peace process. Sinn Fein accused DUP stalling transfer policing powers last three years feared failure find agreement could see collapse power-sharing government led two parties. The agreement finally came near midnight Stormont's parliament building. Earlier evening Sinn Fein said basis deal table giving DUP leadership time persuade party accept it. Robinson emerged meeting party colleagues confirm secured unanimous support proposals. Earlier week 14 DUP assembly members opposed proposed deal give unionists enough concessions. Robinson said would look gain support community smaller assembly parties deal. "We basis upon go forward recommend [the deal] party, parties Northern Ireland community. "An essential element Democratic Unionist Party's manifesto requirement community confidence; believe basis gaining confidence." However leader hardline Traditional Unionist Voice (TUV), Jim Allister, questioned 14 DUP rebels changed minds.
