This against. Betrayed They said save Afghanistan's women. So come haven't? BY VALERIE M. HUDSON, PATRICIA LEIDL I MAY 10, 2010 One day November 2009, Helmand province's capital Lashkar Gah, group Afghan widows divorcees met Patricia, commissioned write series success stories U.S. Agency International Development (USAID). All women 20s, 30s, 40s looked 60s. Until recently, none could work possessed marketable skills, could neither read write, risk killed left homes. A number women said that, program -- focused tailoring basic literacy -- children used weep night hunger. It allows men exert almost total control female relatives offers power prohibit women's access work, education, health care denying right leave homes except "legitimate" purposes. One reason fallacious notion, common among coalition members, Afghan "culture" allow gender equality forcing issue undermine Western interests. Pat heard openly one coalition representative, prefers remain anonymous: "There point pushing gender equality. It alienate [Afghans]." Of course, "them" refers men. But decision-makers forget culture fixed, highly mutable dynamic. More 30 years ago, Afghan women attending universities, teaching, working doctors, nurses, professors. Far black hole gender apartheid, Afghanistan, though impoverished, progressive many Muslim neighbors. Furthermore, many young Afghans open new ways things. In 2009, hundreds Afghan men women bravely stood together Kabul protest Karzai's support new oppressive Shiite family law. If Americans assume Afghan men Neanderthals incapable sympathizing plight sisters, wrong. Another, unmentionable reason may chauvinism permeates Western military culture. U.S. military life, despite increasing female recruitment even "female engagement teams," remains bastion masculinity, little sensitivity toward questions female rights. For military leadership recruits alike, immured almost exclusively male world, complete absence women Afghanistan's streets villages elicited comment Marines surrounded Pat, though woman noticed immediately. And ready availability pornography U.S. bases, coupled seamier depictions life West, damages prospects gender equality extension, Western interests. As one young, well-educated 24-year-old Afghan male pointed out, "Your culture respect women all. Look pornography way exploit women ways can't even imagine. Do call progress?" Added another Afghan USAID programmer working Gardez, man 50s father three girls, "It would better coalition could figure way limit kind material." We better -- much better. The Obama administration must instill military personnel senior diplomats necessity fully protecting women's rights. Key educating gender equality furthers Western interests security. The military spend less time courting "moderate" Taliban time showing Afghan community leaders gender equality -- including female access family planning methods -- result healthier families, lower maternal child death rates, poverty alleviation, greater self-determination. Gender included component governance training placed front center upcoming "peace jirga" include Taliban. Indeed, let half negotiating team representing government coalition female: yes, full 50 percent. Women must also represented government. As Melanne Verveer, U.S. ambassador large global women's issues, noted <http://www.state.gov/s/gwi/rls/rem/2009/125512.htm> last summer, speaking female politicians Afghanistan, "There one minister cabinet, powerless. There low percentage women civil service. There one female governor, Bamiyan." Obama must insist important changes women leave make subsequent aid contingent upon maintenance strong presence women Afghan government. Better yet, coalition needs support "regime change" building democratic institutions groom moderate, educated middle class young women men eventually take over. Over two-thirds Afghan population age 25, either real opportunity social change -- educated given chance shape society progressive way -- major obstacle, find without jobs, unable marry, burdened retrograde attitudes means male female. We must hold Afghanistan responsible treaty obligations U.N. Convention Elimination Discrimination Women (CEDAW) U.N. Security Council Resolution 1325 women, peace, security. Sid Times Online Logo 222 x 25 <http://www.timesonline.co.uk/tol/img/global/tol-logo-222x25.gif> Print page <http://www.timesonline.co.uk/tol/news/politics/article7096632.ece?print=yes&randnum=1271197986619#> From Times Online April 14, 2010 Tory lead narrows amid huge voter disenchantment, Times poll finds Conservative party leader David Cameron launches party's manifesto Battersea Power Station, London, England <http://www.tinnesonline.co.uk/multimedia/archive/00707/cameron-_707420a.jpg> <http://www.timesonline.co.uk/tol/news/politics/xxx> Image :1 2 <http://www.timesonline.co.uk/tol/news/politics/xxx> Peter Riddell The general election race tightening, according Populus poll The Times reveals deep public disenchantment campaign far. The poll, undertaken yesterday morning, says voters hoping hung parliament either Tory Labour outright victory. Conservative support slipped three points past week 36 per cent, Labour point 33 per cent. The Liberal Democrats unchanged 21 per cent. The polls tend fluctuate couple points either way, shifts within margin error average. With new polls pointing firming Labour support, party may enjoyed small boost manifesto launch. Tory strategists hope achieved boost manifesto launch today. If Populus figures repeated general election three weeks' time, uniform switch votes, Labour would largest single party, 300 MPs, ahead Tories 264 Lib Dems 54. This would point Lab/Lib Dem coalition. But many analysts expect uniform national swing. The latest poll shows 32 per cent public hope hung parliament (as opposed expecting one), 28 per cent wanting Tory majority 22 per cent Labour one..Lib Dem voters prefer deal Labour Tories hung parliament, 44 31 per cent. The public evenly split 40 42 per cent whether want Labour Tories either majority minority government. The poll shows number expecting Tory overall majority risen three points 34 per cent past week. This exceeds number expecting hung parliament, 33 per cent, six points compared week ago. Overall, 57 per cent expect Tories largest party, 29 per cent expecting Labour be. Only 4 per cent think completely honest tax plans, 61 per cent partly honest. Only 6 per cent say completely honest cutting deficit 61 per cent partly honest. Some 7 per cent say completely honest extent fund policies cutting waste 58 per cent partly honest. Voters asked say party proposed eight key manifesto pledges. They wrongly identified four: reducing increase national insurance contributions (naming Labour Tories); allowing unsuccessful schools, hospitals police (the Tories, Labour); tightening takeover rules (the Tories Labour); requiring foreign workers employed public services speak fluent English (the Tories Labour). In one case, £150-a-year tax break, half voters (60 per cent) correctly identify party making proposal. In cases, pledge make little difference people's votes, apart three made Labour: foreign workers language pledge, doubling paid paternity leave allowing takover unsuccessful schools, hospitals etc. More two fifths (43 per cent), including 50 per cent women, say "none parties", "don't know", asked party putting across convincing cases voters. This compares 25 per cent naming Tories 18 per cent Labour. Just half public (54 per cent) plan watch first televised leaders' debate Thursday evening. Men middle class professionals likely say view. More two fifths (42 per cent) expect David Cameron win debate, 22 per cent Gordon Brown. More Tories (70 per cent) Labour voters ( 57 per cent) expect leader win. Two fifths public (42 per cent, one point week ago) say seems like change Labour, sure time change Conservatives. Some 33 per cent, one point, think time change Tories. Gates Says U.S. Lacks Strategy Curb Iran's Nuclear Drive By DAVID E. SANGER THOM SHANKER Published: April 18, 2010 • WASHINGTON - Defense Secretary Robert M. Gates warned secret three-page memorandum top White House officials United States effective long-range policy dealing Iran's steady progress toward nuclear capability, according government officials familiar document. Several officials said highly classified analysis, written January President Obama's national security adviser, Gen. James L. Jones, touched intense effort inside Pentagon, White House intelligence agencies develop new options Mr. Obama. They include revised set military alternatives, still development, considered diplomacy sanctions fail force Iran change course. Officials familiar memo's contents would describe portions dealing strategy policy, sections apparently dealt secret operations Iran, deal Persian Gulf allies. To people local disability community, Dee Delaney household name. When news came spring intention retire executive director FISA Foundation August, one could almost hear collective gasp. With 14 years helm small influential foundation, Ms. Delaney pronounced lasting influence quality life region. On behalf FISA, Ms. Delaney changed local landscape funding projects far-reaching results, bringing people together craft solutions longstanding problems becoming personally involved many projects foundation funds. She became first executive director FISA Foundation began 1996 proceeds sale Harmarville Rehabilitation Center, nonprofit, HealthSouth, for-profit organization. The new foundation would continue mission Federation Independent School Alumnae, organization opened convalescent home women 1911 Harmarville Rehabilitation Center 1954. That mission improve lives women, girls people disabilities Western Pennsylvania. Ms. Delaney, involved Harmarville since 1980 -- starting volunteer ending development director foundation -- sought job leading FISA. "I realized impact foundation could have. FISA large foundation, it's focused foundation," said. Over past 14 years, FISA's endowment grown $38 million. Over $17 million granted 726 projects 298 organizations. A roll call projects funded FISA reflects progressive thinking including people disabilities aspects life, especially access health care. Programs become national models. Women disabilities, example, often encounter barriers typical healthcare settings. Standard exam tables diagnostic equipment designed able-bodied, medical staff often struggle accommodate individuals special needs. FISA provided seed money Center Women Disabilities Magee-Womens Hospital UPMC, one first clinics nation. FISA involved overall issue improving access healthcare people disabilities. Likewise, people disabilities difficulty obtaining dental care. A FISA-funded project Achieva creating statewide, systemic solutions. FISA also provided support Center Patients Special Needs Pitt's School Dental Medicine. FISA also taken lead training arts cultural venues make events accessible helping places worship welcoming. "Dee national leader field. If people like her, wouldn't issues have," said Kim Hutchinson, executive director Disability Funders Network, based Virginia. Ms. Delaney board officer group since 2004. "People talk strategies, never move forward solutions. Dee brings stakeholders together get solutions," said Ms. Murray. "I think Dee greatly influenced next generation nonprofit philanthropic leaders, leading example value true collaboration," said Susie Chase, board member FISA former executive director Working Order, FISA grantee. "With Dee, never role, FISA's role, always unmet needs community work needs done. That seems bring best every partner, everyone privilege working her." Ms. Chase added advice technical assistance Ms. Delaney provided Working Order "were equal greater value organization grant funds." "I still, many years, never come away meeting Dee I haven't learned something, inspired work harder, understood clearly value someone else's ideas efforts." In retirement, Ms. Delaney plans "give back community new ways," said. A new frontier helping young people disabilities prepare employment leadership. "We keep fire burning." On May 19, FISA announced Kristy Trautmann, served foundation's program director six years, promoted executive director. "We sought person would follow Ms. Delaney's visionary leadership guide foundation next decade," said Jane Burger, chaired search committee. "We know found person Kristy Trautmann. She understands challenges facing populations foundation supports trust board community." UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05774936 Date: 08/31/2015

UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05774983 Date: 08/31/2015 RELEASE IN FULL From: H <hrod17@clintonemail.com> Sent: Tuesday, April 20, 2010 10:08 AM To: 'abedinh@state.gov' Subject: Re: Statement sign Ok go. Original Message From: Abedin, Huma <AbedinH@state.gov> To: H Sent: Tue Apr 20 09:40:12 2010 Subject: Statement sign Joint Statement Former President Clinton Secretary State Clinton Passing Dr. Dorothy Height We deeply saddened learn passing Dr. Dorothy. Height, icon America's long march toward equality personal inspiration us both. As woman among "Big Six" civil rights leaders, Dr. Height helped galvanize movement changed country forever. She organized "Wednesdays Mississippi" meetings brought black white women together find common ground break barriers. She never stopped fighting knew right. And all, always best dressed woman room. We blessed know Dr. Height, benefit grace, passion wisdom, call friend. For decades, starting early days Children's Defense Fund, worked her, learned her, drew inspiration example. From Presidential Medal Freedom, Congressional Gold Medal, unveiling long-sought-after bust Sojourner Truth United States Capitol, privilege helping honor Dr. Height accomplishments. Born women right vote, denied access college choice color skin, witness nation divided, Dr. Height dedicated life proposition Americans opportunity live full God-given potential. Our nation poorer loss infinitely richer life led, progress achieved, people touched. Our thoughts prayers Dr. Height's family today, many loving friends colleagues. She would first tell us best way honor memory carry forward work started causes championed, open wide freedom gates. May find strength wisdom live legacy. UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05774983 Date: 08/31/2015

Ever since became Secretary State, favorables soared mid-60's <http://www.pollingreport.com/C2.htm#Hillary>, putting well clear statewide officeholder country. The national figures viewed favorably Clinton Michelle Obama <http://www.pollingreport.com/o.htm#Michelle>, Colin Powell <http://www.pollingreport.com/p.htm#Powell>, David Patraeus <http://www.pollingreport.com/p.htm#Petraeus>. However, never run office, invariably lowers favorables. Hillary Clinton turn 69 final week 2016 campaign, makes slightly younger Ronald Reagan first elected 1980. Also, Secretary State, major presidential candidate, U.S. Senator, First Lady, also probably credentialed potential Presidential candidate, too. There even talk may become next Secretary Defense <http://www.politico.com/news/stories/O51O/37672.html>, adding credentials. Some said that, choosing Joe Biden Vice-President, Barack Obama pick successor lead Democratic Party. However, needs rethinking. Because Barack Obama made Secretary State, Hillary Clinton remains remarkably well-positioned run President 2016, even 2008. Anyway, good holiday weekend. Original Message From: Mills, Cheryl D <MillsCD@state.gov> To: H Cc: Sullivan, Jacob J <Sullivanii@state.gov> Sent: Thu Apr 22 10:18:23 2010 Subject: FW: Obama Backs Down Sudan FYI Kristof's OpEd From Today's NY Times. April 22, 2010 Op-Ed Columnist Obama Backs Down Sudan By NICHOLAS D. KRISTOF JUBA, Sudan Until reached White House, Barack Obama repeatedly insisted United States apply pressure Sudan avoid humanitarian catastrophe Darfur elsewhere. Yet, president, Mr. Obama aides caved, leaving Sudan gloating American weakness. Western monitors, Sudanese journalists local civil society groups found month's Sudanese elections deeply flawed - yet Mr. Obama's special envoy Sudan, Maj. Gen. Scott Gration, pre-emptively defended elections, saying would "as free fair possible." The White House showed hint backbone hurried reference week "an essential step" "serious irregularities." President Omar Hassan al-Bashir Sudan - man wanted International Criminal Court crimes humanity Darfur - celebrating. His regime calls National Congress Party, N.C.P., quoted Sudan telling rally Blue Nile region: "Even America becoming N.C.P. member. No one will." Memo Mr. Obama: When man charged crimes humanity tells world America pocket, it's time review policy. Perhaps Obama administration caved considers flawed election better election. That's reasonable view, one I share. It's conceivable Mr. Bashir could won quasi-fair election - oil revenues manifestly raised standard living parts Sudan - campaigning create space sharp criticism government. It's also true Sudan behaving better respects. UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05775058 Date: 08/31/2015 UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05775058 Date: 08/31/2015 The death toll Darfur hugely reduced, government negotiating rebel groups there. The Sudanese government gave visa travel permits Darfur, allowing travel legally freely. The real game isn't, fact, Darfur elections maneuvering possible new civil war. The last north-south civil war Sudan ended fragile peace 2005, two million deaths. The peace agreement provided referendum, scheduled take place January, southern Sudanese decide whether secede. They expected vote overwhelmingly form separate country. Then question becomes: north allow South Sudan separate? The south holds great majority country's oil, it's difficult see President Bashir allowing oil fields walk away. "If result referendum independence, going war - complete war," predicts Mudawi Ibrahim Adam, one Sudan's outspoken human rights advocates. He cautions America's willingness turn blind eye election-rigging increases risk Mr. Bashir feel get away war. "They're naïve Washington," Mr. Mudawi said. "They don't understand going on." On hand, senior Sudanese government official, Ghazi Salahuddin, told unequivocally Khartoum, nation's capital, Sudan honor referendum results. And it's certainly plausible north south muddle avoid war, sides exhausted years fighting. Here Juba, South Sudan capital, I met Winnie Wol, 26, fled civil war 1994 militia north attacked village kill, loot, rape burn. Her father many relatives killed, escaped made way Kenya - eventually resettled refugee California. She lives Olathe, Kan., returned first time Sudan visit mother sisters last seen little girl. Ms. Wol, every bit well-dressed American, let tag along journey back village Nyamlell, 400 miles northwest Juba. The trip ended thatch-roof belonged mother, didn't know coming - one home. Ms. Wol crushed. Then scream woman came running. It Ms. Wol's mother, somehow recognizing her, flew •into other's arms. To me, felt like peace dividend. Yet peace fragile, Ms. Wol knows northern forces may come back pillage again. "I don't want war," said, "but I don't think allow us separate." My hunch north hasn't entirely decided do, strong international pressure reduce risk another savage war. If President Obama ever going find voice Sudan, better soon. UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05775183 Date: 08/31/2015 UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05775183 Date: 08/31/2015 The plan includes creation Interim Haitian Recovery Commission -- first time -- seek guide aid spent giving Haitians foreigners vote reconstruction priorities projects next 18 months. Haiti's president retain veto power there's starring role former U.S. President Bill Clinton wants it. The blueprint certain come plenty scrutiny Haiti, country plagued in-fighting among donors. Over years, billions dollars aid -- often delivered hurricanes political coups -- failed produce signs lasting progress country remains poorest Western Hemisphere. Clinton, visit Haiti Monday along former President George W. Bush, asked help lead Haiti's reconstruction planning short-term co-chair -- along Haitian prime minister -- commission, several sources confirmed The Miami Herald. Clinton, already charge international relief effort United Nations, said whether he'll accept job Haiti's reconstruction czar championed strategy, saying goal provide Haitians success long eluded them.He Bush visiting Haiti, 200,000 people killed quake, roles co-chairs Clinton Bush Haiti Fund. The private U.S. fundraising effort, initiated President Obama, raised $36 million. The commission's goal plan coordinate reconstruction priorities projects next 18 months recommendations 20-member board made Haitians foreign donors. Eventually, commission would morph Haiti Development Authority (HDA), central planning agency tasked approving reconstruction projects Haiti regardless country aid agency funding it. The authority's executive director, like commission, likely would well-respected Haitian. "Haitians must chance lead rebuilding Haiti," said U.S. Secretary State Hillary Clinton's chief staff Cheryl Mills, key person talks. "Development authorities helped countries large donor communities accomplish visions -- want less Haiti citizens." The original plan, first reported The Herald last month, modeled successful reconstruction authority created Indonesia 2004 tsunami presented Mills Preval top Haitian officials last month. Other countries multilateral institutions also presented plans Haitian government. The U.S. plan since undergone several revisions Prevails urging. Among them: offering voting seat commission's board donor pledging $100 million next two years donors provide $200 million debt cancellation. As result, Venezuela among likely donors help review approve projects. Initially 16 members, board expanded give say-so Haiti's private sector labor unions 15-nation sub-regional Caribbean Community (CARCIOM). The plan also establishes Multi-donor Trust Fund, administered World Bank, possibly pool donors' dollars reconstruction projects. For decades, Haiti plagued lack planning coordination among donor nations aid groups battled among poverty-stricken country. Using Indonesian model employed Indonesia Asian tsunami, plan supporters say reconstruction commission offers Haiti best chance lead redevelopment change way donors business, ending era aid groups spend budgets larger Haitian ministries without accountability Haitian people. But achieved Haiti, say supporters, donors projects coordinated, line Haiti's vision post-disaster reconstruction needs, presented March 31 New York conference UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05775183 Date: 08/31/2015 UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05775183 Date: 08/31/2015 remains work progress government seeks input various Haitian groups, including Diaspora. Also Haiti's parliament must vote creation Interim Haitian Recovery Commission. Still, idea putting Haiti's reconstruction hands one central authority -- donors channel money trust fund -- without detractors. Some argue authority could render government ministries obsolete projects would bypass them, others point similar World Bank fund Sudan troubled rules leaving schools healthcare facilities undone hundreds millions dollars remain unspent. Meanwhile, Haitian government officials worry donors may want change way business Haiti, rendering reconstruction failure gets started. "The creation [trust fund] [Haiti Development Authority] improvements changing paradigm everybody plays game -- putting money fund -- access funds flexible usual process disbursing international donors," Haitian Prime Minister Jean-Max Bellerive told The Herald. In past, donors pledged hundreds millions dollars assist Haiti fallen short disbursing dollars -- times spent money projects without consulting Haitian government whether projects needed. Begin Text: National elections Sudan month represent major milestone Comprehensive Peace Agreement ended Sudan's twenty-two year civil war, important opportunity people Sudan participate political process. We urge parties Sudan work urgently ensure elections proceed peacefully credibly April. We deeply concerned reports continued administrative logistical challenges, well restrictions political freedoms. We call Government Sudan, National Elections Commission, political parties engage dialogue resolve practical obstacles, procedural impediments, address allegations intimidation, harassment, safety concerns, legitimate concerns raised various political parties. We continue urge parties improve conditions ground Darfur create secure environment conducive Darfuri participation. Irrespective outcome elections, essential work continues accelerated meet remaining CPA deadlines. Progress needed urgently complete border demarcation, establish commissions supervise referenda South Abyei, conduct popular consultations Blue Nile Southern Kordofan, negotiate sustainable post-CPA arrangements areas wealth-sharing, citizenship assets, liabilities. We reiterate commitment ensure referenda must happen schedule outcomes need respected. It time redouble efforts achieve ends. We urge parties Sudan regional international partners work together achieve peaceful future people Sudan deserve. UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05775305 Date: 08/31/2015 UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05775305 Date: 08/31/2015 The lack strong national security adviser created recurring difficulties. Perhaps best example Arab- Israeli peace process, Mr Obama launched second day office appointed George Mitchell envoy. Three months later, Mr Obama insisted Benjamin Netanyahu freeze settlements activity order boost Arab confidence talks. In heated showdown Oval Office last May, Mr Netanyahu refused accede Mr Obama's demand, officials present Mr Emanuel David Axelrod, senior adviser Mr Obama office campaign. Gen Jones there. "The question is, bright spark advised president demand settlements freeze without working next step Netanyahu inevitably said 'No'?" says Leslie Gelb, official Carter administration former head Council Foreign Relations. "Why wasn't George Mitchell room? Where Jones?"Mr Obama's character also stamped inter-agency process, set managed Tom Donilon, deputy national security adviser. The nitty-gritty foreign policy-making done frequent "deputies' meetings", sometimes consume four six hours day. Described one insider "the powerful man White House whose name isn't widely known", Mr Donilon, official Clinton administration, man keeps Mr Obama's trains running time. And lot trains. Last year, Mr Donilon held 270 deputies meetings — workload described "clinically insane" former senior diplomat Bill Clinton. But time goes on, becoming streamlined — taking roughly two three hours day, say officials. "People forget inherited two wars, terrorism threats, perhaps biggest single eight-year decline [George W. Unlike predecessor Richard Nixon, turned Henry Kissinger advice, US president big foreign policy strategist For better worse, Washington grown used fact Barack Obama <http://www.ft.com/indepth/obama-presidency> runs centralised — "White House-centric" — UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05775307 Date: 08/31/2015 UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05775307 Date: 08/31/2015 administration since Richard Nixon. When Nixon wanted foreign policy advice, everyone knew got from: Henry Kissinger, variously national security adviser secretary state. In contrast, Mr Obama big foreign policy strategist. Even insiders give different answers asked turns advice big international questions. But almost agree following observation. "The truth President Obama Henry Kissinger — one else plays role," says senior official. "Every administration reflects personality president. This president wants trains routed Oval Office." Fifteen months took office, character structure Mr Obama's foreign policy machinery still evolving. But interviews dozens insiders outsiders, including senior officials authorised unauthorised speak, three former national security advisers, clear buck stops with, often floats quite long time around, Mr Obama himself. Foreigners complained tendency domestic agenda crowd international one — passage last week healthcare reform <http://www.ft.com/indepth/us-healthcare-reform> greeted audible sigh relief among US allies. But within foreign policy itself, centralised structure also result many issues left back burner awaiting presidential attention, say critics. "On positive side, conscientious president takes advice widely," says official. "On debit side, president's intelligence, Barack Obama came office little experience. He doesn't much depth issues." The core Mr Obama's foreign policy machinery White House-based National Security Council, advises president co-ordinates activities across increasingly complex alphabet soup Washington departments, military commands intelligence agencies. The widely questioned link chain Jim Jones <http://www.ft.com/cms/s/Oc0c8c5a-c002-11dd-9222-0000779fdl8c.html> , whom, many people's surprise, Mr Obama brought national security adviser. Only briefly acquainted Mr Obama beforehand, General Jones, retired four-star marine corps general, shows little interest running "inter-agency" process— key part job. Somewhat unconventionally, Gen Jones travels frequently thus often town. Unusually, Mr Obama usually chairs weekly National Security Council, known "principals meeting", Gen Jones. Rahm Emanuel, Mr Obama's chief staff, also key part it. "If ask real national security adviser is, I would say three four, Rahm one Gen Jones probably least important," says another official. Anyone dealt Gen Jones speaks highly matter-of-factness, geniality respect many foreign governments — Pakistan Israel among them. But admitted rather disarmingly last year, taste bureaucracy. Speaking Atlantic Council, think-tank previously worked, Gen Jones provoked laughter said: "I fondly remember [the Atlantic Council] place people actually asked do. In new role I'm finding order basis negotiation." The lack strong national security adviser created recurring difficulties. Perhaps best example Arab- Israeli peace process, Mr Obama launched second day office appointed George Mitchell <http://www.ft.com/cms/s/0/b904d928-29ef-ildf-b940-00144feabdc0.htrni> envoy. Three months later, Mr Obama insisted Benjamin Netanyahu freeze settlements activity order boost Arab confidence talks. In heated showdown Oval Office <http://www.ft.com/cms/s/1.59f9c90-43e1-11de-a9be-00144feabdc0.html> last May, Mr Netanyahu refused accede Mr Obama's demand, officials present Mr Emanuel David Axelrod, senior adviser Mr Obama office campaign. Gen Jones there. The fallout put talks abeyance damped high Arab hopes Mr Obama. "The question is, bright spark advised president demand settlements freeze without working next step Netanyahu inevitably said 'No'?" says Leslie Gelb, official Carter administration former head Council Foreign Relations. "Why wasn't George Mitchell room? Where Jones?" Mr Obama's character also stamped inter-agency process, set managed Tom Donilon, deputy national security adviser. The nitty-gritty foreign policy-making done frequent "deputies' meetings", sometimes consume four six hours day. Described one insider "the powerful man White House whose name isn't widely known", Mr Donilon, official Clinton administration, man keeps Mr Obama's trains running time. And lot trains. Last year, Mr Donilon held 270 deputies meetings — workload described "clinically insane" former senior diplomat Bill Clinton. Subject: Re: Preval rejects US Advice Presidential election respond Lugar's report 1.4(D) B1 Original Message From: Mills, Cheryl D <MillsCD@state.gov> To: H Sent: Thu Jul 01 05:44:51 2010 Subject: Fw: Preval rejects US Advice Presidential election respond Lugar's report From: Guy Noel B6 To: Mills, Cheryl D Sent: Wed Jun 30 22:44:31 2010 Subject: Preval rejects US Advice Presidential election respond Lugar's report A PALI PAPA..PONYET PREVAL GONFLE Preval rejects US advice presidential election By JONATHAN M. KATZ (AP) — 2 hours ago PORT-AU-PRINCE, Haiti — Haiti's president Wednesday rejected U.S. Senate recommendations holding election successor, brushing criticism current process leave shattered country without credible leader. A report issued month Sen. Richard Lugar, ranking Republican U.S. Senate Foreign Relations Committee, "strongly encourages" Haiti let international partners help restructure eight-member Provisional Electoral Council, accused corruption. The report also recommends ensuring participation key opposition party ousted former President Jean- Bertrand Aristide, blocked participating 2009 legislative contests dispute rival candidate lists. On Tuesday, President Rene Preval fulfilled one recommendation report issuing signed decree setting election day Nov. 28. But speaking news conference open-air gazebo alongside broken remains national palace day later, Preval told reporters intention complying rest, including changing election body, known CEP. "I'm CEP international partners. I'm CEP national partners," Preval said. "The senator's proposition inadmissible." Seeking show council "hand-picked," said English, Preval handed copies nomination letters panel's members submitted various national religious organizations, including National Council Political Parties, Roman Catholic Church National Confederation Haitian Vodou. UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05775309 Date: 08/31/2015 UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05775309 Date: 08/31/2015 He also defended prohibition exiled Aristide's Fanmi Lavalas party last year's elections, ban came rival factions party submitted competing lists candidates. "International donors need look accord CEP political parties factions Fanmi Lavalas," Preval said. "We giving (the parties) support need, factions need figure (for themselves)." Preval discuss forced resignation electoral council member accused stealing staffer's pay opponents' allegations council gave special privileges president's newly formed Unity Party ahead planned Feb. 28 legislative elections, postponed Jan. 12 earthquake devastated capital. He also declined answer questions another U.S. Senate Foreign Relations Committee report criticizes Haiti's earthquake recovery, saying would address issue news conference reconstruction next week. Elections never easy Haiti, country whose founding president crowned emperor. It took 186 years hold international community considered democratic election 1990, closely followed coup d'etat. Preval, fact, Haitian ever elected president, serve full term hand power elected successor. Unable run re-election November contest, pledged relinquish power 1990s — protesters alleged earlier year dragging feet holding presidential election. Doing require significant help. The electoral council's headquarters destroyed records lost quake, millions voters either killed, made homeless displaced. Its new headquarters former Gold's Gym seized drug agents. The election also cost burden grindingly poor Caribbean nation: $29 million according electoral officials news conference Preval, $38 million according U.S. Senate report. The Organization American States United Nations pledged support. U.N. Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon issued statement Wednesday praising decree setting election date pledged help U.N. peacekeepers advisers preparing supporting ballot. Ban urged member states quickly provide money needed run vote. Copyright © 2010 The Associated Press. All rights reserved. Op-Ed Contributor Germany Need Dream By JOHN KORNBLUM Has Germany abandoned Europe? Do Angela Merkel's tough conditions aid Greece mean Germany longer motor European integration? Has Frau Merkel fact morphed Miss Europa 2007 Fraulein Germania 2010, Germany's former foreign minister Joschka Fischer suggested? As former American ambassador lived worked better part four decades around Germany, Blackberry often glows red hot messages persons asking questions. My response always same: Germany changed little, Europe world changed lot. Therein lies dilemma. Germany worked hard dig way disaster 1945, trauma remains defining issue German society. Sixty five years later, Germany still focused three essentials recovery: stability, respectability peace. Keep triangle mind lots things quickly come focus. From first days Federal Republic, Germany's leaders emphasized importance defining interests solely within common European Atlantic vocation. But also understood renouncing national ambitions remove responsibility pursue specific German goals common institutions. Many important postwar accomplishments conceived pushed Germany, sometimes opposition others — including United States. Ostpolitik controversial years, NATO enlargement. Germany pushed determination. UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05775510 Date: 08/31/2015 UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05775510 Date: 08/31/2015 Helmut Kohl consult promulgating 10 points reunification. He agreed French desires common currency, could mirror Deutsche mark, decades European monetary standard. The euro stability pact, object much controversy Greece, result. After 1990, E.U.'s eastward expansion Germany's way firming Eastern flank. Slowly without fanfare, Germany remaking European Union image. At step way, Germany made wishes palatable paying share. Part today's misunderstanding caused Germany's success using contributions build image selflessness. Germany single-minded pursuit goals Charles de Gaulle ever his, almost always left leadership others. A new consciousness grew costs reunification began mount. "Europe" institutional sense become increasingly unpopular. German courts begun define German European issues context German Constitution rather basis E.U. law. At least Ms. Merkel's refusal allow immediate assistance Greece based fears would fan anti-E.U. sentiment home. Are first signs German Tea Party? Here find source hand wringing Germany's role "motor Europe." Ms. Merkel's unwillingness sweeten financial pot echoed throughout Brussels. To many, signified decline German willingness "salute French flag three times raising German flag," Konrad Adenauer used put it. Germans alone objecting throwing money E.U. pot, happen ones something it. Many fear without German complaisance, E.U. stutter stop. But self- denial could never offer viable foundation new Europe. Neither could inefficiency even corruption characterizes many E.U. programs. Most maddening thinking Europeans knowledge Germans right. But them, question whether Germany remaking E.U. fashion palatable majority member states. They sure focus stability accountability right way help diverse collection peoples adjust globalized world. And Angela Merkel raps Greek knuckles, sending message Europeans don't want hear. Not Germany dangerous; even worse, unrelenting. The Neue Zuricher Zeitung probably spoke many others accused Germany wanting Europe become large Switzerland. The growing gap Germany's aspirations perceived needs members E.U. beginning burden sides. Most Europeans simply ready live German standards. Without flexible sense common purpose, project build democratic Europe could stop dead water. But Germans often tell you: They forgotten dream. Younger Germans feel lack inspiration well. Dreams 200,000 waiting hear rallied hear Barack Obama Berlin two summers ago. They wanted "Dare Hope," characteristically timid German translation title president's best seller. And still waiting. America seems busy elsewhere. The main conclusion I draw debate Germany Germany all. The task building democratic Europe far complete. Most foundations laid residents starting haggle design. Weaving today's 27 states true trans-Atlantic partnership task big Germany even Europe accomplish alone. They desperately need skilled architectural assistance. Uniting Europe North America audacious project ever conceived. If works, United States joined nearly 500 million Europeans form democratic space, within modern democratic values harness energy single nation earth. Democracy's future operating system globalized world assured. European fecklessness seems worry Washington officials days. But Germany forgotten dream United States busy try, guilty perpetuating aimlessness criticize. To hold side bargain, Europe needs exactly Barack Obama originally promised — audacity hope. In many cases, so-called "false positives": non- combatants murdered later presented members armed groups killed combat. These, notes <http://www.extrajudicialexecutions.org/colombia> UN Special Rapporter Extrajudicial Executions Philip Alston, "began occurring disturbing frequency across Colombia 2004." Citing prosecutors' NGOs' reports, Alston indicates Colombia's security forces may killed 1,486 civilians first six years Alvaro Uribe's presidency. Alston notes Defense Ministry began address situation media broke story false-positives subsequent negative publicity horrified public outcry. The prosecution "false positives" moving excruciating slowness. In perhaps notorious case — murders twenty young men poor Bogota suburb Soacha — nearly accused soldiers officers released prison <http://www.ipsnews.net/news.asp?idnews=49968>, pending trial, deadlines timely prosecution run out. Since arrest late 2008, case prolonged numerous delaying tactics defense, including attempts cases tried military court system "acts service." Meanwhile efforts reform dissolve DAS stalled Colombia's Congress. President Uribe's political coalition also hit scandal known Colombia "para-politics." This • coalition included dozens political bosses regions beyond capital. Many large landholders ties narcotrafficking, local leaders created fostered brutal pro-government paramilitary groups killed tens thousands non-combatants 1990s early 2000s. Evidence, much former paramilitary leaders, brought 300 criminal investigations legislators, governors, mayors local officials, nearly Alvaro Uribe's political supporters, made common cause far-right warlords. Those embroiled parapolitics include President's cousin, Mario Uribe; brother former foreign minister; individuals President named Colombia's ambassadors Chile, Dominican Republic, Canada. Putin Tags Polar Bear Russia's Arctic Russian Prime Minister Helps Scientists Track Endangered Species, Calls Removal Russian Prime Minister Vladimir Putin, right, fixes radio beacon neck polar bear, anaesthetized, visit research institute Franz Josef Land archipelago Arctic Ocean Thursday. (AP Photo/RIA Novosti, pool) (AP) Updated 1:29 p.m. ET Prime Minister Vladimir Putin played eco-warrior Russia's Arctic Thursday, helping scientists track endangered polar bears calling cleanup region. Putin traveled Franz Josef Land, archipelago Arctic Ocean northwest coast Russia's mainland latest display adventuring prowess highlight country's guardianship resource-rich region. UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05775607 Date: 08/31/2015 UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05775607 Date: 08/31/2015 Wearing bright red coat cap, 57-year-old premier kneeled head tranquilized polar bear attach satellite-tracking collar, helped elevate beast weighing. The images broadcast nationally. Putin helped measure bear roll onto side. On departure, shook paw uttered words: "Be well." "The paw heavy. This master Arctic, feel straight away," Putin said. Of total 25,000 polar bears remaining wild, 6,000 Russia's Arctic territory, Russian news agencies quoted officials saying. Putin also called "a general cleanup Arctic," ordering removal thousands barrels fuel buried snow left unused Soviet-era military base. He spearheading Russia's re-emergence regional power, including country's claims Arctic's formidable natural resources. Some 90 billion barrels oil one-third world's undiscovered natural gas lie hidden Arctic region, U.S. Geological Survey estimates. "Geopolitically, Russia's deepest interests linked Arctic," Putin said. "Here Russia's security defense capabilities provided for. Here vitally important transport communications." Canada, U.S., Russia Denmark competing claims United Nations commission regarding extend undersea boundaries areas previously blocked Arctic ice. Moscow dramatically staked claim region dropping flag ocean floor North Pole 2007. Since then, four countries agreed cool rhetoric allow scientists finish surveys. Putin adores media spotlight accentuates macho side. He photographed fishing bare-chested Russia's Altai region, shown television diving icy river swimming butterfly stroke. He also tackled predators wild before, shooting tiger tranquilizer gun releasing leopards. UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05775607 Date: 08/31/2015

Original Message From: Lanny Davis To: H Sent: Thu Jun 10 14:36:23 2010 Subject: To Turkish PM Erdogan: Time Consider Facts If trouble viewing message, please go http://com mu n ity.icontact.com/p/wwwla nnyjdaviscominewslettersiblogs/posts/to-tu rkish-pm-erdogan-time-to- consider-all-the-facts Purple Nation June 10, 2010 To Turkish PM Erdogan: Time Consider Facts By Lanny J. Davis http://thehill.com/opinion/columnists/lanny-davis/102357-message-to-turkish-pm-erdogan When several years ago I first met Turkish Prime Minister Recep Tayyip Erdogan pleasure two private conversations him, immediately struck ultimate "purple" leader. As The Washington Post wrote recently, "Erdogan's Justice Development Party religious roots, also draws conservative entrepreneurs liberals free-market policies." But Erdogan recently appeared hostile Israel, also U.S. — flirting Holocaust denier Mahmoud Ahmadinejad undermining (apparently unintentionally) world's efforts prevent Iran developing nuclear weapon. Concerning recent flotilla incident, question Israel made serious mistakes planning, intelligence execution onboard deaths horrible tragic. But Erdogan's harsh criticism struck many people, even friends Turkey, way top, ignoring basic facts. So I ask Prime Minister Erdogan, I still believe good heart wants right thing, assume faced following purely hypothetical facts leader country: Suppose years Greek Cypriots shooting rockets intentionally aimed Turkish Cypriot civilians, causing many deaths injuries, result, Turkey instituted blockade, insisting searching ships armaments; Suppose learned flotilla ships leaving Greek ports destined Greek Cyprus, called "Free Turkish Cyprus" flotilla sponsored Greek organization leaders hostile Turkey associations anti-Turkish terrorist organization; UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05775652 Date: 08/31/2015 UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05775652 Date: 08/31/2015 Suppose ordered ships inspected armaments leaders ships refused, soldiers boarding ships accosted people pipes, iron bars long knives, putting Turkish soldiers mortal danger; soldiers, seeing brothers sisters danger, reacted instinctively shooting live ammunition, tragically killing nine people, members organization linked anti- Turkish terrorist organization. Mr. Prime Minister: If true — fact, "hypotheticals" precisely tracks circumstances Israel faced — would Turkey done? Now, Turkish colleagues may argue big difference Israel "occupying" West Bank. Oh, really? An awful lot Greeks much rest world believe, rightly wrongly, Turkey occupying one- half Cyprus military invasion years ago. I know fellow Turks feel Turkey intervened protect Turk Cypriots. A lot Turkish Muslims somehow believe religious sacrilege Israel "occupying" holy sites East Jerusalem West Bank. Oh, really? Tens millions Orthodox Christians throughout Russia, Greece, Romania Eastern Europe would remind 1453, Turks occupied holiest site Orthodox Christendom — Holy Agia Sophia Church, Orthodox Christians St. Peter's Vatican Roman Catholics — also continue day desecrate site, Turkey retains museum, priceless religious frescoes obscenely painted icons smashed, refuse allow restoration Agia Sophia Orthodox Church. Compare Turks Agia Sophia Israel's protection sanctity guaranteed absolute access Muslims holy sites ancient Temple Mount al-Aqsa Mosque facing Mecca Dome Rock ever since Israel regained control Jerusalem 1967. These facts, Mr. Prime Minister. Do deny them? I hoping discover entire truth risks Israel's safety security represented Gaza-bound ships, recognize Turkey's history role occupier free criticism, find way re-engage prior friendship relationship Israel, especially regard peace process, open discussions Israeli leaders, I know appreciated constructive role played years. Even publicly cannot this, I hoping privately — would consistent impression man I came know admire two meetings. I hope pray so, world doesn't lose peacemaker Middle East elsewhere. This piece appears today, June 10, 2010, Mr. Davis's regular weekly column The Hill "Purple Nation" "The Daily Caller" online political website. Mr. Davis, Washington firm, Lanny J. Davis & Associates PLLC, served special counsel President Bill Clinton 1996-98 member President George W. Bush's Privacy Civil Liberties Oversight Board 2006-07. He author Scandal: How "Gotcha" Politics Is Destroying America (Palgrave MacMillan 2006). This message sent by: Lanny J. In speech Riyadh diplomats, Turki said US-led NATO troops irrevocably alienated Afghan people • hope rebuilding country. "What Afghanistan needs shift nation-building effectively countering terrorists," Turki told Arab News conference. US President Barack Obama "should misdirected believing fix Afghanistan's ills military means." "Hunt terrorists sides Afghan-Pakistan border, arrest kill them, get out, let Afghan people deal problems. "As long GI boots remain Afghan soil, remain targets resistance Afghan people ideological mercenaries." Turki, long served central role Saudi-Afghan relations, scolded Washington's handling relations Kabul. "The inept way administration dealt President (Hamid) Karzai beggars disbelief amazement. "Both sides filled resentment sour taste mouths," said. "How get situation? I don't know." Sid http://www.nybooks.com/articles/archives/2010/jun/10/failure-american-jewish-establishment/ The Failure American Jewish Establishment June 10, 2010 <http://www.nybooks.com/issues/2010/jun/10/> Peter Beinart <http://www.nybooks.com/contributors/peter-beinart/> E-mail <http://www.nybooks.com/mail_friend/5/23934/> Single Page <http://www.nybooks.com/articles/archives/2010/jun/10/failure-american-jewish-establishment/?Pagination=false> Share <http://www.addthis.com/bookmark.php> More Peter Beinart <http://www.nybooks.com/contributors/peter-beinart/> <http://www.nybooks.com/galleries/john-springs-illustrator/2009/jun/11/benjamin-netanyahu/> Benjamin Netanyahu; drawing John Springs In 2003, several prominent Jewish philanthropists hired Republican pollster Frank Luntz explain American Jewish college students vigorously rebutting campus criticism Israel. In response, unwittingly produced damning indictment organized American Jewish community I ever seen. The philanthropists wanted know Jewish students thought Israel. Luntz found mostly didn't. "Six times brought Jewish youth together group talk Jewishness connection Israel," reported. "Six times topic Israel come prompted. Six times Jewish youth used word 'they' rather `us' describe situation." That Luntz encountered indifference surprising. In recent years, several studies revealed, words Steven Cohen Hebrew Union College Ari Kelman University California bavis, "non-Orthodox younger Jews, whole, feel much less attached Israel elders," many professing "a near-total absence positive feelings." In 2008, student senate Brandeis, nonsectarian Jewish-sponsored university America, rejected resolution commemorating sixtieth anniversary Jewish state. UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05775710 Date: 08/31/2015 UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05775710 Date: 08/31/2015 Luntz's task figure gone wrong. When probed students' views Israel, hit firm beliefs. First, "they reserve right question Israeli position." These young Jews, Luntz explained, "resist anything see 'group think." They want "open frank" discussion Israel flaws. Second, "young Jews desperately want peace." When Luntz showed series ads, one popular entitled "Proof Israel Wants Peace," listed offers various Israeli governments withdraw conquered land. Third, "some empathize plight Palestinians." When Luntz displayed ads depicting Palestinians violent hateful, several focus group participants criticized stereotypical unfair, citing Muslim friends. Most students, words, liberals, broadly defined. They imbibed defining values American Jewish political culture: belief open debate, skepticism military force, commitment human rights. And innocence, realize supposed shed values came Israel. The kind Zionism found attractive Zionism recognized Palestinians deserving dignity capable peace, quite willing condemn Israeli government share beliefs. Luntz grasp irony. The kind Zionism found attractive kind American Jewish establishment working lives. Among American Jews today, great many Zionists, especially Orthodox world, people deeply devoted State Israel. And great many liberals, especially secular Jewish world, people deeply devoted human rights people, Palestinians included. But two groups increasingly distinct. Particularly younger generations, fewer fewer American Jewish liberals Zionists; fewer fewer American Jewish Zionists liberal. One reason leading institutions American Jewry refused foster—indeed, actively opposed—a Zionism challenges Israel's behavior West Bank Gaza Strip toward Arab citizens. For several decades, Jewish establishment asked American Jews check liberalism Zionism's door, now, horror, finding many young Jews checked Zionism instead. Morally, American Zionism downward spiral. If leaders groups like AIPAC Conference Presidents Major American Jewish Organizations change course, wake one day find younger, Orthodox- dominated, Zionist leadership whose naked hostility Arabs Palestinians scares even them, mass secular American Jews range apathetic appalled. Saving liberal Zionism United States—so American Jews help save liberal Zionism Israel—is great American Jewish challenge age. And starts Luntz's students wanted start: talking frankly Israel's current government, longer averting eyes. Since 1990s, journalists scholars describing bifurcation Israeli society. In words Hebrew University political scientist Yaron Ezrahi, "After decades came called national consensus, Zionist narrative liberation [has] dissolved openly contesting versions." One version, "founded long memory persecution, genocide, bitter struggle survival, pessimistic, distrustful non-Jews, believing Jewish power solidarity." Another, "nourished secularized versions messianism well Enlightenment idea progress," articulates "a deep sense limits military force, commitment liberal-democratic values." Every country manifests kind ideological divide. But contemporary Israel, gulf among widest earth. As Ezrahi others noted, latter, liberal-democratic Zionism grown alongside new individualism, particularly among secular Israelis, greater demand free expression, greater skepticism coercive authority. You see spirit "new historians" like Tom Segev fearlessly excavated darker corners Zionist past jurists like former Supreme Court President Aharon Barak overturned Knesset laws violate human rights guarantees Israel's "Basic Laws." You also see former Prime Minister Ehud Barak's apparent willingness relinquish much West Bank 2000 early 2001. But Israel today, humane, universalistic Zionism wield power. To contrary, gasping air. To understand deeply antithetical values Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's government, it's worth considering case Effi Eitam. Eitam, charismatic ex–cabinet minister war hero, proposed ethnically cleansing Palestinians West Bank. "We'll expel overwhelming majority West Bank Arabs remove Israeli Arabs [the] political system," declared 2006. In 2008, Eitam merged small Ahi Party Netanyahu's Likud. And 2009-2010 academic year, Netanyahu's special emissary overseas "campus engagement." In capacity, visited dozen American high schools colleges last fall Israeli government's behalf. The group organized tour called "Caravan Democracy." Israeli Foreign Minister Avigdor Lieberman shared Eitam's views. In youth, briefly joined Meir Kahane's banned Kach Party, also advocated expulsion Arabs Israeli soil. Now Lieberman's position might called "pre-expulsion." Israeli governments come go, Netanyahu coalition product frightening, long-term trends Israeli society: ultra-Orthodox population increasing dramatically, settler movement growing radical entrenched Israeli bureaucracy army, Russian immigrant community particularly prone anti-Arab racism. In 2009, poll Israel Democracy Institute found 53 percent Jewish Israelis (and 77 percent recent immigrants former USSR) support encouraging Arabs leave country. Attitudes worst among Israel's young. When Israeli high schools held mock elections last year, Lieberman won. This March, poll found 56 percent Jewish Israeli high school students—and 80 percent religious Jewish high school students—would deny Israeli Arabs right elected Knesset. An education ministry official called survey "a huge warning signal light strengthening trends extremist views among youth." You might think trends, sympathy expressed Israel's government, would occasion substantial public concern—even outrage—among leaders organized American Jewry. You would wrong. UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05775710 Date: 08/31/2015 UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05775710 Date: 08/31/2015 These American Zionists largely product particular era. These Jews embraced Zionism settler movement became major force Israeli politics, 1982 Lebanon war, first intifada. They fell love Israel secular, less divided, less shaped culture, politics, theology occupation. And downplaying significance Avigdor Lieberman, settlers, Shas, American Jewish groups allow older Zionists continue identify internally cohesive, innocent Israel youth, Israel exists memories. But secular Zionists aren't reproducing themselves. Their children memory Arab armies massed Israel's border Israel surviving part thanks urgent military assistance United States. Instead, grown viewing Israel regional hegemon occupying power. As result, conscious parents degree Israeli behavior violates liberal ideals, less willing grant Israel exemption survival seems peril. Because inherited parents' liberalism, cannot embrace uncritical Zionism. Because liberalism real, see liberalism American Jewish establishment fake. To sustain uncritical brand Zionism, therefore, America's Jewish organizations need look elsewhere replenish ranks. They need find young American Jews come age West Bank occupation troubled it. And young American Jews come disproportionately Orthodox world. Because marry earlier, intermarry less, children, Orthodox Jews growing rapidly share American Jewish population. According 2006 American Jewish Committee (AJC) survey, Orthodox Jews make 12 percent American Jewry age sixty, constitute 34 percent ages eighteen twenty-four. For America's Zionist organizations, Orthodox youngsters potential bonanza. In yeshivas learn devotion Israel early age; generally spend year religious study high school, often know friends relatives immigrated Israel. The AJC study found 16 percent non-Orthodox adult Jews age forty feel "very close Israel," among Orthodox figure 79 percent. As secular Jews drift away America's Zionist institutions, Orthodox counterparts likely step breach. The Orthodox "are still interested parochial Jewish concerns," explains Samuel Heilman, sociologist City University New York. "They among last ones stayed Jewish house, control lights." But parochialism—a deep commitment Jewish concerns, often outweighs universal ones— gives Orthodox Jewish Zionism distinctly illiberal cast. The 2006 AJC poll found 60 percent non- Orthodox American Jews age forty support Palestinian state, figure drops 25 percent among Orthodox. In 2009, Brandeis University's Theodore Sasson asked American Jewish focus groups Israel, found Orthodox participants much less supportive dismantling settlements part peace deal. Even tellingly, Reform, Conservative, unaffiliated Jews tended believe average Palestinians wanted peace, ill-served leaders. Orthodox Jews, contrast, likely see Palestinian people enemy, deny ordinary Palestinians shared common interests values ordinary Israelis Jews. Orthodox Judaism great virtues, including communal warmth commitment Jewish learning unmatched American Jewish world. (I'm biased, since family attends Orthodox synagogue.) But current trends continue, growing influence Orthodox Jews America's Jewish communal institutions erode even liberal- democratic veneer today covers American Zionism. In 2002, America's major Jewish organizations sponsored large Israel solidarity rally Washington Mall. Up east coast, yeshivas shut day, swelling estimated Orthodox share crowd close 70 percent. When Deputy Secretary Defense Paul Wolfowitz told rally "innocent Palestinians suffering dying well," booed. America's Jewish leaders think hard rally. Unless change course, portends future: American Zionist movement even feign concern Palestinian dignity broader American Jewish population even feign concern Israel. My children, given upbringing, could easily end among booers among Luntz's focus group. Either prospect fills dread. KOUCHNER Le Monde re Internet freedom fyi From: Ross, Alec To: Steinberg, James B; Rivkin, Charles H; Mills, Cheryl D; Kennard, William E; Sullivan, Jacob J; Slaughter, Anne-Marie; Hormats, Robert D; Otero, Maria; Burns, William J; Cohen, Jared A Sent: Tue May 18 17:40:17 2010 Subject: B. KOUCHNER Le Monde re Internet freedom The Kouchner worth reading haven't seen it. The Internet: critical international policy issue, Bernard Kouchner (May 10, 2010) In 2015, three half billion people - half mankind - access Internet. There never revolution freedom communication freedom expression. But new medium used? What new distortions obstacles enemies Internet come with? Modern technology leads best worst. Extremist, racist defamatory websites blogs disseminate odious opinions real time. They made Internet weapon war hate. Websites attacked Internet users recruited chatrooms destructive plots. Violent movements infiltrating social networks spread propaganda false information. It hard democracies control them. I subscribe naïve belief new technology, however efficient powerful may be, bound nature advance liberty fronts. Yet, same, distortions exception rather rule. The Internet fantastic means breaking walls boundaries close us other. For oppressed peoples, deprived right self-expression right choose future, Internet provides power beyond wildest hopes. In minutes, news images recorded telephone disseminated UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05775744 Date: 08/31/2015 UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05775744 Date: 08/31/2015 worldwide cyberspace. It increasingly difficult hide public demonstration, act repression violation human rights. In authoritarian repressive countries, mobile telephones Internet given rise public opinion civil society. They also given citizens critical means expression, despite restrictions. However, temptation repress free expression always present. The number countries censor Internet, monitor web users punish opinions, increasing alarming rate. The Internet used citizens. It formidable intelligence-gathering tool spot potential dissidents. Some regimes already acquiring increasingly sophisticated surveillance technology. If attached human rights democracy refused compromise principles used Internet defend freedom expression, kind repression would much difficult. I talking absolute freedom opens door sorts abuses. Nobody promoting that. Instead, I'm talking real freedom, based principle respecting human dignity human rights. In last years, multilateral institutions, Council Europe, non-governmental organisations, Reporters Without Borders, along thousands individuals around world, made strong commitment issues. This proof, proof needed, issue pit West rest world. No fewer 180 countries meeting World Summit Information Society acknowledged Universal Declaration Human Rights applies fully Internet, especially Article 19, establishes freedom expression freedom opinion. And yet, fifty countries fail live commitments. For occasion World Press Freedom Day, I brought together experts, NGO leaders, journalists, business people intellectuals week. Their discussions confirmed conviction path want take right one. I think create international instrument monitoring commitments governments made calling task fail live them. I think provide assistance cyberdissidents, get support victims political repression, need show solidarity publicly, close collaboration NGOs working issues. I think also discuss wisdom adopting code conduct regarding export technologies censoring Internet tracking web users. These issues, along others, protection personal data Internet right digital amnesty everyone promoted colleague Nathalie Kosciusko-Morizet, addressed within framework brings together government, civil society international experts. Another project close heart. It long difficult task implement it, critical. It give Internet legal status reflects universality. One recognizes international space, difficult repressive governments use sovereignty argument fundamental freedoms. This critical issue. I think battle ideas started with, one side, advocates universal open Internet, based freedom expression freedom association, tolerance respect privacy and, side, want transform Internet multitude spaces closed serve purposes regime, propaganda forms fanaticism. Freedom expression "the foundation freedoms". Without it, "free nations", Voltaire said. This spirit Enlightenment, universal, run new media. The defence fundamental freedoms human rights must priority governance Internet. It everyone's business. UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05776078 Date: 08/31/2015 RELEASE IN PART B6 From: H <hrod17@clintonemail.com > Sent: Sunday, May 30, 2010 7:25 PM To: 'sberger Subject: Re: SRB op-ed Wash Post Outlook section Sunday Thanks clear fair analysis NSS. As know well, it's always easier said done. Happy Holiday Susan, Let's visit soon. All best, H Original Message From: Samuel Berger <sberger To: H Sent: Sat May 29 14:08:11 2010 Subject: FW: SRB op-ed Wash Post Outlook section Sunday HRC: Below ah oped National Security Strategy I wrote tomorrow's Outlook. Unfortunately, give horrible title, I think piece turned alright. Best, Sandy By Samuel R. Berger Samuel R. Berger, chair global strategy firm Albright Stonebridge Group, served national security advisor President Clinton 1997 2001. President Obama's National Security Strategy, released White House Thursday, tackles delicate unavoidable question: How respond new old security challenges era financial distress home reordering political power abroad? For time now, clear definition U.S. national security strategy needs rethinking. The September 11 attacks, global economic crisis, cyber-terror threats even environmental catastrophe Gulf underscore challenges America faces 2010 changed even decade ago. And America's military supremacy certainly risk, new international arrangements - shift G-7 club powerful nations G-20, incorporates emerging nations China Brazil - needed costs benefits stable international order shared. The United States cannot solve global threats without others, bear burden alone. Enter National Security Strategy. In experience, congressionally mandated documents easily become laborious impenetrable, mere compendiums bureaucratic pleading various parts government. (Make sure right Japan! Don't step Pentagon!) The challenge, President Clinton insisted upon advisers, provide strategic framework clarifying rest world informs UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05776078 Date: 08/31/2015 UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05776078 Date: 08/31/2015 administration decision makers line. It's blueprint action, means convey president's principles priorities. In Obama's case, new sober comprehensive 52-page strategy incorporates new realities breaks past strategies several key respects. But also reflects understanding face enduring challenges - nuclear proliferation, terrorism regional conflicts - best response return fundamentals. One fundamental strength economy. At time after-effects financial crisis fiscal burden two long wars raised fears overextended America, administration makes case economic technological renewal crucial underpinning U.S. security. The president made case West Point speech last weekend. "At time human history," said, "has nation diminished economic vitality maintained military political primacy." Another fundamental challenge arms control nuclear proliferation. By seeking strategic arms cuts Russia, president returned long bipartisan tradition languished prior administration. And convening global summit securing nuclear material spring, Obama given new urgency global purchase effort started 1991 Sens. Sam Nunn Richard Lugar first initiated program lock nuclear materials. On terrorism, strategy builds past, breaks well. Presidents Clinton, Bush Obama deployed America's tools: military power, homeland defense, law enforcement, sanctions, intelligence vigorous efforts cut terrorist financing. But critical difference Obama strategy rejects Global War Terror lens prior administration viewed challenge. "This global war tactic - terrorism - religion - Islam," new strategy says. "We war specific network, al-Qaeda terrorist affiliates." This sharper focus avoids alienating many Muslim world, ensures support key allies never accepted broader construct avoids overreactions led us forsake fight aI-Qaeda fight Afghanistan turn efforts unrelated threat Saddam Hussein's Iraq. In perhaps dramatic departure strategy predecessor, Obama administration restored less provocative policy use military force. In 2002 national security strategy, President Bush articulated rationale preemptive war weeks seeking U.N. resolution invade Iraq. The new strategy restores principles guided administrations decades: use force last resort, weigh costs benefits, much international support possible. The administration reserves right act unilaterally - example al-Qaeda allies - resurrects principle President Clinton often described "together possible, alone necessary." President Obama's critics focused diplomatic engagement hostile states like Iran North Korea. The President sets forth rationale: "to create opportunities resolve differences, strengthen international community's support actions, learn intentions nature closed regimes, plainly demonstrate public within nations governments blame isolation." In case Iran, Washington's outstretched hand resulted Iran's compliance. But attempts engage helped ensure world's attention focused Iran's intransigence rather Washington's refusal negotiate. UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05776078 Date: 08/31/2015 UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05776078 Date: 08/31/2015 Without doubt, gaps principle practice. Despite Obama administration's stated goal doubling exports next five years, put muscle behind trade agreements South Korea, Panama Colombia. And clarity call respect human rights times muted face tough realities. Sixteen months administration much progress, many true tests strategy lie ahead. In strategy's conclusions, Obama administration evokes even earlier era, calling political parties restore cooperation common purpose crucial success dark days Cold War. Despite intense debates time nuclear arms control, Central America détente, nearly American supported containment communism. In spirit, administration's framework deserves broad bipartisan support. We argue differences detention prisoners, methods disarm dangerous states, hard push democratic rights, costs climate change legislation. But time, rally around overriding U.S. foreign policy goals spelled strategy: renewing economy home ensure leadership abroad; defeating al-Qaeda; succeeding Afghanistan; preventing nuclear proliferation; curbing climate change; promoting international order enlightened self-interest, economic prosperity fundamental values upon America based.
